story:
Doomed Barbarian is a 60 page sword and sorcery in space with a punch line. From waste land planets run by magic to over populated planets consumed in tech . Doomed Barbarian and his six eyed techie friend Tugg are galactic bounty hunters looking to find adventure and make a few Bucks along the way. Have they bitten off more than they can chew rescuing a slave girl from one of the galaxies worst villain?

With Doomed Barbarian you will receive BarFight and Tales of the  Dead Knight mini-comics.

First 5 pages

 

 

 

BarFight  Six Page Mini Comic

Mini Comic Stretch Goal unlocked at $3k

If you ain't blastin' you aint lastin'!

About me.

My name is Gibran Redinger. This is a comic book that I spent the last 2 years putting together. I tattooed for ten years before leaving the shop to stay at home with the kids.  During my time at the tattoo shop I came across Jeff Lafferty, his Artcast, all the awesome artist associated with it and the 100 days of making comics group.  After I became delusional and Drunk with power (OK, just drunk) I thought I could also make a comic. I began on a journey of  self-doubt, regret and long nights of frustration. Being too hard headed to quit and too dumb to know I've lost, I am now here with a finished 60 page comic and 2.... maybe 3 mini-comics (Jurassic Jib  releases if the campaign hits $3k). So back Doomed Barbarian If ya want a fun time that is just a vacation from reality, in a book made to laugh at itself, about a couple of crude drawn boobs.

Risks & Challenges

  • The book is complete and ready for print.
  • Plan is to print as soon as the campaign is funded.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Character Biography 

Dominic Netherin: A man born in a place called the Shadow Realm. Throughout his journeys, he must face challenges throughout his life, from the ups and downs. Living a life without his parents completely turn his life upside down. He had no choice but to trained and become a Shadow Hunter under a group organization called the Shadow Academy ruled by the Shadow Councils. One's Bloodshed was old enough he wanted to seek the truth of his missing parents and to know what goes on within the shadow council and what secrets are they hiding from.  

 

 

Comic Universe Summary 

This comic book is based on a solo origin series of Bloodshed. Our goal is to create this vast open multiverse. A multiverse full of Superheroes, Mythology, Fantasy, Horror, Folk tale and more. A whole universe that you can dip your feet into and begin something exciting. We have Medieval, Victorian era, Mystery, Time Travel, Dimensions and so much to experience, we at Heartline & BloodMoon Comics can’t wait to welcome you with this amazing comic book series. 

 

We're planning on creating many stories and characters and significant lore, let's try to expand this universe and change the comic book industry forever. We will also be creating a YouTube account explaining to you the fans all our new updated content within the comic. So we could all have a stronger bond with our fans.

 

 

Goals and Budget

Our $1,000 budget will cover a high-quality artist, the cost of additional rewards. Whatever we raise above our goals will go to increase our creator page rates and will go towards the next Issue. So please, support our company, and we promise we will give back to all our fans! Cause you're the number one priority for our comic! We will provide many rewards for whoever donates to us, we're all about our fans and the content we provide to them. We will try our best to come with the best rewards we could give out. So as long as the donates keep coming in we will provide with many more rewards for all of you! 

 

The funds that need to be raised will cover the cost of printing and perks for backers.  This venue allows small publishers in the indie market to thrive and share content on a consistent basis.  

  • Perks Costs:                                                            
  • Bookmarks: $30
  • Posters: $50
  • T-Shirts: $100-$200
  • Original Art: GOD TIER PRICE!!  (we think you get the picture)
  • All the funds raised will go towards the production of this book. Excess funds, if reached, will help fund future issues and so forth. Like we said before every little donation will go out for the comic and for the fans with the reward that we have for you.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand everyone may not be in the position to help fund this project or this project may not be to your liking.  However, you can still support us and help make this a successful campaign.  You can simply:

  • Get the word out and make some noise about our campaign via your social media. 
  • Share, share, share and use the Kickstarter share tools whenever possible.

Follow us on social media:                         

  • https://twitter.com/Heartline_comic
  • https://www.instagram.com/heartline_comics/
  • https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCP54n3UpzV4hAorervwBOSA?view_as=subscriber
  • https://www.facebook.com/Heartline-Blood-Moon-I...

 

We thank you for taking the time to review our campaign and always appreciate comments and feedback.

story:
Do you love crazy stories filled with monsters, magic, gore, and humor?

Have you ever read about H.P. Lovecraft's Dreamlands and thought..."I wish this was funnier and gorier"?

Are you excited by stories that keep you on your toes and make you question the very fabric of reality?

Then you are going to love Ichabod Jones: Monster Hunter.

Ichabod Jones is about a mental patient that escapes an asylum and becomes a monster hunter during the Apocalypse, but doesn't know if he's killing monsters, humans, or if it's all in his head the whole time.  It's a complete fantastical and psychological mindscrew. 

Ichabod comes from a deep, almost primordial, place in my soul. It's the part that devours movies like In the Mouth of Madness, Event Horizon, and Jacob's Ladder, while still binging on Gravity Falls, Frankenweenie, and Army of Darkness. It's the part that read Johnny the Homicidal Maniac and laughed hysterically at every gruesome scene.

All of that went into Ichabod Jones Monster Hunter. We delivered volume 2 of the story in January, and now we're back with the never-before-seen THIRD volume of Ichabod Jones: Monster Hunter, with Renzo Podesta back on art duties. 

We're now ready to release the third volume of Ichabod Jones: Monster Hunter, a 96-page hardcover.

What is the story about, really?

Ichabod isn't about some mental patient who's ruthlessly killing people. It's about a broken man, who was cast off by society, and whether that person, a person who nobody wants, can be a hero.

Can he find his place in the world? Can he come to terms with everything that he's done? Can he become a hero?

I'm very interested in that idea, as a person who is severely broken myself. I've had depression and anxiety for as long as I can remember, and it's getting worse with every passing year.

I never felt like I fit in for the first 30 years of my life. It wasn't until I went out into the world and became the hero of my own story that I started to think that maybe I wasn't the worst human being on the planet.

Ichabod, though, came from a place where I was very much alone, broken, and wondering if it would ever get better.

I think what makes Ichabod really special is that it was started by a person who never knew if he could be fixed, one who felt like he was cast off from society, and now it's being written by a person who understands that the broken bits are what make him special.

See, Ichabod, at its core, is about hope. It's about taking what's special about you and using it to bring light into the world; of shining hope in a bleak universe. Ichabod's world is harrowing and awful, but Ichabod can bring light into it, not despite of being broken, but because of it.

A psychological mind screw

Ichabod Jones is about a mental patient that escapes from an asylum and becomes a monster hunter during the Apocalypse, but he doesn't know if he's killing monsters, humans, or it's all in his head the whole time.

Ichabod has been imprisoned in a mental asylum for crimes he definitely committed. When he was arrested, the police found him wrist-deep in the guts of his latest victim.

While he's never claimed he was innocent, he says he only committed atrocious acts because an authoritative, and unwelcome, voice in his head told him he was doing God's work.

He tried to say no to the voice, but it was very insistent and persuasive. It told Ichabod that the people he was killing were monsters and he was saving the world by murdering them.

He was wrong...or so he thought.

At the beginning of the story, Ichabod wakes up in the Apocalypse, being chased by a monster trying to devour his soul. He has no choice but to use his training as a monster hunter to fight off the beast, and accept his fate as the savior of the world.

He meets a band of other inmates, helps them escape the asylum, and they begin their long journey across the desert to freedom, trying to carve out a bit of humanity as they go.

Something strange happens to Ichabod throughout the story, and I say strange in a tale that is already at 11 on the strange meter.

Every now and then...he snaps back to another place, where he's sitting with his doctor, talking out what just happened to him, or on the run from the law, and definitely NOT in the Apocalypse.

Is he really there, is it a memory, or is he having a psychological break?

It's that juxtaposition between reality and perception that makes Ichabod special. It's not just an Apocalypse story, or a dark fantasy tale, or a chosen one book. It also messing with your very perception of the universe, and whether Ichabod is truly a hero, or a psychopath killing the innocent.

After all, he was wrong about being a savior once, and that's what got him locked away in the first place. What's to say he's not wrong again, only now he's having a much more vivid hallucination?

Or perhaps he's only fantasizing about being a hero, while being locked in his cell, unable to smell freedom ever again.

What other people are saying about Ichabod

We've gotten some great reviews over the years.

If you’ve got a taste for unconventional and offbeat horror, then don’t miss Ichabod Jones: Monster Hunter!" – Bryant Dillon, President: Fanbase Press

https://fanbasepress.com/index.php/blogs/bryant-dillon/item/1072-ichabod-jones-monster-hunter-review

"Ichabod Jones: Monster Hunter – is a glimpse into the abyss. Renzo Podesta’s art fits perfectly. If you love your horror gritty, gory, and psychological, pick up a copy." – Chuck Suffel, whatchareasing.com

https://whatchareading.com/ichabod-jones-monster-hunter/

 

"Ichabod Jones: Monster Hunter" gets a 5 out of 5 for me. A nicely done little indie horror comic that could. Nice atmospheric artwork, good characters." – popgoesthedarkeraven.com

https://popgoesthedarkeraven.wordpress.com/2020/08/13/wannabe-ichabod-jones-monster-hunter-4-review/

"This ongoing story combines the best concepts of the Lovecraftian style to deliver a dark fantasy horror series."

https://www.cbr.com/hp-lovecraft-cosmic-horror-comic-recommendations

 

I am so appreciative of all the amazingly supportive press reviewers we've met over the years. However, the most important reviews to me are from fans just like you.

 

Check out what other fans are saying about Ichabod.

Who am I?

My name is Russell Nohelty, USA Today bestselling author and publisher of Wannabe Press, a small press that creates weird books for weird people, creator of Katrina Hates Dead Shit, Ichabod Jones Monster Hunter, and Pixie Dust, along with the editor of both the Monsters and Other Scary Shit, and Cthulhu is Hard to Spell anthologies.

Who drew that dope art?

Renzo Podesta is a bit of a kingmaker in indie comics. I didn't know it when we first started working together, but Renzo has helped some of the coolest comic creators on the planet build their careers. You can check out his work here.

He's worked with Charles Soule on a book called 27 from Image Comics. From that book, Charles started working with Marvel, and has written Death of Wolverine, X-Men, Poe Dameron, Han Solo, and a bunch of books for them.

He's also worked with Jeremy Holt, who has several books out with Insight Editions, including After Houdini and Skinned, and Skip to the End for Heavy Metal.

He was also the original artist on Howard Lovecraft and the Frozen Kingdom before it was picked up as an animated movie.

I met Renzo all the way back in 2010, well before I was a known artist in the indie scene. In fact, he was producing the first issue arc for me while he was producing the second arc of 27 for Charles, and well before Charles was even at Marvel, which seems like two lifetimes ago.

He's one of my favorite artists, and he's the reason Ichabod became such a beloved character. He took a psychopath who could have easily come across as evil and creepy, and turned him into an enduring, lovable person.

story:
The Norm 2020 Calendar

I'm Michael Jantze, creator of comic strip "The Norm," once syndicated daily in newspapers now featured weekly at GoComics.com! "The Norm" is about Norm and his wife, their two kids, two jobs, two dogs and too much to do! Sound familiar?

A new year approaches and it promises to be a doozy. You will need something to act as a handle, something to steady you through the churn —something normal, something that, when it's all over is recyclable — you need The Norm 2020 Wall Calendar! 

What is  The Norm 2020 Wall Calendar? Well, this baby features:

  • Fourteen full-color "The Norm 4.0" comic strips.
  • Twelve roomy grids for notes, organization, and communication.
  • Plus a full-color sticker sheet featuring The Norm characters.
  • A page dedicated to all the donors, listing their names.
  • And it will be delivered in December 2019!

You can only purchase this limited-edition calendar through this fundraiser and you can get additional discounted calendars, as well. You'll be able to tell your friends you "know someone." So contribute today! 

 

Your Impact

As with my books, I am planning a limited run and will only sell these directly from this Indiegogo campaign page. Here's how your contribution will make a difference:

  • Get a calendar and some other stuff you may want
  • Support one of your favorite (wink wink) comic strip artists
  • Give yourself the chance to get extra copies at a steep discount
  • Brighten this dark and ugly world with color comics
  • You can help feed me and my family, including Coco the borador 

​

Risks & Challenges

The calendar and stickers are ready to go to press. I'll reveal the sticker sheet in November! Here's how I plan to deliver this calendar to you on-price and on-time!

  • I'm an Indiegogo veteran. I have a plan to print and ship the calendars five weeks from the date of full funding.
  • The calendars will be printed in the United States, so no waiting on a boat from China.
  • If we don't make the funding goal, we won't print the calendar and your money is returned.
  • Any stretch goals will be add-ons that can be printed and shipped with the original order.

 

Where Your Money Goes 

Your contribution will be used to:

  • Pay for the printing of the calendar and stickers.
  • Pay for shipping and shipping materials.
  • Pay all Indiegogo, Paypal, other processing fees, and taxes.
  • Pay off a bit of debt from previously, poorly-planned projects
  • Pay any unforeseen costs

 

Other Ways You Can Help

The first way to help? Contribute to this campaign. But if you can’t contribute you can still help my campaign. Use the share tools to get the word out on social media: send the link by email, or share this page in person with your friends and family! Regardless of contributing or not, sharing is the best way to help!

And thank you so much in advance!

Normally,
Michael Jantze
The Norm®: It's a Serious World, Someone Has to Make Fun of It!

The calendars will be printed in the United States, so no waiting on a boat from China.
If we don't make the funding goal, we won't print the calendar and your money is returned.
Any stretch goals will be add-ons that can be printed and shipped with the original order.

 
Where Your Money Goes 
Your contribution will be used to:

Pay for the printing of the calendar and stickers.
Pay for shipping and shipping materials.
Pay all Indiegogo, Paypal, other processing fees, and taxes.
Pay off a bit of debt from previously, poorly-planned projects
Pay any unforeseen costs

 
Other Ways You Can Help
The first way to help? Contribute to this campaign. But if you can’t contribute you can still help my campaign. Use the share tools to get the word out on social media: send the link by email, or share this page in person with your friends and family! Regardless of contributing or not, sharing is the best way to help!
And thank you so much in advance!
Normally,Michael JantzeThe Norm®: It's a Serious World, Someone Has to Make Fun of It!

story:
AGENTS OF TALON - a military-esque super team with characters that have heart! Normal characters doing extraordinary things, but with real emotions and problems like the rest of us.

 

AGENTS OF TALON is a 40-page full color one-shot comic book that has been a labor of love for my brother Steve and me for over a decade.  We've always had a passion for comics since childhood, especially superheroes.  While developing our first published work CODENAME: BLACK DEATH, we came up with a great idea for another book, which became AGENTS OF TALON.  

While we contained AGENTS OF TALON in a one-shot with one great self-contained story, it can easily be expanded upon.  As such, included in this book is the 8-page Training Day, narrated by Gus, featuring a collection of characters for future AGENTS OF TALON stories.

SYNOPSIS:

Welcome to Talon - the most powerful military institution in the world! Ivan the Dominator has been amassing his forces underneath the radar of Talon.  Now, there’s only one thing Talon can do; send in a specialist – the Air Enforcer! Will Talon’s superhero be enough to stop the biggest threat the world has ever seen?

AGENTS OF TALON focuses on the introduction of Clay Jackson, family man and top Air Force pilot, being recruited by Talon to don the Air Enforcer armor.  Clay deals with the struggles of keeping his family together while the demands of his new assignment constantly pull him away and into danger. 

THE REVIEWS ARE IN! THEY LIKE US! THEY REALLY LIKE US! 

Preview copies of Agents of Talon were sent to media in 2006, where it was universally applauded with flattering comparisons to established loved characters.  We were told that the Talon logo was very iconic!

  • “G.I. Joe with heart.” - Comic's Buyer's Guide (which became our tag line--thanks CBG!) 
  • "A definite must for anyone who enjoys great characters" and "a well-written story.” - Silver Bullet Comics
  • Air Enforcer is “so bad ass he’d make Iron Man pee the bed.” - Wizard Magazine #179

 

Unfortunately, we ran out of funding to finish publishing AGENTS OF TALON.  But thanks to our recent Kickstarter backers, AGENTS OF TALON has been successfully funded-so this book will be made and fulfilled for all Indiegogo backers!  Any upgrades in AGENTS OF TALON #1 through our Indiegogo will also be given to backers of our Kickstarter.

 

REWARDS

We worked with talented veteran comic book artist Bong Dazo (Deadpool, Star Wars:KOTOR).  Bong provided inspired artwork for the entire book, and it was apparent that he had a lot of fun drawing the characters and action scenes.   

Rest in peace Bong, your contribution to the vision for Agents of Talon was integral.  

 

See where we started! As an added value, included in some reward tiers is the entire mini-series of our original published title CODENAME: BLACK DEATH, which was produced by the same creative team (Dazo/Zinngrabe) as AGENTS OF TALON. Discover how Marshall Ahrens, a Marine Corps Special Forces leader, becomes the infamous Black Death.  For Marshall, the motives are good...but the methods are brutal.  Includes the 1st appearance of S.K.A.T.E.! Learn more about Codename: Black Death at triumphverse.com.

 

 

NOTE: The AGENTS OF TALON universe will be expanded upon with a follow up book.  The next chapter of AGENTS OF TALON will feature S.K.A.T.E, from the pages of CODENAME: BLACK DEATH!

The story and art of AGENTS OF TALON are 100% complete, and it looks fantastic!

Having self-published the CODENAME: BLACK DEATH mini-series previously, we're knowledgeable in the process--and pitfalls--it takes to bring comics into print. The goal is to always meet the promised schedules--as we did with our four-issue miniseries through a major distributor.

Thank you, everyone, for your time and checking out our project. Let's get this done!

story:
Overview

Arkin Kovacs, is a reclusive billionaire genius and running the world's most successful international corporation. Being a superhero vigilante by night, is now the world's most wanted felon. When his secret identity is leaked online, tangling him in a web of mystery, murder and high-octane action with a bullseye painted on his head.

 

 

Ballistic is a thirty page comic that will launch a universe of heroes and villains and will be an on-going series taking place in a cyberpunk world. The pencils, inks, and will be done by Patrick Nguyen. The comic will also include a newsletter section where you can submit fan art, letters, and more with  any backer who claims a perk of $25 or more will be included on the "thank you page"!

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 


RISKS AND CHALLENGES 

 

  • Only YOU can bring this adventure to life! Your support not only helps produce this book but will also help me start work on future books.
  • The main concern is just getting the book done on time, I've written several issues and volumes ahead but art is always difficult. Getting caught up in the little details. 
  • Other than that there are no concerns.

 

​STRETCH GOALS

 

1,500$: ISSUE ONE COMPLETED 

2,000$: 20 ADDITIONAL PAGES. 

2,500$: BALLISTIC ON-GOING SERIES (DIGITAL)

6,100$: COLORED PAGES (DIGITAL)

9,500$: PHYSICAL BOOKS

 

THANK YOU SO MUCH FOR ALL YOUR SUPPORT!

 

*Artwork not final*

story:
Even though this campaign has ended without appearing to be funded, I know that there is a God in Heaven who watches over this campaign, my life, and Conversation Alley. I will not walk in fear but in peace because this company has a destiny and I will live to see it prosper.

This peace is a peace that even a 'closed' campaign will not take away. I can sleep with happiness in heart and peace in my mind because the Father provides for his children. I am so excited for the future of Conversation Alley.

Love,

~Jubilee

We are thankful to all of our students, donors, as well as for the concept of crowd-funding for allowing our small start-up to promote our business's progress over the last few months as well as our current needs for the new year. 

  • We opened our doors January 26, 2016.
  • We are an online, on-demand video subscription service (similar to Netflix but for English Learners!).
  • All of our anime illustrations and animations are made by us.
  • Weekly, we add conversation topics and techniques to our online library.
  • We create a unique short story every month.
  • We welcome all levels of students! In 2017, we have plans to release a series with a hundred+ lessons to help English beginners learn the fundamentals of the language. Our current lessons are best for students with a basic knowledge of English as knowledge of English sentence structure and verb tenses are expected. All lessons are made for students who wish to learn without the constant aid of a teacher.
  • Subtitles are included in all of our language learning videos for students with difficulties listening to average paced spoken English.
  • We are expanding our definition services! For now, text-based definitions are added underneath all of our topics, techniques, and stories. Soon we will launch, "Think as a Native Speaker!" A series of 15+ minute videos with detailed explanations for thousands of common/uncommon words found in average English dictionaries. These videos will help our students to understand the emotions, thoughts, history, and usage of these words based on American culture. This style of vocabulary memorization will allow our students to think as native speakers when using words.
  • Weekly, we offer all of our students a free conversation practice session with live native speakers. 

  • To provide a safe environment for students of all ages to practice their English conversational skills before using them in the real world.
  • To provide access to live native speakers - We feel native teachers recognize issues concerning intonation, rhythm, diction, and stress of words better than non-native teachers. We also believe native teachers may better understand 'why' certain words are used above others in comparison to non-native teachers.
  • To use anime, fiction stories, and cute dialogues to allow our learners to have the most exciting ESL learning experience as possible for creative minded students.
  • Read Our Terms of Use.
  • Read Our Frequently Asked Questions.
  • Read Our Privacy Policy.
  • Read Our Easy Billing Policy.

We understand that everyone who likes our campaign may not have the ability to give. This is especially understandable given that this campaign is launching near the holidays. On the other hand, did you know that you can give without even spending a dime:

  • Please share this campaign on social media. Someone may check it out and offer to help us to keep Conversation Alley alive because you took a bit of time to share it.
  • Tell your friends and family about our campaign, even if it's just to check out our cute animations. ^_^
  • Tell people who are interested in learning English, especially other ESL students, about our campaign. For a limited time, we are offering memberships to our ESL subscriptions for 40% off (only through this campaign).

Here is a detailed list of our budget costs for the following year:

  • $90 (+ $12 for shipping) - APC Back-UPS Connect BGE50ML (part one of our backup system during power outages)
  • $150 (+$20 for shipping) - Tripp Lite 1500VA Back-UPS (part two of our backup system during power outages)
  • $444 (including $11 for shipping) - A one-time business cost for our 2nd year's communication equipment upgrade. (What a cute number! Yet, it is the actual full cost of upgrading our phone services for our students).
  • $500 - Start-up cost to register a trademark and legal fees to fulfill the process.

  • $675 - Necessary website services (needed for better functionality, faster hosts, domain security, and an additional payment option for our customers during checkout).
  • $518 - Cost to maintain our Adobe video and audio subscription services for another year.
  • $720 - Start-up cost for premium accounting and budgeting software.

  • $2000 - Marketing start-up costs ($350 for pay-per-click ads, $650 for email marketing services with best templates in town!, $1000 for online newspaper advertisements & paper promotional materials).

  • $3715 - Costs from our first year's equipment and website needs we would like to complete (this includes a necessary computer upgrade during our first year).
  • $5520 - Cost to maintain our illustrators and animators for another full year.

We believe our donors and students should know where their donation and perk money will be spent (even to the exact dollar).

Your generous donations and heart-filled contributions will truly make the difference in whether or not Conversation Alley will continue to provide services to our online community. 

Without your help:

  • Leo the Golden Warrior and his robotic kitten Gingercake will never finish their journey to find Leo's sister and parents in the Silver Millennia Galaxy.

  • Lana and Timothy, no more than friendly co-workers, may never get the chance to explain that their engagement was an innocent joke to calm Tim's elderly parents over his lack of marriage for several years.

  • Teenage Paige will never get a summer job to provide once in a lifetime concert tickets for her family.

  • Thousands of video-based definitions will never be provided. English language learners will continue to use plain, customary, one sentence definitions to learn important vocabulary words.

  • Complex and interesting animated conversation ideas will cease to be created, and students in schools all over the world will be forced to practice conversation with average conversational topics such as, "Ask Billy to be your friend."

  • The true art of conversation, the balance between polite yet non-formal English, and the depth of English connotation may continue to be overlooked and not explained to most English language learners.

  • No one will believe how close they were to seeing a change come to the way ESL is taught to creative-minded English language learners.

  • Super polite and willing to help live native speakers may become obsolete... and teachers who happen to be depressed all the time may accidentally teach BLUNT or PLAIN English. Their students will never know why some native speakers mistake their common speech lacking polite intonation for rudeness (over-polite students may even be taken as flirts).

 

Jubilee Grace is the CEO and President of Conversation Alley INC. As a former film major with a love for language learning and travel, she graduated with a BA in English Lit and a certification to teach English to students as a foreign language. She desires to help create a world where English language learners may expand their conversational skills without common grammatical barriers. Her favorite pastimes include video editing, language learning, teaching ESL, and computer coding.

story:
What's Daughter of Titan about?

Daughter of Titan follows Alena Amar, a young woman living in the city-state of Tridecca City, who discovers she is the descendant of the world's last true superhero "Titan".

This sounds like it would be amazing right? Unfortunately, despite Alena's desire to do good, a Titan revival has its detractors; ranging from the head of a shady government augmentation program to the ex-augmented detective who hunts for illegal augmentations, from Lovecraftian monsters in another dimension to her own disapproving parents. 

The series has been inspired by the way superhero comics portray women and the lack of diversity within the industry.

Greatness has thrust itself upon Alena Amar. How will she use her powers?

Want to read the opening 3 pages? 

 

So will you like Daughter of Titan?

If you like any of the following things then there's a good chance you'll love it!

  • Superhero Origin Stories 
  • Strong Female Protagonists 
  • Morally grey characters
  • Cosmic Horror
  • Dystopian Fiction

Suzanne Perkins is smarter than you, and she knows it.

 

Here's a brief overview of the story

The story is set in Tridecca city, a sprawling metropolis that is comprised of thirteen American and Canadian cities that have banded together as the rest of North America fell into disarray. On top of the regular police force, there exists a government program that uses augmentations to raise regular officers to near superhuman capabilities called the "augthorities".  However, public opinion of the augthorities is low with reports of brutality. 

Nice guys don't get to be the head of a multi billion dollar human augmentation program.

 

Enter Alena Amar, once a promising robotics student, who dropped it to appease her "realist" parents who see no future in the branch of robotics she is pursuing. 

In issue 1 when cornered one night by a mugger, she discovers she has superhuman powers. Before she can act, two augthority officers appear and deal with the mugger in a brutal fashion that even raises sympathy from Alena herself.  

She confides in her best friend and fellow robotics prodigy Suzanne Perkins and learns Suzanne is building a super suit to replace the augmentation program. Its design was based on the urban legend of Titan. They decide to combine their talents and try and make the world a better place. 

Now in issue #2 Titan's return has not gone unnoticed which has brought General Dwight Rossiter and Detective Frank Brenner onto the scene. 

General Dwight Rossiter runs the augmentation project. He doesn't take kindly to anyone or anything trying to undermine his life's work. He has the ear of some of the city's most powerful people and isn't afraid to use any means necessary to secure his legacy.  

Frank Brenner was the most successful agent on the augmentation program. But augmentations take their toll on the mind and now Brenner suffers from a series of mental conditions. This has made him very unstable, yet Rossiter covers up for him to avoid any shadows being cast on his augmentation program. This essentially gives Brenner the freedom to do whatever he wants (often with messy results).

But sitting in a fancy office sits an even greater threat, an old rival of Titan watches on, waiting for the right moment to tear open a hole to a hellscape dimension and settle an age-old score. 

Once a hero, Brenner's tattoos hide scars from his augmentations. Sadly, the psychological damage was already done by then.

 

Praise for Daughter of Titan

Being my first comic, issue #1 had a few mistakes. So this time around, I took my time (over a year) to craft the story again and enlisted an experienced editor and new artist to help put the story back on track. Here's what people have said:

 

Meet the Team

The art team and editor behind this comic are all women, which I have received criticism for by a small sect of the comics community that think by giving women the chance to shine in a male-dominated industry, I am committing some egregious crime. They can take a long walk off a short pier :P

Richard Mooney (Writer/Creator): Born and raised in Scotland, Richard came out of University and went straight into the brutal world of Freelancing where he has now spent half a decade working on some of the weirdest projects you can imagine. 

Daughter of Titan is his first creation, but he has worked on several other comics as a Writer: the bearded escapades of Percy Nobleman and the dark and violent series of Uptown Chronicles are among them.

Monika Laprus-Wierzejska (Artist): Monika doesn't exist on a physical plane. She is a cyber-rider who occasionally creates bad-ass art. Among them is the comic known as EXIST.

Maja Opacic (Colourist): Maja was born in 1983 in Karlovac, Yugoslavia (today Croatia). She received her diploma from the Academy of Arts and Restoration in Belgrade in the study of conservation and restoration of fine art.  In 2017, she ventured into the field of digital art and comic book coloring. Her love for comics started in early childhood and grew with European comics like Dylan Dog, Alan Ford, and Modesty Blaise. As comics were the reason for her initial interest in art it seems like her art has made full circle going back to her first love.

Novella Locritani (Letterer): Novella Locritani is a Digital Artist from Italy. She explored almost every graphical field of the comic industry. As a letterer, her name can be found in various published books all over the world, most of them being translated editions of DC, Vertigo and Image comics. She's a newbie LARPer and avid D&D player.

 

What We Need & What You Get

We actually ran a very successful Kickstarter campaign last month, raising 250% of what we needed. Despite the popularity, some people still missed out on the campaign. Someone mentioned I should do try Indiegogo to see if there were any fans out there who also missed it because they don't pay attention to other crowdfunding websites. I thought "Fair Point", so here we are!

Now there are only digital copies available (sorry!) but if anyone is interested in climbing on board and seeing some incredible art and getting a fun story to boot, then you're in the right place!

 

Risks & Challenges

There are literally no risks. All of the art is complete, just the colouring and lettering for the final few pages. After that, I will be handing it back to the editor to do one final overall check and then they will be prepped to be sent out!
story_txt:
What's Daughter of Titan about?
Daughter of Titan follows Alena Amar, a young woman living in the city-state of Tridecca City, who discovers she is the descendant of the world's last true superhero "Titan".
This sounds like it would be amazing right? Unfortunately, despite Alena's desire to do good, a Titan revival has its detractors; ranging from the head of a shady government augmentation program to the ex-augmented detective who hunts for illegal augmentations, from Lovecraftian monsters in another dimension to her own disapproving parents. 
The series has been inspired by the way superhero comics portray women and the lack of diversity within the industry.

Greatness has thrust itself upon Alena Amar. How will she use her powers?
Want to read the opening 3 pages? 



 
So will you like Daughter of Titan?
If you like any of the following things then there's a good chance you'll love it!

Superhero Origin Stories 
Strong Female Protagonists 
Morally grey characters
Cosmic Horror
Dystopian Fiction


Suzanne Perkins is smarter than you, and she knows it.
 
Here's a brief overview of the story
The story is set in Tridecca city, a sprawling metropolis that is comprised of thirteen American and Canadian cities that have banded together as the rest of North America fell into disarray. On top of the regular police force, there exists a government program that uses augmentations to raise regular officers to near superhuman capabilities called the "augthorities".  However, public opinion of the augthorities is low with reports of brutality. 

Nice guys don't get to be the head of a multi billion dollar human augmentation program.
 
Enter Alena Amar, once a promising robotics student, who dropped it to appease her "realist" parents who see no future in the branch of robotics she is pursuing. 
In issue 1 when cornered one night by a mugger, she discovers she has superhuman powers. Before she can act, two augthority officers appear and deal with the mugger in a brutal fashion that even raises sympathy from Alena herself.  
She confides in her best friend and fellow robotics prodigy Suzanne Perkins and learns Suzanne is building a super suit to replace the augmentation program. Its design was based on the urban legend of Titan. They decide to combine their talents and try and make the world a better place. 

Now in issue #2 Titan's return has not gone unnoticed which has brought General Dwight Rossiter and Detective Frank Brenner onto the scene. 
General Dwight Rossiter runs the augmentation project. He doesn't take kindly to anyone or anything trying to undermine his life's work. He has the ear of some of the city's most powerful people and isn't afraid to use any means necessary to secure his legacy.  
Frank Brenner was the most successful agent on the augmentation program. But augmentations take their toll on the mind and now Brenner suffers from a series of mental conditions. This has made him very unstable, yet Rossiter covers up for him to avoid any shadows being cast on his augmentation program. This essentially gives Brenner the freedom to do whatever he wants (often with messy results).
But sitting in a fancy office sits an even greater threat, an old rival of Titan watches on, waiting for the right moment to tear open a hole to a hellscape dimension and settle an age-old score. 

Once a hero, Brenner's tattoos hide scars from his augmentations. Sadly, the psychological damage was already done by then.
 
Praise for Daughter of Titan
Being my first comic, issue #1 had a few mistakes. So this time around, I took my time (over a year) to craft the story again and enlisted an experienced editor and new artist to help put the story back on track. Here's what people have said:

 
Meet the Team

The art team and editor behind this comic are all women, which I have received criticism for by a small sect of the comics community that think by giving women the chance to shine in a male-dominated industry, I am committing some egregious crime. They can take a long walk off a short pier :P
Richard Mooney (Writer/Creator): Born and raised in Scotland, Richard came out of University and went straight into the brutal world of Freelancing where he has now spent half a decade working on some of the weirdest projects you can imagine. 
Daughter of Titan is his first creation, but he has worked on several other comics as a Writer: the bearded escapades of Percy Nobleman and the dark and violent series of Uptown Chronicles are among them.
Monika Laprus-Wierzejska (Artist): Monika doesn't exist on a physical plane. She is a cyber-rider who occasionally creates bad-ass art. Among them is the comic known as EXIST.
Maja Opacic (Colourist): Maja was born in 1983 in Karlovac, Yugoslavia (today Croatia). She received her diploma from the Academy of Arts and Restoration in Belgrade in the study of conservation and restoration of fine art.  In 2017, she ventured into the field of digital art and comic book coloring. Her love for comics started in early childhood and grew with European comics like Dylan Dog, Alan Ford, and Modesty Blaise. As comics were the reason for her initial interest in art it seems like her art has made full circle going back to her first love.
Novella Locritani (Letterer): Novella Locritani is a Digital Artist from Italy. She explored almost every graphical field of the comic industry. As a letterer, her name can be found in various published books all over the world, most of them being translated editions of DC, Vertigo and Image comics. She's a newbie LARPer and avid D&D player.
 

What We Need & What You Get
We actually ran a very successful Kickstarter campaign last month, raising 250% of what we needed. Despite the popularity, some people still missed out on the campaign. Someone mentioned I should do try Indiegogo to see if there were any fans out there who also missed it because they don't pay attention to other crowdfunding websites. I thought "Fair Point", so here we are!
Now there are only digital copies available (sorry!) but if anyone is interested in climbing on board and seeing some incredible art and getting a fun story to boot, then you're in the right place!
 
Risks & Challenges
There are literally no risks. All of the art is complete, just the colouring and lettering for the final few pages. After that, I will be handing it back to the editor to do one final overall check and then they will be prepped to be sent out!

story:
About the Artist

Jason Williams has been tattooing for over 20 years and has recently made the venture into creating his own fan-based comic book. He is a lover of all things horror and comics, and has decided to merge his two loves into one. For the past few months, he has worked diligently on a Batman vs. Jason fan-based graphic novel. By supporting our campaign, you will aide in his dream coming to fruition and bringing it to all horror and comic lovers alike. 

What's in it for me?

A fully detailed graphic novel, a custom designed book marker, an autographed poster of your choosing, a first pick of your very own Batman OR Jason cover, along with an assortment of trading cards of characters from the graphic novel could be yours based on your contribution. Any and all funding contributed will pay for the comic. That includes but is not limited to the printing, distribution, and custom covers for the comic. It will also pay for the book markers, cards, and posters.

The Impact

Jason has always had a love and passion for the Friday the 13th films ever since he was a boy. His grandmother used to take him to the theaters to see the films. Batman, in his opinion, is the greatest superhero of all time. Jason has always wanted to see the two in some type of medium and as a result, he took it upon himself to make it happen not only for himself, but for the world as well. 

Risks & Challenges

Jason has already invested much of his time into the artwork. So far, he has sketched over 50 pages and inked approximately 10 pages and is still going strong. Working on this project has taken up a lot of his time. He has put himself on a tight deadline to see this dream of his come true and continues to work tirelessly on a least 1 page a day. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If a monetary contribution isn't possible for you, please, feel free to share our page with you friends, family, and coworkers. Show your support in anyway possible! We greatly appreciate your time!

story:
The Story behind Beast King...

Genetically modified from birth, Jake Stephens must find his own path as he gains more control over his abilities. The company behind his mutation, Anico, murdered his parents and is now hunting Jake down for their own experiments. He is the perfect specimen of what Anico wanted to create, a genetically modified soldier. 

But Jake wants revenge for his parents murder, and he is not letting anything get in his way. After a massive betrayal from the one person he thought he could trust, Jake is now on his own and must destroy Anico for good. Can he pull this off without losing himself to the beast within? 

Here is a free digital copy of Beast King Issue #1 to give you an idea of the awesomeness you will be reading.

 

Digital Copy of Beast King Issue #1 PDF Download

 

 But who is this for?

Do you enjoy stories with a flawed main character with a no nonsense attitude like that of Wolverine, but is plagued by a monstrous transformation like that of The Hulk? 

Do you like the idea of stories combining elements of science fiction and fantasy to create unique stories?

Do you enjoy strong characters, action-packed fights, and a plot-line that you will get sucked in to? 

Then Beast King is the must-read comic series for you! Every issue is filled with 32 pages of story content for your enjoyment.

And Finally, Thank You!

Without the help of comic book fans and even people new to comics, stuff like this wouldn't be possible. We creators more than anything just want to produce great stories for individuals like you to be able to just enjoy and have fun reading. To be able to maybe help people momentarily forget about the troubles in the world is truly a great feeling.

So I just want to say THANK YOU for putting your faith and trust in me as a creator and allowing me to put my work in the world for more people to see. Without your help, none of this would be possible.

story:
Summary

Hi, fellow Flarrow fans. We are so excited to bring you VIGILANTE CONVENTION!

Vigilante Convention will be a small convention in NYC that will bring together select cast members and you, the Flash/Arrow fan community. We hope that you'll join us in all the activities we have planned. We will be having Q&A's, photo ops, autographs, parties and contests.

Our team is made up of fans of not only the Flash and Arrow TV shows but who have been in the superhero and sci-fi/fantasy fandoms for over 20 years! We are fan fic writers, vidders, fic readers and all around fangirls and fanboys.  We have a passion for fandom and for conventions, large and small. We hope to combine our experience and knowledge to bring you an amazing event.

We look forward to seeing you in NYC next March and thanks so much for checking out our IGG Pre-Sale!

Dates: March 19-20, 2016 with Registration and a Pre-Party on Friday, March 18, 2016.


What We Need

The cost of putting on an event of this magnitude is daunting for our team and so we need help in raising money for it. This IGG will be the springboard for all the great things we have planned. Below is a small list of what we need to make Vigilante Convention it's best:

    1. Venue space - we need rooms for panels, parties, photo ops, etc.

    2. Guest Appearance Fees.

    3. Audio/Visual staff and equipment like microphones, speakers, projectors, screens.

    4. Photography/Videography equipment.

    5. Business registration fees.

    6. T-shirts and program books

    Reaching our goal means that we can really kickstart our planning and get Vigilante Convention off the ground.

    Admission Badges & Perks

    We want to give attendees various ticket options so that you can really customize your experience. You can review inclusions for each level below.  

    *Ultimate V.I.P., Super V.I.P. and V.I.P. Plus Badges are only available via the IGG Pre-Sale. These will include an exclusive laminated badge.

    *Denotes exclusive perks for IGG backers.

    *Ultimate V.I.P. Badge - $2,250:

    Convention admission on Saturday and Sunday
    Assigned Seating in theater in the front row 
    Standard room at the hotel (Friday Check-in – Sunday Check-out)
    Autographs from all GUESTS and HEROES
    2 Group Photo Ops
    2 GUEST Single Photo Ops
    1 HERO Photo Op
    1 Double (GUESTS or HEROES) Photo Op
    Meet and Greet with 2 GUESTS
    Friday night's pre-party
    Saturday night's after party
    Exclusive VIP ticket holders panel
    Access to break room (snacks and drinks provided)
    Exclusive laminated badge
    Vigilante Convention T-shirt
    Convention Swag Bag (includes wristband/button)
    Vigilante Convention Scrapbook Kit


    *Super V.I.P. Badge - $1,250:

    Convention admission on Saturday and Sunday
    Assigned seats in the front row to the left and right of Ultimate V.I.P.’s
    Autographs from all GUESTS and 1 HERO (your choice)
    1 Group Photo Op
    2 GUEST Single Photo Ops
    1 Double (GUEST or HEROES) Photo Op
    1 GUEST Meet and Greet
    Friday night's pre-party
    Saturday night's after party
    Entrance to an exclusive VIP ticket holders panel
    Access to break room (snacks and drinks provided)
    Exclusive laminated badge
    Convention Swag Bag (includes wristband/button)
    Vigilante Convention T-shirt
    Vigilante Convention Scrapbook Kit


    *V.I.P. Plus Badge - $825:

    Convention admission on Saturday and Sunday
    Assigned seats in the second  row of the theater
    1 GUEST Single Photo op
    Autographs from 4 GUESTS and 1 HERO (your choice)
    Friday night's pre-party
    Saturday night after party
    Exclusive VIP ticket holders panel
    Access to the break room (snacks and drinks provided)
    Convention Swag Bag (includes wristband/button)
    Exclusive laminated badge
    Vigilante Convention T-shirt
    Vigilante Convention Scrapbook Kit


    V.I.P. Badge - $375 $337:

    Convention admission on Saturday and Sunday
    Friday night pre-party
    Saturday night after party
    Exclusive VIP ticket holders panel
    Autographs from  4 GUESTS
    $50 photo op credit for GUEST of your choice
    Convention Swag Bag (includes wristband/button)
    *Priority Seating in the V.I.P. Section (excludes reserved seats for Ultimate V.I.P., Super V.I.P. and V.I.P. Plus)
    *Vigilante Convention T-shirt


    Preferred Badge - $250 $225:

    Convention admission on Saturday and Sunday
    Friday night pre-party
    50% off Saturday night’s after party
    Autograph from 2 GUESTS
    Convention Swag Bag (includes wristband/button)
    *Priority Seating in the Preferred section
    *Vigilante Convention t-shirt


    General Admission Badge - $150 $135

    Convention admission on Saturday and Sunday
    Friday night pre-party
    Convention swag bag (includes wristband/button)
    *Priority Seating in the General Admission section
    *Vigilante Convention t-shirt


    JUST ADDED!

    Half Vendor Table - $100

    Half Vendor Table in the Dealers Area at Vigilante Convention
    1 General Admission Ticket
    Friday night pre-party
    Convention swag bag (includes wristband/button)
    50% off Saturday night’s after party
    *Vigilante Convention t-shirt
    *Priority Seating in the General Admission section


    Full Vendor Table - $200

    Full Vendor Table in the Dealers Area at Vigilante Convention
    2 General Admission Tickets
    Friday night pre-party
    Convention swag bag (includes wristband/button)
    50% off Saturday night’s after party for 2
    *Vigilante Convention t-shirt
    *Priority Seating in the General Admission section


    Can't make it out to NYC? Here are some perks that don’t require a badge to Vigilante Convention.

    *Group photo ($125) - signed by all convention heroes and guests

    Convention DVD ($125) - videos of panels. Excludes V.I.P. exclusive panel.

    *Signed T-shirt  ($100) - signed by all convention heroes and guests

    USB Photo Package ($75) - All photos taken of the event by the official convention photographer minus photo ops and group pictures from the Meet and Greets. Will contain exclusive behind-the-scenes photos no one will have access to.

    Official Convention T-shirt ($25)

    Convention Swag Bag ($20)

    Convention Wristband and Button ($15)

    “Thank You” ($10) - post from the Official Vigilante Convention social media accounts.

    *E-hug & E-Kiss ($5)


    Sponsorship Opportunities - If you'd like to support Vigilante Convention on another level, consider being a convention sponsor. Packages range from $150 - $300.


    Silver Sponsor ($300):

    • Logo on Website
    • Logo on Convention Signage
    • Ad in the program booklet
    • Advertising tweets/posts monthly
    • Promotional material in all attendee swag bags
    • 1 General Admission Ticket
    • Priority Seating in the General Admission section
    • Vigilante Convention T-shirt
    • Access to Break Room (snacks and drinks provided)
    • Convention Swag Bag (includes wristband/button


    Bronze Sponsor ($150): Non Attending

    • Logo on Website
    • Logo on Convention Signage
    • Ad in the program booklet
    • Advertising tweets/posts monthly
    • Promotional material in all attendee swag bags
    • Vigilante Convention T-shirt
    • Convention Swag Bag


    Please email for details on international shipping.


    Other Ways You Can Help

    We know that not everyone will be able to attend or help with a small donation, but there are still things you can do to help. Share this Campaign on social media sites to help us get the word out. 

    The Vigilante Con Team thanks you for being part of a great opportunity to bring fans an amazing convention!

story:
Short Summary

Hello and thank you for giving me the chance to talk about my fantasy comic book series called Elfwood which is my first comic book project. I released a printed and digital version of Elfwood on Kickstarter back in March 2020 with 100 backers and 200 printed copies containing 21 beautifully illustrated pages. I am passionate about storytelling and creating something that is unique and unexpected. I was inspired a variety of sources such as the comic book series SAGA, LOTR, Game of Thrones and Greek and Norse mythology as well as certain historical events. Most Elf-centric fantasy stories tend to start off in the medieval period . In the fantasy community there is a love of medieval and renaissance story telling, yet I took a huge risk and developed a story that is placed during the early years of civilization when the first powerful nations are appearing. Our story focuses on two great continents divided by a massive sea. The northern continent is filled with mountainous forests and a vast cold tundra where human nomads wander, while the costal lands are dominated by a militaristic naval power called the Sea People who are the first human civilization and who live in city-states along the coast. In the warmer southern continent most elves live in primitive tribes except for the kingdom of Elfwood which is the most advanced early civilization. The elves of Elfwood live within carved out massive trees within very dense forests. The leader of the Sea people is a commander named Azari who has a lust for war. Azari was based on the Greek god Aries except more intelligent and more aggressive. The leader of Elfwood is a queen named Akara who was inspired by the greek goddesses Artimis and Athena as well as the Roman goddess Vesta. The culture of the Sea People were in part inspired by Greek and Viking naval culture, while the Elf culture was inspired by Minoan culture. Every culture in the story will feature a great wonder of some kind. In Elfwood #1 that will be represented by a great statue of the Elfwood goddess of creation.  Issue 2 will feature the Sea People's great wonder. Issue 1 focuses on the first battle in the war between humans and elves and will set-up the theme of the stories to follow. The series will later introduce other races, creatures and themes such as the Orcs, fairies and dragons as well as the discovery of magic. The elves in my story are about a foot shorter than humans, so about 4 to 5 feet, while humans range from 5 to 6 feet. Faries are about 3 inches tall and Orcs are about 6 to 7 feet tall. Our Orcs will look more like a human/orc hybrid and would be an evolutionally off shoot of the humans. 

 

The funding generated from this campaign would be used to develop Elfwood Issue #2. Our ultimate goal is to develop this into a single graphic novel telling one complete story. 

What We Need & What You Get

Developing a comic book requires a team that includes a writer, artist, cover artist(s), inker and letterer which is surprisingly costly. Since issue #1 is complete as long as this campaign is successful, you will receive a PDF copy of issue #1. With the goal amount of $250 we can develop about 8 pages into issue #2 which would be amazing and we would start developing immediately. If we raise more money than that, we will use it to develop more pages and could possibly develop variant covers. If we don't reach our goal, you will still receive a copy of issue #1 and the raised funds will be used to develop as much as we can of the next issue.

 

In order to build trust we are offering Indiegogo backers a discounted rate on the digital version of Elfwood #1 for only $3 which is a $2 discount from my Kickstarter campaign. If you want to contribute more that would be appreciated.  If you like issue #1 please note that all future digital comics will always be under $5 per issue and will be available on Indiegogo.  

Risks & Challenges

NONE. Issue 1 is 100% completed and ready to be delivered. I am 200% motivated and excited to get started on issue #2. The only risk is whether or not the backers will like the comic which is why I am offering a discounted rate of only $3. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • You can help spread the campaign on Facebook, Twitter or Instagram using the Indiegogo share tool.  If the campaign is successful and you get 100 likes on any post on Facebook, Twitter or Instagram, email me a print screen of the post showing the number of likes and I will give you a free copy of Elfwood #1. (The campaign must reach the goal amount of $250 for you to get a free copy of Elfwood). Thank you for your support!

And that's all there is to it.
story_txt:
Short Summary
Hello and thank you for giving me the chance to talk about my fantasy comic book series called Elfwood which is my first comic book project. I released a printed and digital version of Elfwood on Kickstarter back in March 2020 with 100 backers and 200 printed copies containing 21 beautifully illustrated pages. I am passionate about storytelling and creating something that is unique and unexpected. I was inspired a variety of sources such as the comic book series SAGA, LOTR, Game of Thrones and Greek and Norse mythology as well as certain historical events. Most Elf-centric fantasy stories tend to start off in the medieval period . In the fantasy community there is a love of medieval and renaissance story telling, yet I took a huge risk and developed a story that is placed during the early years of civilization when the first powerful nations are appearing. Our story focuses on two great continents divided by a massive sea. The northern continent is filled with mountainous forests and a vast cold tundra where human nomads wander, while the costal lands are dominated by a militaristic naval power called the Sea People who are the first human civilization and who live in city-states along the coast. In the warmer southern continent most elves live in primitive tribes except for the kingdom of Elfwood which is the most advanced early civilization. The elves of Elfwood live within carved out massive trees within very dense forests. The leader of the Sea people is a commander named Azari who has a lust for war. Azari was based on the Greek god Aries except more intelligent and more aggressive. The leader of Elfwood is a queen named Akara who was inspired by the greek goddesses Artimis and Athena as well as the Roman goddess Vesta. The culture of the Sea People were in part inspired by Greek and Viking naval culture, while the Elf culture was inspired by Minoan culture. Every culture in the story will feature a great wonder of some kind. In Elfwood #1 that will be represented by a great statue of the Elfwood goddess of creation.  Issue 2 will feature the Sea People's great wonder. Issue 1 focuses on the first battle in the war between humans and elves and will set-up the theme of the stories to follow. The series will later introduce other races, creatures and themes such as the Orcs, fairies and dragons as well as the discovery of magic. The elves in my story are about a foot shorter than humans, so about 4 to 5 feet, while humans range from 5 to 6 feet. Faries are about 3 inches tall and Orcs are about 6 to 7 feet tall. Our Orcs will look more like a human/orc hybrid and would be an evolutionally off shoot of the humans. 
 
The funding generated from this campaign would be used to develop Elfwood Issue #2. Our ultimate goal is to develop this into a single graphic novel telling one complete story. 

What We Need & What You Get
Developing a comic book requires a team that includes a writer, artist, cover artist(s), inker and letterer which is surprisingly costly. Since issue #1 is complete as long as this campaign is successful, you will receive a PDF copy of issue #1. With the goal amount of $250 we can develop about 8 pages into issue #2 which would be amazing and we would start developing immediately. If we raise more money than that, we will use it to develop more pages and could possibly develop variant covers. If we don't reach our goal, you will still receive a copy of issue #1 and the raised funds will be used to develop as much as we can of the next issue.

 
In order to build trust we are offering Indiegogo backers a discounted rate on the digital version of Elfwood #1 for only $3 which is a $2 discount from my Kickstarter campaign. If you want to contribute more that would be appreciated.  If you like issue #1 please note that all future digital comics will always be under $5 per issue and will be available on Indiegogo.  

Risks & Challenges
NONE. Issue 1 is 100% completed and ready to be delivered. I am 200% motivated and excited to get started on issue #2. The only risk is whether or not the backers will like the comic which is why I am offering a discounted rate of only $3. 
 

Other Ways You Can Help
Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:
You can help spread the campaign on Facebook, Twitter or Instagram using the Indiegogo share tool.  If the campaign is successful and you get 100 likes on any post on Facebook, Twitter or Instagram, email me a print screen of the post showing the number of likes and I will give you a free copy of Elfwood #1. (The campaign must reach the goal amount of $250 for you to get a free copy of Elfwood). Thank you for your support!
And that's all there is to it.

story:
Shield of The Interceptor Volume 1

The superhero action-adventure comic book mini-series is collected into a 100-page graphic novel. It mixes comic style shield slinging with Arthurian mythology and lore.  Within the Universe of Unstoppable Comics, the sword Excalibur was to be paired with a shield, but it went missing until today. Find out what happened to it, why it was made, and how did it fall into the hands of a retired athlete. If you have ever been a fan of Captain America, A Midsummer Night's Dream, action, and fantasy you may be interested in checking this book out. Check out the preview pagesbelow and the preview pages for the other graphic novels way down below.

GRAPHIC NOVELS

Here are some of the graphic novels produced by Unstoppable Comics and currently in print.

  • DRAGONSTORM: A 75-page full-color superhero ninja action story that takes place within the Unstoppable Comics Universe. If you are a fan of Nightwing or Iron fist you may be interested in this. Can be added to any perk for $15. Shipping in the U.S. is included.
  • UNSTOPPABLE ORIGINS: A 100-page full-color graphic novel that features the origin stories of 4 characters in the Unstoppable Comics Universe. One of the origins is that of the Interceptor. Can be added to any perk for $20. Shipping in the U.S. is included.
  • THE STORMCHASERS: A 104-page full-color superteam action story. Collects the 1st four issues of The Stormchasers. If you are a fan of Avengers or Justice League you may be interested in this book. Can be added to any perk for $20. Shipping in the U.S. is included.
  • THE OFFICIAL CHARACTER GUIDE OF UNSTOPPABLE COMICS: This 100-page full-color graphic novel collects biographies, stats, and powers sets to some of the most important characters in the Unstoppable Comics Universe. Makes a great companion piece to Shield of the Interceptor giving details to some of the background characters not explained in the book. If you are a fan of the classic Handbook to the Marvel Universe of DC Comics Who's Who you may be interested in this book. Can be added to any perk for $20. Shipping in the U.S. is included.

SINGLE ISSUE COMIC BOOKS

Many of the single issues in print are out of stock and have been collected into Graphic Novels. These are the single issue that remain. Many are full-color, 24-page stories but some are not and will be indicated below. Each of the single issues is $5, and that includes shipping in the U.S. Any single issue can be added on to any perk.

  • STORMCHASERS #1:  A full color, 24-page superteam action story.
  • STORMCHASERS #2:  A full color, 24-page superteam action story.
  • STORMCHASERS #3:  A full color, 24-page superteam action story.
  • STORMCHASERS #4:  A full color, 32-page superteam action story.
  • STORMCHASERS #5:  A full color, 24-page superteam action story, and the 1st appearance of The Interceptor.
  • STORMCHASERS #6:  A full color, 24-page superteam action story.
  • STORMCHASERS #7:  A full color, 24-page superteam action story.
  • New York vs The World #1: A black and white 24-page zombie story that takes place outside of the Unstoppable Comics Universe. For mature readers only.
  • New York vs The World #2: A black and white 24-page zombie story that takes place outside of the Unstoppable Comics Universe. For mature readers only.
  • Unstoppable Origins #1 Tenth anniversary edition: A full-color, 24-page comic that features 2 origin stories
  • Dragonstorm #1 Tenth anniversary edition: A full-color 24-page superhero ninja story.

TRADING CARD SET

The trading card set is at 43 total cards at the launch of the campaign.

  • The trading card set will expand with stretch goals.
  • Only the trading cards that are unlocked with stretch goals will be added to each backer with a print reward at no extra charge.
  • The complete trading card set can be added to any reward.
  • All cards are standard 2.5 x 3.5 trading card size.

T-Shirts

  • 100% preshrunk cotton
  • Sizes range from Small - XXXL
  • No extra charge/added fee for sizes XXL & XXXL
  • Can be added to any reward.

Risks & Challenges

There are always risks and challenges in everything we do. This is my 16th Crowdfunding project, and in the time I've spent self-publishing comic books I have experienced printing and shipping delays, creative differences, and people dropping out of a project in the middle of production. These are things that have happened and will always happen. That is why I have tried to limit as many of the x-factors on this campaign as possible, by starting first with an art production team that knows and has worked with each other for years. As I said many times before, this book is already made, all we have to do is print it up. I hope to limit as many mistakes in printing and shipping as possible. I have found out there is always a snag or two that will happen. Aside from that, I hope our library and past campaign success and fulfillment speaks for itself in regards to the quality of our comic books.

Stretch Goals

All stretch goals automatically added to print perks at no extra charge

  • Card #44 unlocked at $2,000
  • Card #45 unlocked at $2,500
  • Card #46 unlocked at $3,000

Why make a superhero comic book?

Because I have a story to tell. My love and passion for comic books growing up drove me to put new spins on some of the characters and stories I read growing up. What if, Elseworlds and even Amalgam comics showed me there are great ways to take the classic concepts in a new direction and still stay true to the source material. If you look hard enough into Unstoppable Comics you may be able to identify some of those very sources of material. I am here to have fun and entertain you as much as myself.  I feel Superheroes are a modern-day form of mythology and even though there are other companies doing it longer there is still space to add to it.

Who is on the creative team?

Brandon Easton/Writer: Brandon's talent as a writer has landed him credits on some pretty strong geek cred properties such as Transformers: War for Cybertron, Thundercats (2011), and Peggy Carter: Agent of Shield in television. In the realm of comics, Brandon has done work at Lion Forge and now DC.

Jay Dee Rosario/Writer: For the last 10 years JayDee has been self-publishing comic books. He has written comics for Unstoppable Comics such as Stormchasers, New York vs. The World, and Dragonstorm. 

Russ Leach/Illustrator: The professional credits of  Russ Leach have taken him to some of the A list properties of pop culture. His range of work includes Ben 10 Magazine for Cartoon Network, drawing licensed Marvel characters for Marvel/Hachettes 'Draw The Marvel Way' and a run penciling and inking Doctor Who strips for the BBC in Panini UK's 'Doctor Who Adventures' Magazine.

Andres Barrero/Illustrator: Andres has had his talents shine over at Zenescope, and contributed to some of the most exciting comic books from Unstoppable Comics such as Shield of the Interceptor, New York vs Te World, and The Stormchasers.

Michael Summers/ Colorist: Michael Summers has been coloring comic books since 2010, and just about all the books from Unstoppable Comics have been worked on by him. This includes Shield of The Interceptor, Dragonstorm, Unstoppable Origins, New York vs. The World, and Stormchasers.

story:
Short Summary

Hello Bedheads and potential Bedheads!  My name is Shaun Davis, and welcome to our Pillowman and Blanketboy Second Chance Campaign.  Because a lot of you missed the original Indiegogo campaign, my son Parker(creator and co-writer) and myself wanted to make sure you had another chance at grabbing a copy of this amazing graphic novel for your own.

The word of mouth on our original successful comic campaign has been phenomenal and because of that, we decided to do this second chance campaign.  We want EVERYONE to have a chance to get a copy of Pillowman and Blanketboy!

Each tier will come with the original stretch goals from our previous campaign. This includes our awesome trading card and snazzy bookmark.

We have some stock still available from overprints of the original campaign, however if we sell more than what is on hand we will do another printing (which would be awesome).

                                                                                  MAIN COVER

PILLOW MAN AND BLANKETBOY: MAXIMUM VELOCITY is a 64 page square bound graphic novel and is printed in the United States. The quality on this book is top of the line and can not be beat! Don't believe us, ask our last backers.

                                                                              INSIDE PAGES

For the first and last time, we will offer this very rare PENCIL SKETCH VIRGIN COVER of the regular Pillowman and Blanketboy cover! This cover is only available with this campaign and will not be reprinted. This cover has never been offered so it is required that it be printed.

Behind the Idea

Children have insanely wild imaginations and my son Parker is no exception. When he came to me over ten years ago with the original concept of Pillowman and Blanketboy I thought it was just the ravings of a three year old. Boy was I wrong. His ideas and stories have only grown and grown since then. We are excited to share with you, PILLOWMAN AND BLANKETBOY: MAXIMUM VELOCITY!

With your help and generosity of funding this book, we will give you a story that you will enjoy for long time and also help us give you more Pillowman and Blanketboy comics in the near future!

Meet the Team

My name is Shaun Davis and I am the artist, letterer and co-writer for Pillowman and Blanketboy. I am a father who is turning his thirteen year old son's ideas into reality. 

Parker Davis is my thirteen year old son and he is the brains behind the whole operation and also happens to be a co-writer. Without him there would be no Pillowman and Blanketboy.

Rajesh Kumar is a phenomenal colorist and a fantastic person.  There's nothing this guy can't color.  I thank him for making my art look good!

The Impact

We want you to enjoy Pillowman and Blanketboy as much as we do. These stories are for all ages but that doesn’t mean it’s just for kids. Adults will enjoy it as well. Making Pillowman and Blanketboy a household name is something that we hope to do, and with your help we will!

story:
Short Summary

Hello, world, my name Is Isomidin (you may call me Iso) and I'm writer currently working on one interesting comics series in manga style... "Kunai"

Who is Kunai? His full name is Kunai Obama, he's 14 years old, lives with his grandma and is a son of great scientists couple who were murdered by mighty alien - Iblisius.  Kunai struggles to defeat him and stop his mighty evil plans to conquer the Earth. Supported by aliens he struggles to defeat Iblisius and other villains. Actions will take place worldwide (Paris, New-York, Washington, Beijing, our city so on). Various aliens will try to stop or help Kunai and each part will be original, have own microuniverse of unique actions, decisions and characters. 

I live in beautiful country - Kyrgyzstan, in it's oldest city - Osh. We have lots of interesting stories to tell the world and "Kunai" is one of them. 

This is my first comics project. Previously I worked as journalist, media creator, screenwriter in  local filmmaking industry. This comics hooked me seriously like first love :) 


Each episode will be relised weekly.


Hundreds of talented artists struggle here, our economics is too low to allow them all find jobs and make self-realisation. So, I gathere a small creative group and we gonna create several comics series and several films. We want to inspire others to create astonishing stories, suuport young artists, writers, actors, in other words - grow own Spielbergs, Sorkins and Millers :)

Your help means a lot for us. Each $, share, like, attention will greatly affect to our plans :)

What We Need & What You Get

Let Kunai show you our plans for spending cash:

We calculated that at least 3000$ will be enough for us to work&create 1 year along! Impressive, yeah? In our country you can live like that :) 

At present time we can't offer you various T-shirts and other physical perks, but we have plans to work with Amazon that can produce that stuff and we will notice each of our backer. We live so far away from USA and Europe that we can operate with only digital stuff :)

Every backer will receive digital copy of this manga comics signed by me and our lead visual artist Sai Hirosaki (it's his mangaka nickname, real name is Suyun).  

 

Sai Hirosaki (Suyun Bayzakov, he's on right, on the left - our producer Nurlan) Yup, we are working in kinda shoes shop, soon will move to studio...

No matter how much funds we will get we won't stop and spend each $ to make our dreams come true.

Risks & Challenges

We are not selling specific gadgets and  apps... and wont dissappear with your funds like ninjas... We love what we are doing and wont give up. 
We are making comics and will sell you it's digital copies that can be easly sent to your mail boxes...just in one click :) 

I believe in God and this God doesnt like frauds. There may be one risk, yeah... It's a risk to fall in DEEP FREAKING LOVE with comics and, of course, you can easily be infected :)

Other Ways You Can Help

You can hel us by not only funds, but sharing on social media and among friends about this incredibly interesting project :)  Our city Osh is beautiful and is very old (3000 years) with one astonishing mountain at the center - Sulaiman-Too (Solomon's Mountain). You are always welcome here, visit us, see and taste it's unique meals, places so on :)

First part will be published this Fall.
Thank you for attention. We will be glad for any feedback about our project and this campaign. 
Cheers :) And let me finish by this...

"Even the tiny flower can stand against mighty thunder..."

PS: You can see some parts of 1 episode which is ready and waitin your order :)
