So, I gathere a small creative group and we gonna create several comics series and several films. We want to inspire others to create astonishing stories, suuport young artists, writers, actors, in other words - grow own Spielbergs, Sorkins and Millers :)Your help means a lot for us. Each $, share, like, attention will greatly affect to our plans :)What We Need & What You GetLet Kunai show you our plans for spending cash:We calculated that at least 3000$ will be enough for us to work&create 1 year along! Impressive, yeah? In our country you can live like that :) At present time we can't offer you various T-shirts and other physical perks, but we have plans to work with Amazon that can produce that stuff and we will notice each of our backer. We live so far away from USA and Europe that we can operate with only digital stuff :)Every backer will receive digital copy of this manga comics signed by me and our lead visual artist Sai Hirosaki (it's his mangaka nickname, real name is Suyun).   Sai Hirosaki (Suyun Bayzakov, he's on right, on the left - our producer Nurlan) Yup, we are working in kinda shoes shop, soon will move to studio...No matter how much funds we will get we won't stop and spend each $ to make our dreams come true.Risks & ChallengesWe are not selling specific gadgets and  apps... and wont dissappear with your funds like ninjas... We love what we are doing and wont give up. We are making comics and will sell you it's digital copies that can be easly sent to your mail boxes...just in one click :) I believe in God and this God doesnt like frauds. There may be one risk, yeah... It's a risk to fall in DEEP FREAKING LOVE with comics and, of course, you can easily be infected :)Other Ways You Can HelpYou can hel us by not only funds, but sharing on social media and among friends about this incredibly interesting project :)  Our city Osh is beautiful and is very old (3000 years) with one astonishing mountain at the center - Sulaiman-Too (Solomon's Mountain). You are always welcome here, visit us, see and taste it's unique meals, places so on :)First part will be published this Fall.Thank you for attention. We will be glad for any feedback about our project and this campaign. Cheers :) And let me finish by this..."Even the tiny flower can stand against mighty thunder..."PS: You can see some parts of 1 episode which is ready and waitin your order :)

story:
NOTE: GRAVEYARD WATCH IS NOT a story for children. It's violent, a bit-gory, includes adult themes and characters die often and horrifically. If you are looking for a comic for your kids this is NOT the book. 

 

GRAVEYARD WATCH :: OVERVIEW

This world's generation of superheroes are apotheosized. But their super powered children struggle to live up to there god-like expectations.  Book One is an 140+ page epic written by Ouroboros, drawn by Nguyen  lettered by Eric Weathers. 

 

STORY

The Paragon, is the most powerful and premier superhero team. Protecting the world from both domestic and planetary threats being the world's peacekeepers.

But a decades ago, Tartarus an authoritarian organization bent on world domination. Abducts the Paragons children. To then mysteriously vanish for years. For them to later return as the world’s most infamous super-villains destabilizing countries overnight.

Following the events of an alien invasion. The members of the Paragon continued to dwindle. While their children continue psychological treatment from their years of brainwashing. 

Emma Faden was the super-heroine Almaaz, and now a deceased member of the Paragon. Her son Simon Faden (Qbyte/Kyuubit) has become a cunning and calculated force of nature. Than he is charming. When he decides to leave the Paragon, with his flamboyant and solipsistic sweetheart, Harnabella. As they come into conflict with the Vietnamese superhero community. Which coincidentally coincides with the detonation of a nuclear bomb and the mass-culling of superhumans. Being investigated by the countries Nightcrawler.

Can Simon live up to the legacy of his parents and their sacrifice? Being the hero he was always meant to be, making the world a better place? Or can we only hope that he is…

ILLUSTRATIONS & PAGES

 

 

(Sample Artwork)

(Sample Artwork)

(Sample Artwork)

 

Team:

 

Ouroboros Moon: Writer

I'm not even a main character.  

 

Eric Weathers: Letterer

Eric Weathers has helped bring to life many indie comics including Jawbreakers, Graveyard Shift, Red Rooster, Earthworm Jim, Downcast, Brutas the Badass, Doomkicker, Gunship Thunder Punch, The Good Knight, Ravage Kill All Men, Off Worlder, Monster M.D.and many, many more!

 

Paul Bilick: Colorist

Colorist Wizard Supreme

Patrick Nguyen​: Artist

I'm not a professional painter/illustrator or have an outstanding mind. But time will tell me who I really am, and what I need to do.

 

 

STRETCH GOAL VARIANT COVERS

 

Artist: Caanan White

 

Artist:  Zawaru

 

WHY DOES THIS BOOK COST 8.4K TO FUND?

 

Creating comic books is a very complex and meticulous process involving multiple skill sets. The process begins with a script from the writer. From then, an artist spends hours illustrating just one page. Now comes in the colorist, who spends as much time on a page filling in colors. To the letterer, who carefully places the dialogue bubbles, captions, and effects. 

In full transparency, the $15,000 goal is set to cover the creative teams rate across all 140 pages, and a small print run. That's it. Meaning the colors, letterers and printings are paid for in this total.

STRETCH GOALS

With increased funding simply means our customers are helping to build a better book. The goals we have are as follows:

$8,400: The one-hundred and forty page book is completely funded, which includes a digital copy of the book and my previous book WICKED.

$15,000: The one-hundred and forty page book will have colors. 

$20,750: Variant cover prints by Caanan White or Zawaru will be made avaiable!

$25,950:  Brett Booth (@Demonpuppy) artwork!

$30,450: Interior paper upgrade.

 

REFERRAL CONTEST:

PLEASE READ CAREFULLY

A referral contest rewards the referrer who brings in additional backers or funding. Because my campaign’s dashboard allows for me to track referrals through the insights tab. I'm able to see the Indiegogo users who are directing traffic to my campaign in terms of the number of contributions to the project.

For a backer to count as a referrer, they must promote this campaign with Indiegogo’s share tools while logged into their Indiegogo account. This is important because otherwise, your unique ID won’t be attached to any resulting contributions or visits.

For example: When Funder A is logged into their account and uses Indiegogo’s share tools to send a tweet, the link in the tweet includes Funder A’s unique ID. Then, when Funder B reads the tweet and clicks through the link to contribute, Funder A is recognized as helping bring in the amount contributed by Funder B and traffic.

IMPORTANT NOTES:

  • REFERRERS MUST ALSO BE BACKERS, TO RECEIVE THE REWARD!
  • The person who clicked on the referral link must immediately make a contribution after clicking on the referral link. If they visit other pages or websites or leave and come back to the campaign later to contribute, their contribution will not be counted as a referral.

REFERRAL CONTEST STIPULATIONS:

  • Whichever contributors generates the most traffic will win a prize, from the prize pool. Where they will choose which item that they want at the end of the campaign (first come, first serve). Items are limited. 
  • REFERRERS MUST ALSO BE BACKERS/CONTRIBUTORS TO THIS CAMPAIGN!

PRIZE POOL:

  • To the Abandoned Sacred Beasts: Volumes One to Seven (1x)
  • Priest: Volume Four to Fifteen  (1x)
  • Dead Mount Death Play (1x) + The Elder Sister Like-One (1x) + Ascenders #1 (1x) + Batman Curse of White Knight#1 (1x) + DR.STONE VOLUME 1 + Batman Last Knight on Earth (1x) 
  •  GANGSTA VOL 1 + 2 + RESET (VOLUME) 
  • Drifters Volumes 1 to 3 + Lone Wolf & Cub Hardcover
  • Durarara Volumes 1 to 4 + Duararara Sakie Arc Volumes 1 to 3 + Durarara Yellow Scarves Arc 1 + 3
  • HELLSING VOLUME 1 to 7 + Made in the Abyss Volume 1 + APOSMIZ Volume 1

 

Your support now will be the foundation for the future of this comic universe!

 

I want to make this superhero comic book universe into something that reaches the masses. I have a series of story arcs I want to write that'll expand hundreds of issues. However the universe and some characters need to be established before those stories can begin. But for now GRAVEYARD WATCH will be the jumping off point, for this universe. 

 

GRAVEYARD WATCH: BOOK 1 - STANDING ON A MILLION LIVES PART 1 - NIGHT AFTER DARK

GRAVEYARD WATCH: BOOK 2 - STANDING ON A MILLION LIVES PART 2 - HEAT OF NIGHT

GRAVEYARD WATCH: BOOK 3 - STANDING ON A MILLION LIVES PART 3 - STILL OF NIGHT

GRAVEYARD WATCH: BOOK 4 - STANDING ON A MILLION LIVES PART 4 - GOODNIGHT WORLD

These stories will all be out based on your support for this project. We would also like to find a good home to distribute our books. To a wider audience so feel free to reach out if you'd like to help spread this book to the masses.

 

After the campaign

 

I put my team together to avoid a lot of issues that are seen with crowdfunding like insane delays, items not being shipped out, the money being funded and the book not coming out two or three years. However I'm going to keep our rewards and stretch goals simple so that we can get the book out. The money you donate will go straight into the book!

Support Us

If you can't donate but want to help us out follow me on social media @Ouroboros_Moon on Twitter, and share this campaign and help get the word out!

story:
"CyberPunk Style" is a Cyberpunk genre comic style art book. 40+ Pages of beautiful art Illustrated by Mike Stewart (Top Cow, ImagineFX) Size 5.83x8.27 in (A5), the artwork within is black and white & full color. 

This has a lot more full color pages (Half the book) than any book before; with ALL NEW art specifically made for this book. Every page is of a cyberpunk setting and character. Some of them include fanart of The Witcher's Geralt, the Rebel Terminator, Ghost in the Shell, Aeon Flux and many original creations.

Short Summary

  • Hi my name is Mike Stewart I am an Iraq war veteran and professional comic book artist. My main skills are in fully illustrated stories, pinups, and pages using tried and true methods of storytelling learned from great masters such as Jack Kirby, Joseph Campbell, Robert E. Howard, and Edgar Rice Burroughs. I have watched as the major companies for the most part lost the heart and soul of their storytelling and became slaves to the corporate masters that now control most of the media. I am simply a humble artist that is sharing the love of a great genre (Cyber Punk) with you.
  • Completing the campaign will provide the necessary force to expedite the fruition of the upcoming graphic novel and concepted card game that I wish to share with you.

What We Need & What You Get

  • In order to print and ship the books, our minimum funding goal must be met.
  • The Artbook will be at the very least 40 pages and more to be added as well. If the funding exceeds our goal then pages will continue to be added until the campaign ends.

The Impact

  • Backing this project helps us to continue to create for you without the confines of major corporate companies and the restrictions of politics thereof.
  • We have successfully funded and sent out orders to all of the backers of our previous campaigns and look forward to providing the same support to our backers for this one.
  • Backing this book helps support all future projects including the upcoming graphic novel to be released thereafter.

Risks & Challenges

  • Having successfully completed several campaigns for books before; we are now ready to print and ship all of your rewards as soon as they arrive hot from the printers.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Share this page on social media and tell friends and family about how cool it is.
  • Email the page to people. 
  • Show pics or videos of the book or items once you receive them. 

If you can't contribute, don't worry you can still help!

Note: The printed book will contain uncensored mild nudity. Recommended for mature audiences only.

Having successfully completed several campaigns for books before; we are now ready to print and ship all of your rewards as soon as they arrive hot from the printers.

story:
HTB is a brand new graphic novel from Taurian Films and Jigsaw Entertainment. 

It’s the tale of Vanessa Bachman, an assassin for hire whose latest target gets her mixed up with the feds and an underworld organization. This forces her to seek help from the internet friend she vowed never to meet in person.

The book will use the likeness of actress Annie Cruz for the title character in a story that will be an action packed, dramatic thrill ride for the reader.

Who is Annie Cruz you ask?

Actress, model, media personality, gamer, comic book geek, all around kick butt kind of woman.

Why do we want to produce this book?

It's an original character with a strong female lead that writer, Bj Lewis has had on his mind for years and has worked with his brother Jermaine Spencer to develop. It is long overdue that strides are taken to produce and publish the book and share the story with Cruz fans and comic book fans far and wide.

Wait, who is this Bj Lewis guy?

He's a lot of things beyond the creator and writer of HTB. He was a newspaper reporter for 10 years before taking a private sector communications job. Outside of that 9 to 5 grind, Bj is filmmaker who has produced web series and short films and continues to script more projects with the hope and goal of producing them all. The projects Bj has done to this point (writing, filming, editing) have been budgeted by whatever Bj can scrape together and goes to show how Bj can stretch a dollar, important for a campaign like this.

And Jermaine Spencer?

Attended film school at Clark Atlanta University, since college Jermaine has worked on a plethora of diverse projects including short films, music videos and reality television programs produced by BET and Viacom.

What We Need & What You Get..?

What we need is simple. We need the funds to pay the artist who will wield the pencil on the book, David Jaxon. Every panel of this book that has Annie's character has to look like Annie or else, what is the point right? Jaxon has been illustrating comics for 17 years and we feel he is the man to the art for the main HTB story.

Who is David Jaxon you ask?

David Jaxon is a comic book artist born in Chicago Illinois. Jaxon pencils and inks sequentials as well as pinups and character designs for fellow independent writers/creators. Jaxon has been illustrating comics for 17 years. Some of his most recent work ranging from 2017-2018 includes: "Red Talon" issue 1 for Flatworld Comics, "Armed n Danger'Russ" issues 1-4 and "Wandering Monkey" issues 1-5 for 15 Year Comics, "Crossfire" issue 2 for Splotch Comics, "Xob" issue 1 for Taurus Comics, issue 1 of "The Teddy Bear Legion", and dozens of others some to be announced.

This campaign is all or nothing.

We will get no part of the support funds if the goal is not met. But we have every bit of hope, belief and confidence that we will meet the goals set forth. All it takes is $5, nay $1 from you even and we can make it happen.

Risks & Challenges

Look at the numbers on how many crowdfunding campaigns fail. Heck, we crashed and burned the first time we tried to raise funds for this project, The risk of failure is high, but we think our project is worth it. The challenge of course is to get everyone else to think that as well, to wade through all the other things people have going on in their lives to be able to give us a few minutes and to see if after those few minutes that they want to help us.

It's all or nothing. If we don't hit the goal we don't get anything  and the book has another roadblock in the way of production. As stated,  it's happened before trying to make this book happen, but we will try and try again until we succeed because we believe in the story and we believe people will see what we see, a great story, a great character, amazing art and their time and money invested to be well spent.

Other Ways You Can Help

All it takes to help us spread the word is the click of a button. 

If you aren't in a position to support HTB directly right now, you can still click your mouse.

Share it on Facebook, Twitter, through e-mails, message boards, any and every way you communicate with people. Let's get as many people seeing this campaign as we can and we can increase the chances of meeting the goal!

story:
This corner of the world has a rich tradition, an impressive chestful of stories leading back thousands of years. Traditionally, the stories were said late at night, at the mouth of the stove, at the end of the working day or when the frost cracked the stones - and usually the audience was basically the younger and less experienced part of the family. The stories contained parables - examples - contained a "moral", a key point that brought the light into a situation otherwise tangled or hard to grasp. Good always defeats evil. The wretch gathers bitter fruits. Being brave can get you half the kingdom (all inclusive package, princess and all). Stories have the gift of continuing a community's moral thread, organically transmitting the fundamental, positive values, information and experiences necessary for community's survival in to the future.

Nemuritorii - (The Immortals) - are a set of positive characters (and their villainous counterparts) roaming about the land and having awesome adventures and glorious victories (or defeats). All told using traditional, archaic and regional dialects, using a clean drawing style and staying away from all the bells and whistles of modern comics. The book is published in Romania, but we can ship anywhere in the world to Romanian readers.

This campaign is all about Issue 1, featuring Greuceanu, a hero credited with returning the sun and moon after being snatched by a Zmeu - a troublesome mythical creature with humanoid feature and crafting abilities.

The first story arc, i.e. the first 6 issues, will introduce 3 heroes and 3 villains and as in all traditional comics, the series will rely heavily on the constant battle between good and evil set in a fictional land - borrowing visual cues from folklore and local architecture.

The main characters are archetypal - Prâslea, as the younger brother and less experienced in battle is the perfect trope for an unlikely hero.

Greuceanu - known for  his bravery and super human strength and instantly recognized because of his unique sword .

Capcaunu' - a rather creepy human with the ability to turn into whatever animal he wants, is an established image of evil in it's pure, lonely, and abysmal form. Reasoning with this chap leads nowhere and most who dare cross his path and engage in a fight  often lose - miserably.

Muma Padurii - a really nasty piece of work. Reigns supreme over the Dark Forest, plants, animals,,,passers trough... Really good cook, though! If you're into weird looking meals that is.  Her food can turn you into a frog. Or a log. Or a decent looking stone version of yourself (with you inside it).

Ileana Cosanzeana - a compassionate and brave girl, Ileana is the archetype for beauty and kindness. She can handle a sword and knows her way around bows and arrows as well.

 

Here is a reward breakdown:

Signed Nemuritorii Issue One and 6-12 months subscriptions

East European Comic Con 2018 Full Pass

East European Comic Con 2018 Friday Pass

T-shirts

 

Posters with the first story arc heroes and villains:

Greuceanu Figurine 3d Printed

 

Why Crowdfunding

Printing a comic book is relatively cheap - but not cheap enough for a start-up company. Before we even considering going to print, we need fonts, software, a bit of hardware to help finish the project before the end of the century. Administrative/management related issues need to be addressed as well before sending the books to the customer. We need to protect our work  and brand properly as well (regardless the fact that we're basing the series on folklore - that's free - art is not).

There is a BD market in Romania. It just needs you.

People like stories, and they will always do. But when people who illustrate the stories depend on the people who sell their books - among other equally ridiculous aspects of modern life - comic books get made, experience a rather short life, fill their pages with advertising (we all dislike that) and then disappear. 

There's always a market for stories, in particular in this compressed, easy to read format (and enjoyable too, since thye're illustrated). So let's try this!

 

Keep close

Updates are pending. Awesome stuff coming soon!

 

Thank you!

story:
Black Emerald is written by Matthew Kayal and drawn by John Dillard.  Matthew Kayal has been an independent publishing writer for ten years and John Dillard is the artist/youtuber from John Dillard Gaming the System.  Together they've made a story about a young woman accused of being something that she denies.  Born out of the Gothic Horror genre with doppelgangers, intolerance, and strict moral codes playing out in a modern setting.  

What We Need & What You Get

This is where the Indiegogo comes in:

  • The comic is DONE.  We need $500 to cover costs of shipping, printing, and advertising the book.
  • Do you want some of the original art?  Check out that rewards tier.
  • If we don't reach our goal, we can still honor the rewards because this is a victory lap because the book is DONE.

The Impact

  • If you like Gothic Horror, you'll like this.  If you like Psychodrama, you'll love what we're working on.  
  • Matthew Kayal has been a self publisher for years and John Dillard has been a rising star on YouTube consistently doing great art.
  • If we succeed beyond the goal, the team can go on to make more things.  Starting with a BONUS story that the contributors can appear in and receive with their copy of Black Emerald.

Risks & Challenges

  • There are very few challenges with this campaign.  The book is DONE.  Once the campaign is over, all the contributors will receive their rewards promptly.  

Other Ways You Can Help

If you would like to help but can't share some money here's what you can do:

  • Share us on Facebook!  
  • Tweet out a link!
  • Indiegogo has share tools!

story:
The Comic Wars!

  • Written and Drawn by Zoran Puljic'
  • Edited by Dan Marshall
  • Published by Atlantic Comics

The Comic Wars shows your favorite creators in the roles of their own creations as they fight to save Comicsville from Captain Snowflake!

What We Need & What You Get

We are seeking $1500 to get this comic printed and in your hands!

  • For $8 you will get the 26 pg comic book.
  • For $12 we will include an 11x17 poster!
  • $15 gets you 2 copies of the book!
  • $22 gets you 2 books and 2 posters!

 

e t

This is your chance to own a piece of history! This once in a lifetime opportunity is a must for your collection! 

Risks & Challenges

Please keep in mind that standard shipping rates apply. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Feel free to Spread the word around by sharing this  campaign on social media.

Follow us on Twitter  and Check us out on our website

story:
Story

A group of valiant warriors will use to power of the Dragon Eye to declare war on the Slayers that threaten their lands.  Dragonmasters Issue 1 is a 32 page full color comic each backer that purchases a copy will get a special map of Dragonia and trading card. This is going to be a huge Ongoing series similar to Masters of the Universe but with Dragons.

 

Comic

Figures

 

Map Of Dragonia

Mind Meld With DragonMasters’ Carlos Farias!

One Man Show: Carlos Farias Releases DragonMasters Through Wicked Comics

Carlos Farias is the creator, writer and artist of the recently released DragonMasters #1. DragonMasters is the third title he’s self-published through his company, Wicked Comics. It was a pleasure to talk with Carlos about his inspiration for DragonMasters, character design and worldbuilding, the struggles of indie creators, creative collaboration with fans, DIY action figure production and much more!

JR: How long have you been creating comics, and what made you want to start? What’s the Wicked Comics origin story?

CF: I started about three years ago. The plan was to stay one hundred percent independent and to try to create new ideas and stories. If you look at the market, lot of the books out there are the same characters doing same things over and over. I want to create new stories, new ideas and new characters. I see a lot of people who do the same superhero-type invincible hero. I just feel like there’s always room for different ideas.

JR: You are credited with character design, story and art on DragonMasters. Do you collaborate with anyone on the Wicked Comics titles, or are you a one man show?

CF: It’s pretty much a one man show. I do all the writing, developing the characters, artwork and coloring. That’s why sometimes it takes me a little bit longer to launch a title.

JR: I’m finding out when I interview creators that music often plays a huge inspirational role in their work and creative process. You’ve released three books up to this point: the first, ClownMan, about a clown vigilante, the second, KillSwitch, about a criminal who becomes a super soldier, and your most recent, DragonMasters, featuring a world of wizards, knights, barbarians, magic and dragons as well as advanced technology. Out of personal interest I have to ask: do you listen to hard rock or heavy metal music?

CF: It depends on the title. Definitely music plays a role in each story. As far as ClownMan, I see it as a dark underground world. The type of music that fits with it is almost like industrial rock because ClownMan was inspired by The Crow and the Joker. The same goes for KillSwitch. The music is more of a scientific or futuristic soundtrack. DragonMasters is definitely fantasy. I listen to a lot of fantasy type music in the vein of Conan, Masters of the Universe and Dungeons & Dragons. A lot of that played a role. It’s fantasy music like instrumentals. For DragonMasters I type in fantasy music and try to put myself in that world.

JR: So you search by music theme?

CF: Yeah, for ClownMan I’ll search for creepy carnival music. It helps a bit if you’re running into a blank, you hear something and it might spark a new idea.

JR: ClownMan and KillSwitch are both dark, gritty superheroes. DragonMasters is your new book. What made you want to depart from this theme to do a heroic fantasy book? 

CF: I didn’t want to be typecast as always doing the same thing, or want people to think, “Oh this guy’s a dark person.” As far as the company goes, I want as much variety as I can get. DragonMasters is a fantasy book that’s not your standard comic book character. In the future, you’ll see I even have a cartoon character. So there will be a variety of books, not just superhero titles.

JR: So that allows you to find the audience for Wicked Comics?

CF: Right! It helps get a variety of people interested. For a single book, maybe people with certain interests will be drawn to that story. A good variety of ideas and stories will help to bring a bigger audience to my creations.

JR: Please tell readers a bit about the world of DragonMasters and how the book came to be.

CF: It was always in the back of my head. I wanted to create this fantasy land. The story takes place in a world called Dragonia. How it came about is that I’m really big into Star Wars. I always liked that conflict between the Jedi and Sith. This is my twist on that but in a world of dragons. There are even crazy backstories for each Slayer and each Master. You can keep going into this world and finding out more about each character.

 

JR: Is this title going to be an ongoing series?

CF: Yeah, that’s the plan. You’re gonna see certain relationships between the Masters and the Slayers in the upcoming issues. You’ll see things between them that you never saw coming. There will be plenty of twists and turns in the story. There’s also going to be all kinds of races like cat warriors. So yeah, all kinds of stuff!

JR: One aspect I think fans will be excited about is the mix of technology and fantasy in DragonMasters. What made you decide to incorporate science fiction technology?

CF: I wanted to throw a curve to the fantasy world. Take Conan the Barbarian for example, it’s strictly fantasy-based. But in DragonMasters, the Masters have their sanctuary called the Lair. When they bring in new Masters, they train them with a hologram dragon. They can practice and become better dragon slayers. So that’s the idea – to combine the technology aspect with swords and fantasy. It adds a different feeling to the story. Maybe there will be battles with Slayers armed with high tech guns but also with swords. There might also be special technology to capture dragons.

JR: One of the most interesting, unique and original characters in DragonMasters is the Emperor. What can you tell readers about him?

CF: See the design of that character? See how he runs off of tubes that go into his body? He runs off of the blood of dead kings. He’s a ten thousand-year-old dragon slayer. But because he has that blood running through him, he remains young and powerful. It all has to do with rejuvenation. The blood that flows through him gives him his power. The dark side of the Dragon Eye also gives him power. The Dragon Eye in Dragonia is like a religious symbol that has powers. If you’re an evil dark person, it gives you dark power. If you’re a good person, you use the good side of the Dragon Eye. It’s almost like something you channel.

 

JR: The Kickstarter campaign for DragonMasters #1 is currently live. What would you say to anyone undecided or on the fence about backing the Kickstarter to convince them to get on board?

CF: For each comic I release, I try to do a Kickstarter for it. I haven’t funded through Kickstarter, but people purchase the books on their own. I would say to them that DragonMasters is unique and different. It brings a new world of fantasy to readers. It combines technology, dragons and dragon slaying. There’s tons of battles, and there’s going to be many characters each with their own identity and backstory. It’s going to be something that I feel like will continue for a long time, somewhat similar to Masters of the Universe.

JR: Many times it’s difficult for indie creators to complete books and bring them to market. They have to face a number of obstacles including getting enough time to work on them outside their day jobs, family obligations, problems with printers, finding the money to pay for print runs and just the motivation to keep going and finish the project. Are there any challenges you’ve faced on the road to bringing DragonMasters and the other Wicked Comics books to fans?

CF: Oh absolutely! Definitely motivation. What motivates someone to keep on going? Maybe they’re not seeing a lot of outcome from it, or not really making making a good living from it. To me it’s the fans. They write to me and say, “I’m looking forward to this title. When’s this title coming out?” That’s what keeps me going. Time is also hard to find sometimes. I spend so many hours working on titles. It’s endless. The hardest part is developing the story and coming up with the designs of the characters. A lot of times the first design of a character isn’t the finalized design. It takes me a long time to finally get the right look for each character.

JR: You’ve had great success in soliciting fan art of Wicked Comics characters from the artist community. I was listening to another interview where you said that some of the art you received even inspired you as you were creating later iterations of the ClownMan character. Can you tell readers more about this?

CF: Absolutely! The first iteration of ClownMan was almost like a cartoon, not how you see him now. I got some fan art from from an artist named Frank Soto. He drew ClownMan realistically, almost like The Crow. With that I kept on redesigning. A lot of the changes I make come directly from the fans. The public – they’re the ones who dictate whether the character is going to be successful or not. I always listen to what they say.

JR: Can you tell readers a bit more about what you’re doing with toy design and the Wicked Comics action figures?

CF: A friend of mine who I met on Facebook was getting into making molds at home. We thought it would be a cool idea to bring these creations to life as figures. We brainstormed and came up with different ideas on how to do it. I sculpt the figure from clay, and then I make a mold out of it. I pour plastic into the mold, and then I paint them all by hand. I make the packaging, design it on the computer, print it and glue it on the boards.

JR: So you’re doing all the sculpting, mold making and casting for the toys as well as creating the comics? How do you have any time to sleep!?

CF: Yeah, every day there’s something to do. I also do all the trailers. I do all the mail-outs. So I basically do everything.

JR: Many comic shops have a special section for local and indie comics. I think it would be awesome to see a Wicked Comics mini-display featuring your books and action figures together so customers see the whole immersive world you’ve created. Have you thought about getting any shops interested in something like this?

CF: You know, actually I did. I went to two different shops here in Florida, but they weren’t too inviting. This was when I released ClownMan. They seemed disinterested. But it’s part of the whole thing. I know that success doesn’t come overnight.

JR: Maybe now that you have a few more titles under your belt as well as the figures, shops will start to take notice and show some interest. All the struggling shops out there need something local, different and unique to pull in customers and differentiate themselves from the competition. Are you doing any comic book shop signings or tabling at convention artist alleys to promote and sell Wicked Comics?

CF: I did one comic con so far. It was Hero Hype in Miami. It was a small con, but I sold a few books there. A few of the fans who bought books there, I still keep in contact with them. One guy comes to my house every time I release a new book! But I was planning on doing a convention in April called Ultracon. So you might see me there with ClownMan, KillSwitch and DragonMasters.

JR: Where can fans find out more about Wicked Comics and DragonMasters online?

CF: Just Go to www.wicked-comics.com. The site has a comics section and right now I have DragonMasters on pre-order. I haven’t gotten the print copies yet, but I should have them soon. You can purchase the pdf of DragonMasters. You can also purchase pdfs and print comics of KillSwitch and ClownMan. I also have a section for the figures.

JR: Are you linking the DragonMasters pre-order to the KickStarter now?

CF: On the bottom, I always have the current Kickstarter that’s live. I do the Kickstarters more for people to check out the company and the characters. You have to get your name out there. I use it as a way just so people can see my artwork and stories.

JR: Thank you so much for taking the time to talk with me today! If you’re up for it, I look forward to interviewing you again when you release your next title.

CF: Yeah, absolutely!

Interview by: James Ross

Look out for other  Wicked Titles

Challenges

Our biggest difficulty is creating something that was original and we think that this character has the potential to be a huge success in the mainstream with your guys help.

Funding

All the funds that are raised will be used to hire more artists to create more issues. This is going to be a huge series and we will also use the funds in order to  try to pitch ideas for a video game and motion picture.

Help Spread the Word

It doesn't matter if you do not  donate, we are happy you checked out the character and the company. We would appreciate any help you could give us by spreading the word through social media, facebook or any other outlet. Thanks so much and Stay Wicked Out There ! 

Risks and challenges

This is the third comic book release from Wicked Comics. Wicked Comics is a independent comic book company with over 140 original characters. Our mission is to create new stories and characters for the next generation. Our greatest challenge is to stay original and give fans something new and fresh to discover. Feel free to check out our new website for all upcoming projects @ www.wicked-comics.com

What can you tell readers about him?CF: See the design of that character? See how he runs off of tubes that go into his body? He runs off of the blood of dead kings. He’s a ten thousand-year-old dragon slayer. But because he has that blood running through him, he remains young and powerful. It all has to do with rejuvenation. The blood that flows through him gives him his power. The dark side of the Dragon Eye also gives him power. The Dragon Eye in Dragonia is like a religious symbol that has powers. If you’re an evil dark person, it gives you dark power. If you’re a good person, you use the good side of the Dragon Eye. It’s almost like something you channel. JR: The Kickstarter campaign for DragonMasters #1 is currently live. What would you say to anyone undecided or on the fence about backing the Kickstarter to convince them to get on board?CF: For each comic I release, I try to do a Kickstarter for it. I haven’t funded through Kickstarter, but people purchase the books on their own. I would say to them that DragonMasters is unique and different. It brings a new world of fantasy to readers. It combines technology, dragons and dragon slaying. There’s tons of battles, and there’s going to be many characters each with their own identity and backstory. It’s going to be something that I feel like will continue for a long time, somewhat similar to Masters of the Universe.JR: Many times it’s difficult for indie creators to complete books and bring them to market. They have to face a number of obstacles including getting enough time to work on them outside their day jobs, family obligations, problems with printers, finding the money to pay for print runs and just the motivation to keep going and finish the project. Are there any challenges you’ve faced on the road to bringing DragonMasters and the other Wicked Comics books to fans?CF: Oh absolutely! Definitely motivation. What motivates someone to keep on going? Maybe they’re not seeing a lot of outcome from it, or not really making making a good living from it. To me it’s the fans. They write to me and say, “I’m looking forward to this title. When’s this title coming out?” That’s what keeps me going. Time is also hard to find sometimes. I spend so many hours working on titles. It’s endless. The hardest part is developing the story and coming up with the designs of the characters. A lot of times the first design of a character isn’t the finalized design. It takes me a long time to finally get the right look for each character.JR: You’ve had great success in soliciting fan art of Wicked Comics characters from the artist community. I was listening to another interview where you said that some of the art you received even inspired you as you were creating later iterations of the ClownMan character. Can you tell readers more about this?CF: Absolutely! The first iteration of ClownMan was almost like a cartoon, not how you see him now. I got some fan art from from an artist named Frank Soto. He drew ClownMan realistically, almost like The Crow. With that I kept on redesigning. A lot of the changes I make come directly from the fans. The public – they’re the ones who dictate whether the character is going to be successful or not. I always listen to what they say.JR: Can you tell readers a bit more about what you’re doing with toy design and the Wicked Comics action figures?CF: A friend of mine who I met on Facebook was getting into making molds at home. We thought it would be a cool idea to bring these creations to life as figures. We brainstormed and came up with different ideas on how to do it. I sculpt the figure from clay, and then I make a mold out of it. I pour plastic into the mold, and then I paint them all by hand. I make the packaging, design it on the computer, print it and glue it on the boards.JR: So you’re doing all the sculpting, mold making and casting for the toys as well as creating the comics? How do you have any time to sleep!?CF: Yeah, every day there’s something to do. I also do all the trailers. I do all the mail-outs. So I basically do everything.JR: Many comic shops have a special section for local and indie comics. I think it would be awesome to see a Wicked Comics mini-display featuring your books and action figures together so customers see the whole immersive world you’ve created. Have you thought about getting any shops interested in something like this?CF: You know, actually I did. I went to two different shops here in Florida, but they weren’t too inviting. This was when I released ClownMan. They seemed disinterested. But it’s part of the whole thing. I know that success doesn’t come overnight.JR: Maybe now that you have a few more titles under your belt as well as the figures, shops will start to take notice and show some interest. All the struggling shops out there need something local, different and unique to pull in customers and differentiate themselves from the competition. Are you doing any comic book shop signings or tabling at convention artist alleys to promote and sell Wicked Comics?CF: I did one comic con so far. It was Hero Hype in Miami. It was a small con, but I sold a few books there. A few of the fans who bought books there, I still keep in contact with them. One guy comes to my house every time I release a new book! But I was planning on doing a convention in April called Ultracon. So you might see me there with ClownMan, KillSwitch and DragonMasters.JR: Where can fans find out more about Wicked Comics and DragonMasters online?CF: Just Go to www.wicked-comics.com. The site has a comics section and right now I have DragonMasters on pre-order. I haven’t gotten the print copies yet, but I should have them soon. You can purchase the pdf of DragonMasters. You can also purchase pdfs and print comics of KillSwitch and ClownMan. I also have a section for the figures.JR: Are you linking the DragonMasters pre-order to the KickStarter now?CF: On the bottom, I always have the current Kickstarter that’s live. I do the Kickstarters more for people to check out the company and the characters. You have to get your name out there. I use it as a way just so people can see my artwork and stories.JR: Thank you so much for taking the time to talk with me today! If you’re up for it, I look forward to interviewing you again when you release your next title.CF: Yeah, absolutely!Interview by: James RossLook out for other  Wicked TitlesChallengesOur biggest difficulty is creating something that was original and we think that this character has the potential to be a huge success in the mainstream with your guys help.FundingAll the funds that are raised will be used to hire more artists to create more issues. This is going to be a huge series and we will also use the funds in order to  try to pitch ideas for a video game and motion picture.Help Spread the WordIt doesn't matter if you do not  donate, we are happy you checked out the character and the company. We would appreciate any help you could give us by spreading the word through social media, facebook or any other outlet. Thanks so much and Stay Wicked Out There ! Risks and challengesThis is the third comic book release from Wicked Comics. Wicked Comics is a independent comic book company with over 140 original characters. Our mission is to create new stories and characters for the next generation. Our greatest challenge is to stay original and give fans something new and fresh to discover. Feel free to check out our new website for all upcoming projects @ www.wicked-comics.com

story:
Strap in for a comic book full of energy and inspired by our favorite British gangster movies and spaghetti westerns.

"COWBOY BOB" and his posse of outlaws live to kill drug-dealing gangsters in the streets of Belfast.

 

OVERVIEW

 

Our gritty, independent comic series follows Bobby O'Sullivan, who acts like a modern-day cowboy in the streets of Belfast, earning him his nickname, "Cowboy Bob". Bobby may look like a drug-dealing gangster but he lives to kill them. Join our campaign to back Bob and his posse of outlaws as they clean up the streets of Belfast of drugs and corruption while dodging the dealers and the crooked peelers (cops).

 

This campaign is to fund the printing of our 1st issue, "The Only Good Drug Dealer...". It includes 30 pages of interior art that'll introduce to you Bobby's world and his crusade against drugs.

We plan on delivering it to you by early Spring. It is the first part of a 6 issue mini-series and we intend to release a new issue every season.

 

Mature content

We strive to give our readers the very best quality products and everyone is welcome to enjoy our stories. However, we must advise readers that our hardcore comic series contains mature content such as strong language and graphic violence.

 

 

THE PERKS AND GOODIES

 

We are very proud to offer our readers a variety of different perks on top of the standard digital and physical copies. This includes a variant cover drawn by co-creator and interior artist Elie Bongrand and colored by the amazing Michael Sanders along with another drawn by Marcelo Simonetti and colored by our incredible interior colorist, Ibrahim Aydin who will be joining us for the rest of the series.  These variant copies will also include an additional 16 pages showing a behind the scenes look at the progression of Cowboy Bob and an art gallery.

 

 

We're also happy to announce that with each campaign we will offer a new t-shirt and hoodie with an original Cowboy Bob design exclusive to each campaign and issue. These shirts are 50 percent polyester and 50 percent cotton, so expect virtually no shrinkage. For those who need something to keep them warmer,  we also have hooded sweatshirts. We offer the same design on a neon green 100 percent polyester shirt. 

 

 

We also offer an 18" x 24" poster by Marcelo Simonetti that we like to call our "Epic Irish Potato Western Poster", parodying the classic spaghetti western posters from the '60s and '70s.

 

 

 

STRETCH GOALS

 

- $7,500: a Cowboy Bob bookmark will be added to every book.

- $10,000: every print backer will also get a bookplate with their book

- $12,500: we'll add trading cards to the perks

- $15,000: we will be able to have our book translated in Spanish and two other languages based on popularity

OUR TEAM:

Michael Sanders is a colorist who's become more and more well known and for good reason, he's incredible. He's worked on the following... Hawk issue 1, Lathesome Tales issue 2,3,4, Splitface issue 1, Luchador issue 1, X-Liefields issue 1, Harla - Tales from the Udderverse Vol. 1

Marcelo Simonetti is a very talented and versatile artist from Uraguay. He's done a great job on both our "epic Irish potato western" movie poster and one of our variant covers. You can find his galleries on Guru and at his Instagram @simonetti.marcelo_art .

 

 

RISKS AND CHALLENGES

 

Unlike other teams, we can't claim to have extensive experience in publishing comics. It is indeed our first common operation and we're eager to deliver to you the best product we can create. Some campaigns focus on advanced machinery or breakthrough technologies and therefore imply a strong level of uncertainty. the only risk our campaign knows regards our ability to avoid delays. However, we have saved room for unexpected events to make sure your book is delivered in due time.

story:
WARLASH: COLD METAL MAYHEM & BIOBURDEN COMICS

WE HAVE ALREADY FUNDED ON KICKSTARTER. WE RAISED $4483, BUT IT WASN'T ENOUGH FOR FUNDING FO ALL THE BOOKS. HELP BE A PART OF THIS GREAT BOOK AND AMAZING SC-FI WORLD. HELP SUPPORT INDIE COMICS AND INDIE CREATORS WITH WARLASH:COLD METAL MAYHEM!

WHO IS WARLASH...

THE CREATOR...

THE CAMPAIGN...

WARLASH: COLD METAL MAYHEM #1 (ONE SHOT)

Warlash, an armored warrior of the apocalyptic future, is back. This issue reintroduces Warlash with three tales of hardboiled science fiction crime noir. “The Generator” Warlash goes on the hunt for a missing girl, only to find she has been kidnapped by a super villain who has activated her mutant powers. And in “Grubbs” Warlash goes into the seedy underground sewer system to chase a mutated monster who is devouring people at will, Illustrated by “Stealthy” Steve Mannion.

Warlash: Cold Metal Mayhem #1 is written by Frank Forte (Lovecraft Country, Heavy Metal, Zombie Terrors) and Dwayne Harris (Heavy Metal, ) Illustrators include Steve Mannion (Fearless Dawn), Dwayne Harris and Frank Forte with a cover by Andy Hall.

Risks and challenges

WARLASH: COLD METAL MAYHEM #1 is pretty much complete--we just need to raise funds for printing and promotion. WARLASH: BIOBURDEN #1 is half-finished and we need funds to finish the interior art, pay for promotion and graphic design.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Please help us get the word out and make some noise about WARLASH!
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools! and share us on social media and to your favorite comics groups.
  • Talk about us to other comics fans on NEW COMICS DAY at your local comics shop!!

Thanks for helping us spread the joy of INDIE COMICS!!

story:
Any Port in Storm is a science fiction graphic novel about freedom, friendship, and the right to teleport!

 

Mock-up of Any Port in Storm

Tag is a tour guide in the first wonder of the post-porting world, Storm City. But now that teleportation has been made illegal, people are giving up on the city that meant so much to (and killed) her father. With dwindling customers, sudden appearances of mutated bodies, and a corporate conspiracy that goes all the way to the top, how will she save her home?

 

 

  • 88 page Speculative Sci-Fi graphic novel complete with in-universe ads and backmatter!
  • The whole shebang - you don't need to know anything going in, or wait for any other books to get the whole story!
  •  Fully drawn, inked and lettered - we just need your help to finish the colours!
  • 6.25 inch X 10.25 inch 70# gloss paper!
  • Teens and up - no swearing or sex. Some gross stuff though!
  • International cast: the story is set after teleportation has been invented, so the world is a much smaller place. We have characters from all over the globe!

 

Tag is a tour guide in the first wonder of the post-porting world, Storm City (named for the beautiful, yet ferocious storms that often light up the sky above). It was built in the most inaccessible place on Earth, high up in a dangerous mountain range, surrounded by violent storms, as a testament to what humanity can achieve when they work together. Of course, this posed no problem when teleportation was the most readily available form of transportation.

Porting has made the world a very small place. As such, national borders are virtually non-existent. People have migrated all over the world, and national conflicts have all but ceased. That's how Tag's family ended up in Storm, and why her father fought so hard to defend it, ultimately dying to protect his family.

But porting is illegal now, after victims have been found hideously mutated, "fusing" mid-port, killing them instantly.

Ew.

Since the ban on teleportation, Storm City undergoing hard times. Supplies are getting scarce and people are leaving en masse. The only way to save the city is to lift the ban on porting, and when a mutilated body appears in front of her, it seems like someone is telling Tag that she's the one to do it.

 

 

 

I'm Ben, the artist and writer of Any Port in Storm. I love sharing stories with the world, and we need more engaging science fiction that can be enjoyed by everyone - regardless of age, nationality, or beliefs. Content that isn't reliant on sex or profanity to be edgy, stories that entertain and are a distraction from the world around us.

Any Port in Storm is that - a fun story for anyone and everyone. It's a distraction from the problems in the world today, but also imagines a world where everyone is together, where visiting your international neighbours is only a few button pushes away.

I've been working on this story for a long time now, and it's gone through several major changes. I think you can really see my art style improve as you go further through the book.

Kickstarter will help us raise the money to print Any Port in Storm, and also get it into your hands, wherever you may be. It will also put some money in the hands of our colourist Peyton Freeman so he can finish the rest of the colours. The art, inking and lettering are complete, and Peyton is currently charging through the rest of the colours.

 

While Any Port in Storm will be available from my website and at conventions, we're only doing a fairly small print run, so backing the Kickstarter is the only way to guarantee your copy!

story:
Short Summary

  • This initial offering incorporates a comic book series, as well as a 94-page hardcover graphic novel. 

  • We'll add new comic book issues as fast as we can draw, color and print them - 3 in all.

  • The Graphic Novel is based on the feature film script, Sushi Tushi or How Asia Butted into American Pro Football by Richard Castellane, a live-action movie starring Eddie Mekka and Sumo Yama. Stream this perk===>

  • Our stretch goals will also enable us to produce the pilot episode of an on-going animated web series/movie.

Sumo Yama is the hero of our story

This world champion wrestler is the heaviest Japanese human in history at 600lbs!  He has won the Sumo World Championship title twice! At Nihon University, the #1 sumo school in Japan, Yama won 5 National Champion titles! 

Ramy is a Champ from Egypt  

Egypt’s pride and joy, Judo champion 500-pounder Ramy Elgazar has taken the Sumo world by storm. He was recently crowned a champion after defeating heavyweight Sumo Wrestler Gold Medalist Byamba Ulambayar at the US Sumo Open. Ramy may be, according to writer Castellane, "the funniest Wrestler out there and a true gentle giant".

What We Need & What You Get

$10,000 GOAL

  • Comic Book No. 1. - 22 pages with a glossy cover, signed by the writer & illustrator. $15

$30,000 STRETCH GOAL

  • Comic Book No. 2. - 22 pages with glossy cover. $12 for return supporters
  • Comic Book No. 3. - 22 pages with glossy cover. $10 for return supporters

$40,000 STRETCH GOAL

  • Graphic Novel (94 pages) with Hard Cover 8.25"x12.5".  $75.00. A collector's version with a concluding 4th chapter and signed by the author and illustrator.

$75,000 STRETCH GOAL

  • Production of an animated web-series pilot/movie promo episode. Free download to all investors!

 

Adam Cornell, Illustrator

Sample Scene

We hope you enjoyed that teaser scene!

Here's our first Comic Book (now in production):

In Issue #1 (which is also Chapter 1 of the graphic novel) we first meet Toshi is his room in Portland Maine...

We'll be adding new pages here as quickly as we can ink and color them!

 

Ways You Can Help

Even if you can’t afford to financially support us at this time, you can show your support on Facebook, getting the word out about SUSHI-TUSHI. Indiegogo has a great share tool. We will also let you know as soon as the animated series or movie is ready to see.

The Story

What do you do when you’re a pro football franchise, THE MAINE LOBSTERS, and have lost 32 games in a row? The 32 losses are hard for the fans to take, especially when your quarterback is Caleb O’Rourke, holder of every collegiate quarterback record before being a first-round lottery pick to the pros and The Lobsters. O’Rourke was considered the finest quarterback in a generation, so why the 32 losses? Answer: the line defending O’Rourke consisted of the most inept, bungling idiots ever to play football. In desperation, the team decides to buy up a school of gargantuan Sumos and try turning them into offensive linemen, protecting the precious O’Rourke. Easier said than done since Yama, the greatest of the Sumos, demands, if he will play for THE LOBSTERS, that his girlfriends Fumiko and Yoko, members of the Purple Lotus Blossom Society of Lady Sumo Wrestlers, accompany him to Maine to be incorporated into The Lobsters lovely, graceful cheerleading squad – The Lobsterettes. A PROBLEM! Fumiko and Yoko’s athleticism (flinging their arms, legs and bodies violently about) brings untold physical and mental grief to the delicate Lobsterettes.

What do you do when your Sumo linemen are initially at a complete loss as to the finesse moves of an offensive lineman? Maybe to bring them to their ferocious potential, you psych them by causing them to believe that opposing linemen have lustful intentions upon the Sumos’ mothers, including putting their drooling lips upon the Sumo mothers’ sweet cheeks. Not a happy result for opposing linemen.

And what do you do if you’re Yama, the greatest Sumo, and you mistakenly believe that quarterback O’Rourke is messing around with your Lotus Blossom Sumo girlfriends? Maybe if you’re Yama, on the very first play of the big game, you fling your enormous body into the air and land on the unsuspecting O’Rourke. A disaster for O’Rourke, and for The Lobsters.

And what do you do on the very last play of the big game, when The Lobsters are losing by one TD, and all seems lost? Maybe, if you’re a Sumo lineman, you strip off your stupid pro football uniform, throw your helmet to the ground, take stock of your Sumo heritage, and clad only in your skimpy loincloth go for the win – the SUMO WAY.

Sumo Yama is the hero of our story
This world champion wrestler is the heaviest Japanese human in history at 600lbs!  He has won the Sumo World Championship title twice! At Nihon University, the #1 sumo school in Japan, Yama won 5 National Champion titles! 


Ramy is a Champ from Egypt  
Egypt’s pride and joy, Judo champion 500-pounder Ramy Elgazar has taken the Sumo world by storm. He was recently crowned a champion after defeating heavyweight Sumo Wrestler Gold Medalist Byamba Ulambayar at the US Sumo Open. Ramy may be, according to writer Castellane, "the funniest Wrestler out there and a true gentle giant".


What We Need & What You Get
$10,000 GOAL
Comic Book No. 1. - 22 pages with a glossy cover, signed by the writer & illustrator. $15
$30,000 STRETCH GOAL

Comic Book No. 2. - 22 pages with glossy cover. $12 for return supporters
Comic Book No. 3. - 22 pages with glossy cover. $10 for return supporters

$40,000 STRETCH GOAL
Graphic Novel (94 pages) with Hard Cover 8.25"x12.5".  $75.00. A collector's version with a concluding 4th chapter and signed by the author and illustrator.

$75,000 STRETCH GOAL
Production of an animated web-series pilot/movie promo episode. Free download to all investors!
 


Adam Cornell, Illustrator
Sample Scene










We hope you enjoyed that teaser scene!
Here's our first Comic Book (now in production):
In Issue #1 (which is also Chapter 1 of the graphic novel) we first meet Toshi is his room in Portland Maine...




We'll be adding new pages here as quickly as we can ink and color them!
 

Ways You Can Help
Even if you can’t afford to financially support us at this time, you can show your support on Facebook, getting the word out about SUSHI-TUSHI. Indiegogo has a great share tool. We will also let you know as soon as the animated series or movie is ready to see.
The Story


What do you do when you’re a pro football franchise, THE MAINE LOBSTERS, and have lost 32 games in a row? The 32 losses are hard for the fans to take, especially when your quarterback is Caleb O’Rourke, holder of every collegiate quarterback record before being a first-round lottery pick to the pros and The Lobsters. O’Rourke was considered the finest quarterback in a generation, so why the 32 losses? Answer: the line defending O’Rourke consisted of the most inept, bungling idiots ever to play football. In desperation, the team decides to buy up a school of gargantuan Sumos and try turning them into offensive linemen, protecting the precious O’Rourke. Easier said than done since Yama, the greatest of the Sumos, demands, if he will play for THE LOBSTERS, that his girlfriends Fumiko and Yoko, members of the Purple Lotus Blossom Society of Lady Sumo Wrestlers, accompany him to Maine to be incorporated into The Lobsters lovely, graceful cheerleading squad – The Lobsterettes. A PROBLEM! Fumiko and Yoko’s athleticism (flinging their arms, legs and bodies violently about) brings untold physical and mental grief to the delicate Lobsterettes.
What do you do when your Sumo linemen are initially at a complete loss as to the finesse moves of an offensive lineman? Maybe to bring them to their ferocious potential, you psych them by causing them to believe that opposing linemen have lustful intentions upon the Sumos’ mothers, including putting their drooling lips upon the Sumo mothers’ sweet cheeks. Not a happy result for opposing linemen.
And what do you do if you’re Yama, the greatest Sumo, and you mistakenly believe that quarterback O’Rourke is messing around with your Lotus Blossom Sumo girlfriends? Maybe if you’re Yama, on the very first play of the big game, you fling your enormous body into the air and land on the unsuspecting O’Rourke. A disaster for O’Rourke, and for The Lobsters.
And what do you do on the very last play of the big game, when The Lobsters are losing by one TD, and all seems lost? Maybe, if you’re a Sumo lineman, you strip off your stupid pro football uniform, throw your helmet to the ground, take stock of your Sumo heritage, and clad only in your skimpy loincloth go for the win – the SUMO WAY.

story:
Short Summary

Hello everyone, I am Tony Kittrell and I want to thank you for looking at my campaign.  Let me introduce myself and tell you a little about me.  I am a Husband, Father, Grandfather and 20 year Career Firefighter & Paramedic.  I am also the Head Writer and Publisher of Advent Comics, a small Indie Comics Publisher, for the last nine years.  You can find my comics on Amazon, Barnes & Noble, Comics Plus, Comixology, DriveThruComics.com, IndyPlanet, iTunes, Kindle, Nook and select comic shops worldwide.

When I first started, I had decided that I wanted to put out comics that were entertaining and fun that reminded me of the comic books that I grew up reading as a kid.  DARK MATTER: RISE OF THE LEXICONS is one of those books.  Briefly put, this book is a mix of fantasy, science fiction and superhero elements that makes you think this is what it would look like if Game of Thrones meets Star Wars with Westworld thrown in.  This campaign will allow us to open this book up to people who do not know about us and also allow for a bigger print run of the book.

What We Need & What You Get

As I stated, we are not trying to break the bank but raise awareness of our comic and have set a $600 minimum goal.  The funds will go towards the printing costs that I will be coming out of my pocket with and distribution of the book.  If we get to our funding goal, that would be great.  If we get pass that amount that would be great too! 

With that in mind, we have some pretty fun perks for you if you choose to back us. 

 

The Impact

If you like your comics to have good stories, great art and to be all around fun reads, then this is the comic that you should back!  While this is our first Indiegogo campaign, it is not our first comic book release nor crowdfunding effort.  We have been doing this successfully for close to ten years now.  We want to make great comics for our fans, old & new. 

Risks & Challenges

The book is completed so the only risk comes from the Printer.  We just have to pay for more copies, the rewards and getting you your copies.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

I know it's summertime with bills mounting, kids out of school and just life in general happening so there is not a lot of money to go around.  But if you are able to, support the campaign, pick up a great comic and escape from reality for awhile.  If you can't support with cold hard cash, use the Indiegogo share tools to tell all of your friends about the campaign and get them to support the book.  That works just as well in my book.

I also want everyone to feel free to contact, interact with me and send any questions you have about the campaign my way.  As we move forward, I welcome getting to know you all just as you get to know about myself & the team.

With your help, we will be successful!  Thank you for your support in advance!

The Creative Team

Tony Kittrell - Creator/Writer

Sam Santos - Artist & Cover Art

Zipactli JL - Artist

Beniamino Delvecchio - Pencils/Inks/Colors

Whitney Cook - Colorist

Raphael Kazeem - Colorist

Cristian Docolomansky - Letters & Cover Logo

Jerome Gagnon - Letters

Caanan White/Matias Laborde/J. Brown - Variant Covers

story:
JACK GRIMM CONTINUES ON INDIEGOGO!

I'm Gary Boyarski, a comic book creator and stay-at-home Dad.

For the last 5 years I've been working hard at making my dreams come true.  JACK GRIMM: Harbinger of Death is an on-going, black & white, independently published comic book.  I am the creator, the writer, the artist, the letterer, and the publisher. I’m a complete one-man show. 

But even a lone wolf needs a pack.  For the last 4 issues I’ve self financed the production and printing of my comic book series with limited success.  Now, I’m turning to the multitude of awesome comic fans looking for a fun, exciting, old-fashioned comic book adventure to help take this series to the next level. 

So join me, and return to a time when comic books were fun, characters had heart, and the stories took you to places you never dreamed possible.  

 

SAMPLE PAGES FROM JACK GRIMM

story:
1.the Deal
I’m thrilled to run this campaign to launch ZANE AND THE DIESEL CREW,  as a 42-page graphic novel!  ZANE AND THE DIESEL CREW: THE DAUGHTER OF HEPHAESTUS will hopefully be the first part of an EPIC story, and I am pouring my heart and soul into it.  

With help from my amazing colorist Leonardo Paciarotti, I hope to bring this all to life!
I’m Michael Johnson-Curry, a comic book artist and salesman. I’ve spent the last 20 + years working at perfecting my craft and learning what others find entertaining or fun and selling great comics to others.  And it’s been fun, but ultimately, I think its time to create my own.   

 
I’m taking a step out into my own venture, and I’d like you to come along and support me!  I have a group of original characters, Zane and the Diesel crew, I’ve had a story in mind for a while now, but I think now is the time to bring this all to life!

2.What We Need & What You Get
This is where I shine. Unlike most projects, i have a significant portion complete.

Here is what we have so far:
1. Completed pencil and inked comic.
2. the first 4 pages colored

What we don't have.
1. the rest of the finished colored pages


3.Risks & challenges
Are there risks? Yes, of course! With almost every major project come risks and obstacles that could hinder progress, but what’s important is how they will be tackled and overcome. but if anything does come up, my backers will be the first to know.

4. I don't gots money, AKA "Hey how can I help?"

Maybe you're poor. Maybe you have money but don't care to support with your hard earned money bucks but you still want to see this project come to light.

1. Using IndieGoGo's share tools, promote the comic across social platforms
2. Do you have friends that enjoy this sort of content? Tell them! 


$7000 STRETCH GOAL: THe guts of a page: 5 extra pages of Behind the scenes material on the creation of a comic page. pushing the pages total to a whooping 47 pages of content

$8000 STRETCH GOAL: Behind the skull: 5 more pages of behind the scenes character sketches with commentary I used to create the look and feel of Zane's world. bringing or page count to a HUMONGOUS 52 pages of original content.

$10000 STRETCH GOAL: original art created for 4 original trading cards to be included with every comic!

story:
50 people from all over the world, £1000, and Daniel's comic "The Final" is ready for publication! Can you believe that ? But now we still have the most important aim, and you can become the one, thanks to whom, it will be achieved!

 

First of all, let’s tell everyone who is not yet familiar with our project. The comic "The Final" is dedicated to Daniel's grandfather, Ismail Akhmedjanov, who was affected by a rare form of thyroid cancer. He got this type of cancer from exposure to radiation. When he was in the military, he was sent to build the Baikonur Cosmodrome in Kazakhstan to help launch the spacecraft that led Yuri Gagarin to go to space! Unfortunately great achievements came with a price...Ismail passed away 3 years before Daniel’s birth.

What We Need 

One of the main tasks of our public project “The Final” was the publication of a comic book, which we, thanks to the support of the public, successfully coped with! Now, thanks to 50 heroes, the whole world will be able to get acquainted with the amazing and exciting comic strip by Daniel Akhmed! And that proves the fact that everything is possible only with joint efforts! BUT still our main mission is to hold a series of charity events to distribute comics and donate funds to cancer centres in need. This is why we created the third part of the campaign to gain at least £1000 so that as many organisations fighting against cancer as possible could get the help they need.

Other Ways You Can Help

And now you have a wonderful chance to do a good deed not only by supporting our campaign, but also by offering us an organisation working with cancer patients, which we can include in our charity tour. And then, thanks to your gesture of kindness, people with serious illnesses will be able to gain more strength to fight evil ailments, and what is equally important, to find reasons to continue the fight!

What You Get

For us, as well as for Daniel, the support of each person is very important, which is why, as a gratitude, the names of everyone who supported or will support the project will be indicated on the pages of the comic (but there are other marvelous perks as well!!!). We insist on the thing, that the name of every person who contributes in the development of the life of the whole world, deserves to be marked in history. And in our case, the history, is the comic "The Final", which will become a legacy we are leaving to our descendants.

_______________________________________________________________________________

50 человек со всего мира и 1000 фунтов стерлингов - и комикс Даниеля “The Final” готов к изданию! Представляете? Мы все - большие молодцы, это точно! Но теперь перед нами стоит самая важная цель, а Вы сможете стать тем, благодаря кому она будет достигнута!

 

Для начала хотелось бы рассказать всем, кто еще не знаком с нашим проектом, его историю. Комикс «The Final» посвящен дедушке Даниеля, Исмаилу Ахмеджанову, который заболел редкой формой рака щитовидной железы. Причиной этой болезни стало радиационное излучение, которое поразило его во времена службы в армии. Тогда Исмаил был отправлен на строительство космодрома Байконур в Казахстане, чтобы помочь запустить космический корабль, доставивший Юрия Гагарина в космос! Но, к сожалению, великие достижения всегда даются большой ценой... Исмаил Ахмеджанов умер за 3 года до рождения внука из-за развившегося недуга. 

Чего Мы хотим

Одной из задач общественного проекта “The Final” было издание комикса, с чем мы, благодаря поддержке общественности, благополучно справились! Теперь благодаря 50 героям весь мир сможет познакомиться с удивительным и захватывающим комиксом Даниеля Ахмеда! Это ли не доказательство того, что все возможно только при совместных усилиях? НО нашей главной миссией является проведение серии благотворительных акций по распространению комикса и по пожертвованиям средств в нуждающиеся онкологические центры. Именно поэтому мы и создали третью часть кампании для сбора как минимум 1000 фунтов, чтобы как можно больше организаций, борющихся с раком, получило необходимую помощь.

Дополнительные Способы Поддержки

И вот сейчас у Вас есть замечательнейшая возможность сделать доброе дело не только поддержав нашу кампанию, но и предложив нам организацию, работающую с онкобольными, которую мы сможем включить в наш тур благотворительности. И тогда, благодаря Вашему жесту добра, люди с тяжелыми заболеваниями смогут обрести больше сил на борьбу со злыми недугами, а что еще не менее важно, обрести причины для продолжения борьбы!

Что Получите Вы

Для нас, как и для Даниеля, очень важна поддержка каждого человека, именно поэтому в качестве благодарности имена всех, кто поддержал или поддержит проект, будут указаны на страницах комикса (но не забывайте про готовые уникальные пакеты с подарками!). Мы уверены, что имя каждого человека, вкладывающего в улучшение жизни всей страны, а то и мира, достойно того, чтобы быть сохраненным в истории. И в нашем случае, история - это комикс “The Final”, который останется в качестве нашего наследия нашим потомкам.

И в нашем случае, история - это комикс “The Final”, который останется в качестве нашего наследия нашим потомкам.

story:
Into Darkness

    So a few years ago I started a dream. That dream was to create a series of books based on Mythology and Religion. To create an epic tale of both action and horror in the vein of a Tolkien epic mixed with Lovecraftian horror.  It's taken both time and work to come up with Into Darkness and I'm not only proud of where it is  but also where I know it's going.  It will be an ongoing series based around the end times and what it would truly be like if Hell was unleashed on Earth.  My name is Mark Taub and I thank you for taking the time to explore my passion.                        

Book One 

   will introduce you to Ashley, raised an orphan trained as an assassin.  But things are not quite right as we find out a sinister secret about her.  Is she friend?  Is she foe?  Join her as she discovers things about herself and the coming of The Darkness.  Watch as humanity struggles against  both Hellish forces and even itself.   She will Awaken, The Darkness will rise and our end draws near! 

     The book is already complete and just needs the funding to get it out into the wild.  It is two hundred pages long in black and white and will be in trade paperback format. Into Darkness deals with adult themes and is for mature readers. I consider it an R rated Graphic Novel .

Your contribution

will help me realize a life long dream and also start you at the beginning of an epic tale that will span the course of many years. I feel that Into Darkness isn't a story to be told, it's a story that needs to be told. Thank you for support And be sure to tell your friends about us!

story:
The Story:

The story is about a young boy who finds a Golden Age comic book at a yard sale and finds himself drawn into a world of caped heroes, evil villains, and a death ray that is powerful enough to destroy a city. The story will be printed on classic newsprint to capture the Golden Age look. The comic will be 32 pages overall, with 28 pages of story, and four pages of extras.

About Us:

Author- Doctor Lore is an Army veteran who served in the Iraq war. He is now an aspiring writer and novelist. He holds a Master of Arts in History, and is a member of the Royal Historical Society in London. He has authored several books in both fiction and nonfiction categories.

Illustrator- Trevor Nielson is an Army aviation mechanic in addition to being a professional artist. He has worked on several indie comic projects, including being an assistant to Batton Lash on "Supernatural Law," and has a Joan of Arc comic entitled "The Lily Maid," which is currently in progress.

Colorist- Syrena Sketches is an Army veteran who served in Korea, and is a professional illustrator, having graduated from the Ringling College of Art in Sarasota, Florida. She has illustrated several gaming books and children's books.

Logo Graphic Designer- Bob Stone is an artist and graphic designer who previously designed logos for Richard C. Meyer's comics "Jawbreakers" and "Iron Sights," as well as for half a dozen other comics. He is currently designing a logo for our next project, the fantasy graphic novel series "The Duskbringer Saga." He is also designing the logo for the graphic novel "The Expendables Go To Hell," by Chuck Dixon and Sylvester Stallone.

What You Get

As with all such campaigns, what you get will depend on which tier you select. For this campaign the following are the tiers and perks:

$10- Backer receives a copy of the comic. No frills.

$20- Backer receives two copies of the comic.

$25- Backer receives a copy of the comic, signed by the author. 

$200- Backer has their likeness drawn into the comic as a background character at a fancy ball in a panel on page five (limit- one of one). This perk also includes two signed copies of the comic.

$200- Backer has their likeness drawn into the comic as one of the villain's goons in a panel on page seven (limit- one of one). This perk also includes two signed copies of the comic.

What We Need 

We need an additional 318 backers on the lowest tier (as of April 15th) to make this book possible. This goes down to 164 backers with the signed comic tier, or to somewhere in between with a mix of tiers. This amount is what we will need to allow us to ensure that we can cover the printing and distribution of the comic, as well as expenses such as good packaging to ensure comics are not damaged in transit.

Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word through social media.
