story:
Overview

YATRA – Out of Africa is a graphic novel series - a grand adventure through time where the search for power over one's fate reveals a comically terrifying look into BEING itself. Set in exotic locations including East Africa and India, it is the antihero’s journey, fraught with all the delightful perils of existence, where tyranny lurks around every turn and strange forces loom just beyond the boundaries of normal perception. It’s a tragically funny romp where no one can ever be safe from others, or themselves, for that matter, and you will find that ultimately NOTHING is more offensive than existence…

 

What's the story line?

When a would-be sorcerer attempts to fix his past by reclaiming an ancient artifact with a mysterious power, he unleashes a creature so preposterous it will bring into question the very fabric of BEING. It’s really quite hairy.

The Details

YATRA – Out of Africa is a 4 volume story. This campaign is ONLY for the FIRST volume titled The Veil of Man.  This volume is, however, already FINISHED. It’s about 80 pages of full color artwork in a fun easy-going graphic style. It’s an aberrant look at what it means to BE, all wrapped up in a preposterous adventure with hidden clues to understanding this strange world and it sets the stage for more hilarity, darkness and illumination to come in the subsequent volumes. 

 

The Goods!

Now I love REAL, tangible books so I would really like to release this first volume initially in a full color hardback (case-bound) print 8.5” by 11” version with high quality paper (printed right here in the U.S.) For that reason, a fixed funding campaign makes the most sense to get the quality that comes from a printing press. I would like to keep the campaign simple this time around, so I am limiting the tiers to include  a few other fun perks including some stickers, printed cards and a limited edition 3.5” hand crafted resin cast (see example image) of the mysterious Snake Whisperer featured in this volume!

 

Since this is my first campaign I made sure to be done with all the art/story stuff for this volume so it mostly boils down to the logistics of fundraising, printing and fulfillment. Hopefully, you (the dear reader) and I can make this as smooth and effective as possible so you can get to reading and I can get back to working on this existential odyssey.

Be sure to scan through the perks and see what works for you but if you can’t contribute you can always help spread the word! Any help is greatly appreciated to meet this goal!

Thanks for your support!

Story and art and all the other stuff by QUENTIN JOHNSTON

story:
This mini-series revolves around the royal family of Elthamir. Elthamir, a floating city above Altheria, is ruled by King Timesworth: a noble yet discrete royal, an embodiment of secrets. In true fantastical sense, this story is a capsule of magical intrigue and suspense. Actions are affective and this mini-series reflects this through how the fate of Elthamir dances to the tune of the deeds of its people.

The Lost Tales: The Floating city issue #1 is the first of many issues telling the story of the Elthamirians. This was going to be a black and white series but after seeing it in color how could I deny future fans this magical story. The cost of the artist, letterer are all coming out of my pocket but it is a small fee to pay to tell this epic story. The purpose of this campaign is to be able to print 100 copies of the first issue any extra contribution will go towards creating the second issue. 

 

Here are previews of what to expect

 

This  is where most of the story will be taking place

story:
Cos'è Senzombra


Senzombra è un fumetto che nasce dalla mente di Michele Monteleone, sceneggiatore di Dylan Dog e Orfani per la Sergio Bonelli Editore e dalla matita di Marco Matrone, straordinario esordiente nel mondo dei fumetti. 

Con questo crowdfunding Michele e Marco vogliono coinvolgervi nella realizzazione di un volume da 80 tavole, cartonato, a colori, in formato francese (22x29,5cm). Il vostro aiuto nel finanziare la campagna sarà vitale per realizzare l'albo a fumetti e vi garantirà in ritorno una copia di Senzombra. Oltre al fumetto saranno disponibili un sacco di altri meravigliosi gadget che vi ricompenseranno per essere stati i primi a credere in Senzombra... ma cosa sono questi senzombra?

La storia

La terra dei senzombra è molto simile alla nostra, infatti nel mondo in cui si ambienta la nostra storia, esistono macchine, scuole, supermercati, smartphone, console, fumetti, strade, palazzi, semafori e... MOSTRI!
Tutti sanno dell'esistenza dei mostri e tutti sanno che gli unici che li cacciano sono i senzombra.
Tristan, il nostro protagonista, è un senzombra.

Entrambi i creatori del fumetto, da bambini, avevano paura che un mostro, viscido e ghignante, li aspettasse nell'ombra sotto al loro letto. Michele, ancora oggi, ammette candidamente che  prima di stendersi dà ancora un calcetto nel vuoto fra pavimento e doghe di legno.  

Per sicurezza. 

Non si sa mai. 

Marco scuote la testa al solo pensiero di un ventinovenne, alto un metro e ottanta, che ha paura dell'uomo nero, ma ormai è troppo affezionato al progetto per scappare a gambe levate...

Al contrario di Michele, Tristan, che come vi dicevamo è il protagonista della nostra storia, non ha nessuna paura che un mostro si nasconda sotto al suo letto, anche perché cacciare mostri è il suo lavoro. 

Tristan è un ragazzino sui quindici anni, ha un'insana passione per il ramen istantaneo, una forte dipendenza dai giochi per smartphone e un divorante interesse per i fumetti. Ma lasciate che ve lo presenti:

Speriamo che la spiegazione sia abbastanza chiara, in caso non lo fosse, daremo la colpa a Daniele Di Nicuolo e Walter Baiamonte che hanno rispettivamente illustrato e colorato questo breve tutorial scritto da Michele. A parte gli scherzi, li ringraziamo tanto per averci aiutato a spiegarvi qualcosa del mondo di Senzombra.

Le prime dieci pagine

Vedo ancora qualche scettico fra di voi, inutile che coprite le webcam!
Piuttosto, qui sotto  potrete leggere in anteprima le prime dieci tavole del volume che ci state aiutando a creare e che, presto, potreste stringere fra le mani. Le pagine naturalmente sono scritte da Michele e disegnate e colorate da Marco Matrone, i due autori di Senzombra.

I Perk
I Perk, ovvero le ricompense che otterrete finanziando il nostro progetto, sono tante e alcune sono limitate, ma tutte sono fatte con il cuore... i creatori stessi del progetto sono i primi che non vedono l'ora di stringerle fra le mani. Speriamo vi piacciano e vi convincano ad investire nel nostro progetto.

DIGITALE

BASE fumetto cartonato

ECONOMY Variant Roberto Recchioni

LUSSO spillette e adesivi

EXTRA LUSSO sketch b/n sul volume

SUPER LUSSO maglietta

SUPER LUSSO shopper


MEGA LUSSO sketch a colori su foglio A4

DIVENTA UN SENZOMBRA


ULTRA LUSSO tavola originale


Perché il crowdfunding


Vorremmo iniziare dicendo che non abbiamo assolutamente nulla contro editori italiani o stranieri, amiamo avere alle nostre spalle una casa editrice a cui affidare i nostri progetti, ma questa volta il nostro progetto lo vorremmo affidare direttamente ai lettori, vorremmo essere in grado di seguire la creazione di Senzombra in ogni singolo particolare e senza nessun compromesso e, per farlo, dobbiamo convincervi... uno alla volta. E' la stessa cosa che Michele ha fatto tante volte con l'autoproduzione, ma in questo caso il progetto era troppo ambizioso per quel mezzo (leggi: Michele e Marco non avevano abbastanza soldi) e il crowdfunding ci è sembrata la soluzione migliore. Sarà un lungo viaggio, ma speriamo che, se siete arrivati fino qui in fondo, vi sarete anche appassionati al nostro giovane Tristan, scalpitiate come noi per leggere l'albo e vogliate e deciderete di investire nella nostra storia.

Altri modi con cui aiutarci

Se siete entusiasti del progetto la metà di quanto lo siamo noi, aiutateci a diffondere il verbo di Senzombra, per farlo potete condividere questa pagina copiando e incollando il seguente link - su ogni social possibile e immaginabile, oppure potete seguire la nostra pagina facebook cliccando sul seguente link Facebook, o ancora stampandovi la pagina del progetto e facendo volantinaggio agli angoli della strada gridando che l'apocalisse sta arrivando... scherziamo, eh. Forse...

A cosa ci servono i 28.000 euro

I 28.000 euro che vi stiamo chiedendo per finanziare il progetto compriranno in questo modo le spese della produzione di albo e perk:

15.000 euro per sceneggiatore, disegnatore (che avrà anche il ruolo di colorista in questo caso) e grafico.

6000 euro la stampa dei volumi.

3000 euro i costi della produzione dei perk.

3000 euro sono le varie tasse e fee che ci impongono indiegogo e paypal.

1000 i costi delle varie sponsorizzazioni sui social.

Collaboratori e ringraziamenti

Fabrizio Verrocchi ha realizzato lo splendido logo di Senzombra  e il progetto grafico dell'intero albo. Maria Rosaria Giampaglia che sta seguendo la campagna e ci ha fornito i suoi preziosissimi servizi come ufficio stampa. Salvatore de Chirico che ci aiuta nella gestione delle sponsorizzazioni. Fabio Listrani ci ha aiutato nella visualizzazione dei perk. Daniele di Nicuolo e Walter Baiamonte hanno disegnato e colorato l'intro/tutorial. E la lista verrà aggiornata perchè abbiamo ancora qualchesorpresa per voi...

Infine Senzombra, come tutti gli albi creati in Uno Studio in Rosso (il collettivo romano in cui lavora Michele) deve molto alla collaborazione tra i membri dello studio, quindi ringraziamo per i consigli e l'aiuto: Roberto Recchioni, Riccardo Torti, Giovanni Masi, Giulio Antonio Gualtieri, Federico Rossi Edrighi, Mauro Uzzeo e Roberto Cirincione. E infine ringraziamo tutti voi che parteciperete al crowdfunding e che ci aiuterete a realizzare questo nostro piccolo sogno. Grazie a tutti.

1000 i costi delle varie sponsorizzazioni sui social.

Fabrizio Verrocchi ha realizzato lo splendido logo di Senzombra  e il progetto grafico dell'intero albo. Maria Rosaria Giampaglia che sta seguendo la campagna e ci ha fornito i suoi preziosissimi servizi come ufficio stampa. Salvatore de Chirico che ci aiuta nella gestione delle sponsorizzazioni. Fabio Listrani ci ha aiutato nella visualizzazione dei perk. Daniele di Nicuolo e Walter Baiamonte hanno disegnato e colorato l'intro/tutorial. E la lista verrà aggiornata perchè abbiamo ancora qualchesorpresa per voi...
Infine Senzombra, come tutti gli albi creati in Uno Studio in Rosso (il collettivo romano in cui lavora Michele) deve molto alla collaborazione tra i membri dello studio, quindi ringraziamo per i consigli e l'aiuto: Roberto Recchioni, Riccardo Torti, Giovanni Masi, Giulio Antonio Gualtieri, Federico Rossi Edrighi, Mauro Uzzeo e Roberto Cirincione. E infine ringraziamo tutti voi che parteciperete al crowdfunding e che ci aiuterete a realizzare questo nostro piccolo sogno. Grazie a tutti.

story:
Greetings, Boils & Ghouls!

My name is Ben. I'm a cartoonist  and from Delaware. Also I am a Trashmonger.

I want to print a large run of the first issue of my horror comic, MILLIE. This, consisting of two episodes over 16 pages, is ready to print.

MILLIE centers around a girl (MILLIE) whose cruelty, sharp tongue and biting wit have made it difficult to get anywhere in the dating scene... and she is beginning to lose hope for ever finding Mr. Right. Our story begins with a blind-date typical for MILLIE... but BIZARRE, WEIRD circumstances lead our heroine to the thrill of a lifetime. FOR MATURE READERS ONLY.

Your contributions will allow me to take some currently not affordable time out from work during the week to spin the ongoing saga of MILLIE and get my work out of my dreams....  and onto your bookshelves!

I'm limiting my first print run to, at most, two-times however many donations of $10.00 this campaign receives if my goal is met. All such donations will be rewarded with one lovingly printed, first edition, full-color copy of the sixteen-page first episode of MILLIE. You will also be privy to the completion of future issues of MILLIE, and greater contributions of $50.00 or more will be given first mailings of the next two upcoming installments. If you choose to send $100 or more my way, you will receive your very own WEIRD MYSTERY CARE PACKAGE.

*WARNING: THE WEIRD MYSTERY  CARE PACKAGE may contain items such as assorted prints, comic book fragments, original artwork, sculptures, masks, stickers, audio/video nuggets and other doodads related or non-related to MILLIE.

You can also help by:

Share with your classic horror comic-loving friends!

story:
SA’RA - "What must I do?"

AMUN-RA - "You must convince him to sacrifice himself for the Ananaki."

SA’RA - "Who are the Ananaki?"

Seventh century Scotland. Henry Gunn leads his clan in a ferocious battle with Viking invaders lead by the Savage Rathgar! Rathgar sees victory finally within his grasp. Gunn and his men, sensing that this may be their last stand, are saved by the approach of three unknown ships. The Vikings flee, not sure if the new uninvited "guests" are friend or foe.

Rathgar

Gunn and his men are saved by the fortuitous approach of Princess Sa' Ra of Alexandria. Sa' Ra has been sent on a mission to find a champion. One that she believes will aid her in her time of need. But the "Gods" have an even greater need for this man, Henry Gunn! And if he chooses to ally himself with Sa' Ra and these "Gods", He will be forever changed!

Will Gunn undergo the transformation to something other than human, and at what cost? The fate of civilization rests on the shoulders of a troubled warrior, husband, and father. What are you willing to sacrifice for all of humanity?
In the tradition of The Stars My Destination and The Silver Surfer, Offworlder is a star-spanning science fiction saga that will keep you riveted from the first page to the very last.

Lizzarsin

OFFWORLDER will be a 56 page Graphic Novel, 49 pages of story.  It will be perfect bound with gloss text pages and gloss laminate 110 lb cover.

Cover A by Jordi Armengol

Cover B by Massimiliano Veltri


Offworlder page 6


Offworlder page 14


Offworlder page 20


Offworlder page 21


Offworlder page 23

 

Mike Baron -
Mike is a multi-faceted writer, most commonly known as the creator of Badger and the co-creator of Nexus with Steve Rude. Some of the other titles he's written for include The Flash, Punisher, Action Comics and Batman... just to name a few.  He is also a novelist and has written Helmet Head, Whack Job, Biker, Skorpio and Florida Man.

Jordi Armengol -
Jordi is an amazing artist.  He's been publishing graphic content since 1992.  He has worked at Norma Editorial and Amigo Comics. Some of his works include Rogues and the cover for Mike Baron's novel Skorpio.  In addition to drawing the pages for OFFWORLDER, he's also doing the coloring and lettering.

Ben Henderson -
Ben is the creator of the Gunn Family Saga. These titles include Ravage: Kill All Men, OFFWORLDER, The Wraith, and The Magus.

Fanatic Comics -
Fanatic Comics is a family-run company. The Stewart family is very involved in the growth and prosperity of the company. Lee’s daughter and nieces help with Support. Lee and his wife, Kerry, run the day-to-day. Kerry does much of the programming and paperwork. Lee handles networking, promotion, writing, and logistics.

Fanatic Comics is truly a family business run by comic fans who love comics!


Laying it out in the simplest of terms:

  • When you hire experienced creators, because you demand a quality product, you understand talent like that comes at a greater cost to the producer. Fanatic Comics is only interested in one thing: Bringing great content to comic book readers! Our product is priced low so that more of you can enjoy this fantastic story.
  • Our funding goal is $20,000. Everything over that goes towards Stretch goals and seeding the next campaign. Fanatic Comics has 5 titles it wishes to produce over the next 24 months. You backing this book will help us achieve that goal! 
  • Every backer of a physical item (Book, T-shirt) will receive all unlocked stretch goals.
  • Every backer gets their name on our thank you page. If you wish not to have your name listed email us with your backer number and let us know.
  • Due to the time and cost of shipping to get Mike and Jordi to sign the books, we are setting that stretch goal first. Signatures will NOT be on the cover. They will be on the inside of the book.
  • What happens if the book isn't funded? Refunds will be issued for this campaign. 

International Orders -

Due to government restrictions we are unable to ship to Ascension, Bolivia, Falkland Islands, Korea, Democratic Peoples Republic of (North Korea), or Somalia

We've gone back and forth about the pros/cons of shipping First Class Package International vs Priority Mail International.  We want to keep the costs to backers as low as we can but First-Class Package International doesn't seem to have an insurance option.  Because of this, we have decided to go with Priority Mail International.  Priority Mail International includes insurance up to $100.  So if a package is lost, we can file a claim with the post office and get you a replacement package sent out.  

Due to the costs of international shipping, if you have friends or family that you want to combine an order on, and don't see a tier with add-ons that has what you want, contact us with what you're looking for and we can put together a special tier for you.

Update on International Shipping

There are a lot of variables that we have to figure in so that we are not overcharging on shipping.  At the same time, we also do not want to undercharge.  Each item purchased, optional add-ons, how the items will need to be packaged, weight, destination.  All these things make it nearly impossible to come up with a reasonable cost to you.

We have decided to allow every INTERNATIONAL backer to create their own personalized tier.

If one of the tiers and shipping options we already have setup does not work for you, then we will work with you.  The tiers as they are set up include pricing for Priority Mail International with insurance.

Contact us at customerservice@fanaticcomics.com and let us know what you would like in your tier.  Please be as specific as possible.  Also include your City, State/Province, Postal Code and Country.  That should be all we need to look up shipping options.  We will let you know what it will cost to ship to you.  You let us know if you are fine with First Class International Package shipping or if you would rather go Priority Mail with insurance.  

Yes, this will take a little more time.  And we ask that you please be patient with us.  We will get back to you as soon as we can.  It should only take up to 24 hours, figuring in time differences and work schedules.

$27,000 - All OFFWORLDER Graphic Novels will be signed by Mike Baron and Jordi Armengol (this excludes the LCS copies.)

$30,000 - Trading cards and magnets of Henry Gunn and Sa' Ra

$33,000 - Trading cards and magnets of Rathgar and the Lizzarsin

$35,000 - Upgrade the two 5.5" x 8.5" prints to 8.5" x 11"

$40,000 - Surprise the Troops!  We are going to donate $3,000 to Operation Gratitude.  This will allow them to send 200 care packages to our troops.

$45,000 - Join the clan swag package. Gunn family Badge on an embroidered patch and flair buttons for your favorite jacket or hat!

$50,000 - Bonuses for our creative team.


Offworlder page 1

Our goal is to create content that everyone can enjoy. Our team is made up of individuals with vast experience in their fields. Storytellers, artists, shippers, programmers, customer services. All of this experience coming together under one banner to bring you a high-quality book. Packaged and shipped under the supervision of a 30-year veteran in the industry. This is why we use Gemini mailers. 

We will keep you abreast of all phases of this project as we move forward. Full transparency is important to us. So let's start right now...

  • We will update you at least once a week. Even if that update is the same as the last. (No canned responses) Keeping you informed is important and vital for us to build trust with our backers.
  • Questions posted to the comments section or sent through the "ask a question" link will be answered in a judicious manner!
  • Currently, the script for OFFWORLDER is written. The first 25 pages are penciled and inked. Several pages have already been lettered and colored. This makes OFFWORLDER nearly half complete!

Offworlder page 2

If you are able to contribute to our campaign, that is wonderful!  If you are not able to contribute by becoming a backer, you can still help spread the word.  Please use the share links at the top of the page to help get the word out to others who may be interested in backing the campaign.  

In either case, we greatly appreciate your support.

story:
Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • My name is -J Townsend, and I’m a mentally and physically disabled artist that has painted fo royalty, photographed for NASA, invented new biomedical materials, Runs a Podcast, and am currently animating my first animated series based on a comic series I wrote last year. Oh, and I write young adult fiction for fun. 
  • When my friend read it, their response was that it was “raw”—and 100,000 people have read it online which means maybe it’s an interesting story. It’s also a 100 page glossy first volume. Fancy looking.
  • It would change my life is I could share my art with people all over the world as I do with my podcast, anchor.fm/DivergentMind where I basically work through whatever’s going on in my add rattled head. 

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • I need $3800 usd to buy a Wacom Cintiq 32 inch and the ergo stand so that I can work longer hours without my body letting me down. This animation project is putting me through the wringer and I know that when I can draw big like on a tablet of that size, I can make whatever I want. If you want to download art I’ve already made go to ko-fi.com/DivergentMind/shop for $5 digital print to any size print at home prints. Not fuss, no muss. 
  • Into a savings account until I can get that tablet to replace my current one that is lovely but too small and killing my hand. 
  • What you get: $1 a pdf of the comic, $10 a glossy hard back version sent directly to you through amazons publishing system. If you go to my rebubble or ko-fi stores you can buy all sorts of neat trinkets and clothing.

The Impact

  • I can prove 100,000 people read the comic. I hope you will too. 
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks & Challenges

  • Everything physically is set to fulfill, though the time to ship takes a bit and I will be completely transparent with you about that. 
  • The pdf is sitting on my desktop waiting to upload and my stores online are open for business.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Please get the word out and make some noise about my campaign.
  • Remember them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

Thank you so much for your time .
-J Townsend

story:
Hi!! I'm Dane Celestia! ^_^

I've been drawing for quite a long time now, sometimes it just seems like I started since I could grasp a pencil. Haha. :3

Ever since I was trained by my father, with drawings of stickmans and mannequin frameworks, I knew that it was the thing I wanted to do for the rest of my life, somewhere I belong. So I pushed for it. I strived to be my very best, even as people discouraged and turned back on me. I started doing fanarts, giving every piece everything I got and then I started doing commissions, character designs and arts that people wanna see and keep for themselves. And after that, I was introduced to comic making and met more and more artists as I went on, as I went to know them more, I saw different stories, different experiences, different hardships. This helped me understand the arts more, this helped me be the artist I am today. 

Ever since then I have taken my arts way more seriously, never missing the opportunity to learn more and do more! Until now, even as I am a professional artist, I still continue to learn and test and hone my skills to the maximum extent! ^_^

Along with that, came the yearning to create something more. Something big! And so I went on to make manga! 

With this campaign, you will be helping me create my biggest, most ambitious yet, "Bloodbrand". A medieval fantasy about monsters, dragons, the killing of those guys, friendship, morality, vengeance and adventure.










What We Need & What You Get

Before we start, you gotta know what you are getting into!
If you would kindly visit here:
https://tapas.io/series/Bloodbrand

You're back!  Great!

So, aside from the continuance of Bloodbrand, of which we will be needing equipment, pens and pencils, markers and colors and tons and tons of paper(Because I still do most of these traditionally) the funding will be used to promote the title across all platforms, so that more people can see it and hopefully join what community we may foster here. The more the merrier, right? Heck, we might even publish it and distribute physically! As long as you guys are there with me, the possibilities are endless!

And this is all where I need you guys with. Basically everything. It started as a hobby, I hope we can make it a big, big, BIG thing! 

And at the very end of it, when all is said and done. 

You'd have made this ol' artist's dream come true.

And with it, a story. A legacy of which we are all a part of. 

Digital copies of various artworks will be given to backers, as well as a neatly done digi-comic style pdf for the three chapters out, so it's easier to just grab and read it from time to time. 

For higher tiers, I have been brewing a little something more, a digital artbook of sorts that contain production materials for when I started Bloodbrand, if all goes well, we might even be able to give out physically printed ones!

I may even be able to give free commissions for the coolest top contributors, we'll see!

Honestly, I don't have much to give. But whatever I can, I will.
 

Risks & Challenges

As is with all independent productions, the risk here is time. 

Getting chapters out in a timely and orderly manner is pretty hectic when there's just one of you. 

So I was thinking, if this campaign goes well and nice, I may get the chance to take some more artists for this project, to help with production and elevate it to the best it can be!

Not just that, with this kind of strategy, we will be giving jobs to many freelance artists in the field that are in need of help, experience and income as well!

All of these can be possible if we do indeed do well!

Other Ways You Can Help

Just continuing to read it over at Tapas and appreciating it is already doing a lot. For that, I do thank you.
Not everybody can pledge, this is a fact. But it doesn't mean that not everybody can contribute.
Merely sharing this campaign to your friends, acquaintances, family, dogs, enemies, Ex's, can make a huge impact.

Hell, if you can make one, meme-ing this would be super cool..


With all that said, I shan't bore you with all my blabbering no longer, I leave you, to the world of Aeselin. To the world of wonder that we shall continue to create. 

Have a mythically good day.

A medieval fantasy about monsters, dragons, the killing of those guys, friendship, morality, vengeance and adventure.


What We Need & What You Get
Before we start, you gotta know what you are getting into!If you would kindly visit here:https://tapas.io/series/BloodbrandYou're back!  Great!So, aside from the continuance of Bloodbrand, of which we will be needing equipment, pens and pencils, markers and colors and tons and tons of paper(Because I still do most of these traditionally) the funding will be used to promote the title across all platforms, so that more people can see it and hopefully join what community we may foster here. The more the merrier, right? Heck, we might even publish it and distribute physically! As long as you guys are there with me, the possibilities are endless!And this is all where I need you guys with. Basically everything. It started as a hobby, I hope we can make it a big, big, BIG thing! And at the very end of it, when all is said and done. You'd have made this ol' artist's dream come true.And with it, a story. A legacy of which we are all a part of. Digital copies of various artworks will be given to backers, as well as a neatly done digi-comic style pdf for the three chapters out, so it's easier to just grab and read it from time to time. For higher tiers, I have been brewing a little something more, a digital artbook of sorts that contain production materials for when I started Bloodbrand, if all goes well, we might even be able to give out physically printed ones!I may even be able to give free commissions for the coolest top contributors, we'll see!Honestly, I don't have much to give. But whatever I can, I will. 

Risks & Challenges
As is with all independent productions, the risk here is time. Getting chapters out in a timely and orderly manner is pretty hectic when there's just one of you. So I was thinking, if this campaign goes well and nice, I may get the chance to take some more artists for this project, to help with production and elevate it to the best it can be!Not just that, with this kind of strategy, we will be giving jobs to many freelance artists in the field that are in need of help, experience and income as well!All of these can be possible if we do indeed do well!

Other Ways You Can Help
Just continuing to read it over at Tapas and appreciating it is already doing a lot. For that, I do thank you.Not everybody can pledge, this is a fact. But it doesn't mean that not everybody can contribute.Merely sharing this campaign to your friends, acquaintances, family, dogs, enemies, Ex's, can make a huge impact.Hell, if you can make one, meme-ing this would be super cool..With all that said, I shan't bore you with all my blabbering no longer, I leave you, to the world of Aeselin. To the world of wonder that we shall continue to create. Have a mythically good day.

story:
What is This & Why Should I Back it?

  My name is C.B Smallwood & I am the creator of Wildcat. Wildcat is a character that I created sometime around the early '90s. I guess it shows and it should! A fan of many of the comics being put out at that time from Marvel, DC, Malibu, & Image (to name a few) I created a character that reflected the fun & the energy of that time from both comics & film!

I drew inspiration from just about anything John Carpenter directed such as Escape from New York or anything from Troma Films such as The Toxic Avenger. I was influenced by other fine works such as Alien, Aliens, Army of Darkness, The Blues Brothers, Full Metal Jacket, Rambo, Raising Arizona, Exorcist 3...etc. Everything from horror, thriller, mystery, grindhouse to even Spaghetti Westerns! This comic is a love letter to all the great stuff in the '70s, '80s, & '90s that kids today missed out on. 

It has been my dream to draw & make comics for a living. After growing tired of trying to break into the comics industry I decided to dust Wildcat off and pave my own way! Back in 2017, after hopping to one job to another (and the birth of my son) it was time to go all-in or nothing! Written, drawn, inked, colored, & lettered by me, I had to learn to do everything. It was not easy. Sometimes it felt like there was no light at the end of the tunnel, but here we are on IndieGoGo!

 

So Why Should You Back this Book? 

If you want a comic that is fun, thrilling and leaves you excited for more than look no further! If you want to support a comic creator who values your business, and your fandom then I am your man! Your support is an investment in the character Wildcat, in me as a comics creator, and in this new company that puts readers FIRST. No agendas, no politics, no excuses, just comics the way you like them, BIG, BOLD, FUN, & DANGEROUS!

What We Need & What You Get!

There is a fixed goal of $1500 and I plan to use that money for the following:

  • 24 action-packed pages!
  • Printing cost
  • Shipping containers and handling fees
  • Estimated fulfillment begins Oct 2019
  • Any surplus funds from this campaign will go to creating Wildcat issue #2.
  • As a fixed goal campaign, if I do not make the goal of $1500 you will be fully refunded! 

 

 

Risks & Challenges

There are many risks & challenges ahead. But I am doing everything in my power to minimize any potential problems & to work toward a smooth process that makes your contribution to the campaign to the Wildcat comic being delivered to your door as straight forward as possible. 

The biggest risks & challenges for the campaign are:

  • Selecting the right printer for the comic.
  • Wait time for it to be printed.
  • Wait time for it to be shipped to me.
  • Wait time for it to be packaged & shipped to you.

 

My goal is to have this shipped to you by Halloween 2019. If not by then surely by December 2019. (Depends on the wait time of the Printer).

 

Other Ways You Can Help

To be kept up to date on this campaign & all things Wildcat, please follow & subscribe to me at:

  • Twitter: https://twitter.com/CBSmallwood1
  • Youtube: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCm7Of5D9zxi4wI7bA4NvSpQ

story:
A supernatural western adventure.

A band of gritty wild west bounty hunters with occult powers must recapture 72 escaped daemons in order to rebuild King Solomon's Temple and claim the ultimate treasure within. Can these Wranglers of the Unknown rustle up their hellish bounty in time to save the nation?! 

Find out in THE PROSPECTRES: SIGIL OF STOLAS.

A 48 page graphic novel.

Matthew Fowler (Writer) Ricardo Jaime (Art) Marcos Martins (Colors) Eric Weathers (Letters)

FEATURING 2 AVAILABLE COVERS ONLY AVAILABLE THROUGH THIS CAMPAIGN!

(Any other future printings will have Ricardo Jaime cover art.)

CHOOSE COVER A BY ROB WILLIS (COLORS BY MARCOS MARTINS)

OR

COVER B BY CAANAN WHITE (COLORS BY MARCOS MARTINS)

Any questions or concerns please contact us.

Once the campaign closes, all sales are considered final to allow us to get your high quality products to you as quickly as possible.

 

STRETCH GOALS:

$11,000 STRETCH GOAL *LOCKED* - STICKER - Backers receive a PROSPECTRE STICKER by Six AM Comics (STAR FETCHED)

$12,000 STRETCH GOAL *LOCKED* - TRADING CARDS - Backers will receive 4 CAANAN WHITE TRADING CARDS

 

$13,000 STRETCH GOAL *LOCKED* Backers receive a FOLDED POSTER by MYSTERY ARTIST (Stretch goal art TBD)

 

 

$14,000 STRETCH GOAL *LOCKED* Graphic novel is square bound with 4 extra pages of story

$15,000 STRETCH GOAL *LOCKED* Backers receive an archival quality giclée art print from THE PROSPECTRES by legendary Konami video game box cover artist TOM DuBOIS (images below are for art reference) (Stretch goal art TBD)

story:
Overview

Hello.  I am Brian Blair, a horror artist best known for creating my company Pumpkin Pulp.  I have created numerous masks and props for the Horror and Halloween industry.  After years of planning and talking about doing my own horror stories it is finally time.  I am ready to create a new series of horror filled comics called Tales From The Pulp.  With your support, the first issue called Pork Chop will finally become a reality!

How it all started

​I have been an artist my whole life and grew up reading comics like The House of Mystery, Chamber of Chills, Swamp Thing, and Creepy Magazine.  I spent countless hours creating my own stories and drawing horror filled artwork while watching late night horror movies.  I then graduated from Ball State University with a bachelor's degree in Fine Arts.  I later started my venture into the haunt industry when I formed Pumpkin Pulp in 2006 and began making masks and props.  The masks and props began getting world wide attention and are now collected around the globe.  I have always had a dream to take it to the next level and turn my creations into actual characters.  Creating a character and story to go with the mask is a dream come true. 

The Comic

The first story I have created is called Pork Chop.  It is about a young farm girl who grows up in an abusive relationship with her family.  She finds solitude in raising a young piglet she names Pork Chop.  The pig grows up and is the only peace in life the young girl knows. During a fiery night at the house, the father goes on a rampage and slaughters the pig in spite of his daughter.  This sends the daughter, who was already on the edge of sanity, on a violent bloody rage where there is no return.  

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

What We Need & What You Get

My goal is to raise $5000 to cover the costs of printing and labor. 

Your donation will give you access to plenty of cool perks such as:

  • A copy of the comic
  • A Tales from the Pulp poster
  • A Tales from the Pulp T-shirt
  • Your own Pork Chop Mask
  • A chance to be killed in the comic

Be on the look out for more perks as we get closer to our goal. Check out the sidebar for more info on perks and bundles. 

In the unlikely event that we do not reach our goal of $5000, the comic will still be produced as long as we raise 50 percent or more of the goal. 

I have a few great stretch goals for when we go above and above our goal:

  • At $7,500 every donor receiving a physical item shipped to them in the mail will also receive a Tales from the Pulp sticker in their package
  • At $10,000 I will create another short story that will be added to the comic.

Be sure to keep an eye out for other stretch goals to pop up if we meet these.

The Impact

By donating to this campaign, you will be contributing directly to the creation of a new horror classic. Tales from the Pulp calls back to the feeling of classic horror comics like the ones I grew up reading but stands on its own because of its unique style and background. This comic brings the horrifying masks of Pumpkin Pulp to life and turns them into very real characters.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to contribute at this time but still want to help us out, please share our campaign on social media. Keep an eye on our Facebook and Instagram for more updates!

story:
Reality Hangs in the Balance!


The very engine of creation itself, has been activated.  Unchecked, and without direction, will it unmake all of time and space?

Enemies from this world and beyond struggle not to stop it, but to harness it, to reforge reality in their own image.

An ancient being of immense power is forced out of hiding as the world begins to fray at the seams. For eons he has held secrets thought long vanished.  Can he keep that knowledge safe long enough to somehow stop the plans of Would-Be Gods?



 

44+ PAGES of SIMPLY AWESOME COMICS!!

Our vision is to bring a whole host of new stories to you!

  • OUTLIER #1 is a classic, perfect bound, PRESTIGE FORMAT 44+ page Graphic Novel. 
  • This issue is the first in a series of 4 books to be offered via crowdsourcing quarterly, and finally collected in a final omnibus edition to offer to our backers and supporter around the world!
  • More pages depends, at least in part, on you!  This isn't part of our "official" stretch goals, but when we reach the 5000.00 mark I am going to add a special artist appreciation section featuring the incredible work of our Interiors Artist: FLAVIO GIRON, with a gallery of some of his best work as well as his contact information for pin ups and commissions!
  • Luckless Hero Presents (LHP) is all about one thing: SIMPLY AWESOME COMICS! Don'tcha miss those!?
  • Back this project with confidence. The art on OUTLIER #1 is ALREADY 96% complete and all areas of production are ahead of schedule.  It is our COMMITMENT to DELIVER every perk and promise ON TIME!

 

 

30 YEARS OF STORYTELLING FINALLY MAKING A PUBLIC DEBUT!

OUTLIER: WORLD FORGE is the first of many stories from LUCKLESS HERO PRESENTS (LHP)!  Creator, B. Lincoln Bransch has continuously worked on a SECRET UNIVERSE filled with fascinating characters, incredible worlds, rich stories, and ideas hoping to someday share those tales with fans of fantasy, sci-fi and comics. Now through crowdfunding, there is an opportunity! Back this book and see for yourself! 

 

    We want YOU to be a part of building the LHP UNIVERSE!

    There is a plan already in place to create a connected universe of stories spanning multiple genres, realities and timelines featuring a diverse cast of characters and rich stories that celebrate the greatness of comics as they were in the age of creative giants of the past!

    • The next book in the LHP stable is already in the pipeline, with concept art already completed and a sequential artist already lined up to begin production in the coming weeks.
    • We are planning for the future by making connections with creative greats, known and unknown who share the vision of restoring awesomeness and creativity to this medium we love so much!

    Unlike many first time campaigns, LHP has been in the print and production industry for many years

    Simple things like how to properly prepare a book for printing, to actually finding a source to produce the physical product can be daunting for first timers.

    • With decades of experience in Graphic Design and Production getting your books done well is the least of our concerns.
    • Our most important objective is making sure we fulfill all our obligations to every supporter who makes this dream possible.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    Everyone says it, but it's true.  We literally can't do this without YOU!  PLEASE SHARE THIS CAMPAIGN and follow us on social media!

    •   No matter how great our books are, we need readers to enjoy them!  The strength of legends are in the believer! If you like us, TELL  PEOPLE! 
    • Share! And feel free to contact us for more information, interviews and scheduling: blincolnbransch@gmail.com

story:
THE STORY

   When the stars fell from the sky for the first time, the demons crawled from the deepest of the 12 hells and stepped their feet upon the earth, that is when the downfall of mankind begun.

   Many years from now the earth has been destroyed and there is a lack of water, food and natural resources. Only a few million humans have survived, the majority of which live in major cities call Metropolis.

   Without the knowledge of the past, humanity has descended into a new dark age. The existing technology is mostly beneficial for the rich and powerful. Meanwhile a new religion has been formed to torture and control mankind.

   Cruel kings rule the world with the church supporting their oppressive regimes. As if the above were not enough, a blood disease was casted upon mankind like a plague, making blood so valuable that it's being used as currency.

   Our story focuses on Metropolis 1 and Oulrik, son of the fallen rebel Borin. Follow the journey of Oulrik and his companions in their quest to liberate Metropolis 1 from the evil rule of king Brom and bring justice to the common people.

   To do so, he has to pass through a whole army and the elite squad of Pendekar soldiers and their infamous burning swords. But most of all, he has to make peace with the past

Will he succeed?

JOIN THE WAR

BE A REBEL!!!

Issue #1 cover

 

Issue #2 cover

OUR HEROES

Oulrik

Son of the legendary rebel Borin who is being trained by Momentoya and mentored by a mysterious old man, to be a hero of the rebellion and bring justice to his people

 

Momentoya

Former elite member of the rebellion, loyal bodyguard and best friend with the fallen rebel Borin. He was tasked to be Borins bodyguard in their final mission to overthrow the former king but he failed to protect his former friend and comrade. Now he has sworn to protect his son evil king Brom.

 

This is a sample of our work

About the creators

We are two guys from Greece, Aris Sambariotis (the artist) and Kostis Evagelidakis( the writer).

Ever since we were kids we enjoyed anime like Grendizer ,Robotech, Thudercats and many more, we are huge fans of superhero movies and comic books. Our favorite story lines are DCvsMarvel, Civil war, Planet hulk and the death of Superman and our favourite artist is Claudio Castellini. Two years ago we had an idea to make our own comic book, that idea became a script, and here we are now  to tell you our story!

Why you should fund us

To bring those two issues to you, 5 months of work are needed to be done. The majority of time is work after our regular day jobs, We also need money to pay for a website and for advertising our comic.

Risks

There is no actual risk, the first issue is already done and the second one is underway.

Other ways you can help

If you dont want to back our project you can also like and share our facebook page or maybe just tell your friends :)

 

The Team

 

 

Aris Sambariotis is the creator and artist of The Starfall Saga

Kostis Evangelidakis writer and co-creator of The Starfall Saga

 

Christos Evangelidakis is in charge of technical support

 

Apostolis Papakonstantinou is the social media manager

Our favorite story lines are DCvsMarvel, Civil war, Planet hulk and the death of Superman and our favourite artist is Claudio Castellini. Two years ago we had an idea to make our own comic book, that idea became a script, and here we are now  to tell you our story!Why you should fund usTo bring those two issues to you, 5 months of work are needed to be done. The majority of time is work after our regular day jobs, We also need money to pay for a website and for advertising our comic.RisksThere is no actual risk, the first issue is already done and the second one is underway.Other ways you can helpIf you dont want to back our project you can also like and share our facebook page or maybe just tell your friends :) The Team  Aris Sambariotis is the creator and artist of The Starfall SagaKostis Evangelidakis writer and co-creator of The Starfall Saga Christos Evangelidakis is in charge of technical support Apostolis Papakonstantinou is the social media manager

story:
It happens to all of us. We put a load in the washing machine including several pairs of socks, and, invariably, we always wind up with an odd number in the end. Where does that one sock go?  It's out fighting crime, obviously!

SOCK is a 32-page B&W comic with a color cover, that is suitable for all ages. My name is Rickman and this comic has been an idea in my head for a number of years. During the San Diego Comic Con while at the pool with friends after a day at the show, the conversation turned toward the weirdest comic characters we knew. Flaming Carrot, The Tick, Ed the Happy Clown, Reid Fleming: World's Toughest Milkman, Sam and Max: Freelance Police, were all tossed about. The question was asked: what would be the wackiest thing to make into a comic? As my feet dangled in the water I glanced toward my shoes and socks. I reached for my sketchbook (always next to me) and "SOCK" was born.

               

Shortly thereafter an eight-page mini-comic was published, available on my table at shows for several years, along with a poster of the cover. They sold pretty well and the fans were always asking "when are you going to do more?" SOCK wanted his own book.

Sadly, he'd have to wait. Teaching art classes, working as the Creative Director for an advertising agency, and other work had to come first. My first children's book, Zach Meets the Zombie, (which can be found on iTunes Books) was published and had a bit of success. SOCK was up next.

The second story has sock facing off against a actual Super-Villain! The third story features a giant lizard-monster! SOCK's adventures are wordless. The stories are told without exposition or dialogue. There is only one caption box and one word balloon in the whole book!

We are asking for $2500.00. That will get our book printed and cover expenses for printing and creating perks for the various levels. This includes the special perk of the first "Sock Action Figure!" It's a hand made puppet, and it's limited to 20 pieces! Check the video out for a glimpse!

Teaching kids how to create comics for over 10 years has shown me that the medium can be used for the communication of any idea. This comic may be a fun little experience, but I have used the original story to inspire and motivate kids to create their own characters and art for a long time. Seeing this comic to publication will help to inspire them even further.

We understand that everyone can't afford to pledge, and that's cool. If you want to help, please spread the word! Use the Indie go go share tools! We really appreciate all your help!

One of our perks is a selection of 11 x 17 color prints by a host of industry professionals. Some of which can be seen below!

This book has been a dream for quite some time. We hope you will do us the honor of your pledge, and we will deliver the coolest comic book about an undergarment you can imagine!

               

You can see more of my work at RickmanArt.com and Facebook.com/Rickmanarts.

story:
Short Summary

Hi. I'm Dennis Mallonee, the president of Heroic Publishing. We publish a line of superhero comic books featuring wonderful characters such as Flare, Liberty Girl, the League of Champions, WitchGirls Inc, and the Sensational G-Girl.

One of my favorite titles is comic book legend Roy Thomas's ANTHEM, set in an alternate reality in which the Axis powers are on the verge of winning World War II. In that world, America stands on the verge of defeat, and the young heroes of Project Anthem are freedom's last best hope. Heroic Publishing is all about heroes and heroism against all odds, so naturally when Roy first pitched this to me, I fell in love with the concept. 

Only five issues of ANTHEM have thus far been published. But Roy Thomas and the extraordinary artist Benito Gallego are ready to get cracking on issue #6. Roy has plotted out the story, and Benito has already laid out all 24 pages of artwork.

Now we need your help. Let's bring this project to a successful conclusion.

What We Need & What You Get

As part of this project, we're also planning to bring back into print the first four issues of ANTHEM, in brand-new 2nd editions. We have plenty of copies of issue #5, but very few remaining copies of the original editions of issues #1 through #4.

The first $1000 of funding will go toward printing those second editions of the first four issues of ANTHEM.

The next $6500 of funding will help finance the production of ANTHEM #6.

Even if we fall short of that total goal, any funding we do receive will go toward the production of the new ANTHEM comic book. Bottom line: The closer we get, the more quickly we'll be able to get ANTHEM #6 into print.

And if, with your help, we're able to exceed that goal, Roy and Benito are eager to get started on ANTHEM #7, ANTHEM #8, and many more issues yet to come.

As perks, 

  • Digital copies of all six issues of ANTHEM
  • Physical copies of all six issues of ANTHEM, autographed by Roy Thomas
  • Your name immortalized in ANTHEM #6 with a thank you for your contribution
  • Anything else you can think of that you might like to receive; just drop me a note saying what you have in mind, and we'll see if we can't add it to the reward options

The Impact

The story of the young heroes of Project Anthem is a story that Roy and Gallego have been champing at the bit to tell, a story that has only barely begun.

With your help, we can all find out what happens next.

The Time Frame

It will take a few months for Benito to complete the artwork, Roy to complete the script, and get ANTHEM #6 to our printer. Right now, if we can achieve our goal, we're looking toward March of 2019 as the release date. 

But if we can accelerate that and quickly get ANTHEM #6 to our printer, we will.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please get the word out on every social media platform you can.

Any noise you can make about ANTHEM will help us achieve our goal.

story:
The Story

Tiger Dragon: The Rebirth follows the story of Ayame Ozaki, who believes she is possessed by a Demon and forgoes the way of the Tiger Dragon to seek a normal life.

Ayame’s life is irrevocably altered after her parents are murdered. The loss takes a toll on one so young and the pressure of her newfound responsibility forces Ayame to make a decision changing her life forever.

As The Lost and Demons lay claim to planet earth, Ayame has no choice but to seek the Demon she fears to save the one thing she cares about the most, her family.

 

 

The Tiger Dragon series is the mystical female superhero story you’ve been waiting for. Set in modern-day Japan, where The Lost and Demons lay claim to planet earth. However, legend foretells of the great Rebirth, where the most powerful Kami will rise again, delivering justice and reclaiming their place as guardians of planet earth.

If you enjoy stories steeped in Japanese mythology like Demon Slayer, re-imagined Superhero stories like My Hero Academia or games like Final Fantasy, then Tiger Dragon: The Rebirth is for you.

 

Inside Pages of Tiger Dragon: The Rebirth

 

The Perks

Tiger Dragon: The Rebirth is a 168-page full-colour graphic novel, with glossy cover finishing and perfect binding. The graphic novel measures 178mm x 267mm.

     

    Limited Edition two animated lenticular 4” x 6” prints. Bringing Tiger Dragon: The Rebirth to life.

     

    A gold-foil bookmark to help you achieve your grand ambitions. Measuring 55m x 173mm.

     

    Funding Specifics

    This is a fixed funded campaign as we need a minimum of £500 to get Tiger Dragon: The Rebirth into your hands. All funding will go towards printing perks and shipping supplies.

     

    Stretch Goals

    • £3,000 - Animated lenticular prints will be upgraded to 5x7 size.

     

    The Impact

    When you support this campaign, you will receive an original story that will entertain you and take you on a journey. You will become part of the Mastery Grit Comics family and help bring new superheroes into the spotlight.

     

    Risks & Challenges

    There are no risks or challenges as Tiger Dragon: The Rebirth story is complete and when the £500 fixed funding is met, you will get your copy of Tiger Dragon: The Rebirth delivered into your hands ready for you to enjoy.

     

    Other Ways You Can Help

    If you can't contribute to this campaign, then please help by spreading the word to anyone you know that enjoys stories steeped in Japanese mythology like Demon Slayer, re-imagined Superhero stories like My Hero Academia or games like Final Fantasy.

story:
Hi my name is Carlos Cenoz. Im graphic artist and illustrator. I work as illustrator in the advertaisment and publishing areas.

Rome Tenebris is one personal comic project of 120 pages I have start, about Rome.



I love the history and the ancient rome, is one of my favorite age. But usually we see in movies only his struggles in wars, the obsesion for the power of the emperors and the sword fighting of gladiators.

OK thats cool! And I used too. But in my project I will use all this things,  to tell another kind of story. The adventures of exlegionary Quinto during the  investigation of  the murder of a generals friend and other strangers murders  in the shadows of this ancient city.



Unfortunately to afront this kind of projects you need time and this means money :(.

To make the drawing and coloring art in the level and quallity that I want to develop, I Have to expend many work hours and with out support it is inviable.

The timing I will take its about two years to finished and I will have impression and distribution expenses too.

That means I will need a global figure of 29.000€ to develop it.

You can see below some pages that I develop how can it works the aparence that will have the book when will be finished.

 

 


As you can see is a hard work make a comic book of this kind. Thats why is so important the money support to make this kind of art works, and make it possible.

I hope you will like my art work and my idea to support my project.

Maybe you cant support me with money, but however you can share this page and help me to makes the adventure of Quinto happens.

Thanks you!!!

story:
The Story

This campaign will bring issue 3 of our 5 issue series to print, just as prior campaigns successfully did for Issues 1 and 2. 

Death took our penciler, Lovalle Davis, in April of last year. Here is the team that brought you issue 3: 

Preston Poulter (Writer / Creator): Preston Poulter (Writer / Creator): This is my passion project. As I search for meaning and purpose in my own life, I often reflect on what it must have been like to serve one horrible regime in order to fight another. The story of Lilya Litvyak speaks to me, and this project allows me to share her story with others.

Jake Bilbao (Penciler) is a freelance Comic book Artist that has worked on titles like Bloodrayne, Pathfinder, Wolverine.

Diana Greenhalgh (Editor / Inker): Living in Vancouver, Diana has done work for IDW, Marvel, and Upper Deck. 

Blond the Colorist: Industry veteran colorist from series such as Superman, Green Lanterns, and Red Hood & The Outlaws.

Issue 3 finds our two main characters, Katya and Lilya, fighting for their lives over the skies of Stalingrad against an enemy that is better equipped, better trained, and more experienced.  

 Why this project?

I have always had a strange fascination with self-destructive genius. Those people who have amazing ability to create and influence, but can't seem to find any compelling reason for their own existence. 

n fiction, we cloak these figures in noble ambitions towards unrealistic ideals and often give them superhuman powers to defy the odds. Inevitably, these stories become a quest for redemption measured in the number of times the day got saved. But what if it was your self-destructive nature itself that was your superpower?

This story finds Lydia Litvyak, the White Lily of Stalingrad, falling further and further into the grip of her own death wish. And yet, it is that disregard for her own safety that makes her such a fearsome opponent. 

It is in her story that I have found the quintessential tortured genius. 

Who will like this comic?

Obviously if you enjoy war comics, particularly ones set on the Eastern Front like Sara, then this book will appeal to you. 

If you want to see strong female characters fighting to prove their worth in a male dominated society, you will love this story. 

If you struggle with a sense of purpose and wonder what any of it means, that is the central question I tackle here. Lilya holds a dark wish to die a war hero, and those who love her try to get her to find the value of her own life. Her rage and self-destructive tendencies cause her to take terrible risks that make her a feared opponent in air-to-air combat.  

Risks and challenges

The comic has already been completed. I printed an advance copy of Phoenix Fan Fusion and just finished a campaign on Kickstarter to bring it to print. This campaign is for those who missed the Kickstarter or simply prefer to use another platform. There are no risks to fulfillment.

story:
Short Summary

War Angels is a new take on the Valkyrie legend that allows the reader to immerse themselves into a storyline that crosses genres as the War Angels fight against the forces of evil in multiple realms. In some realms magic is as real as science. In others, you'll see futuristic, technologically-advanced civilizations and cultures. And of course, we'll get a gritty view of the modern world as we know it.

As part of this kickstarter MWP Comics has created TWO FULL GRAPHIC NOVELS in the War Angels Universe: WAR ANGELS Volume 1& WAR ANGELS: ORIGINS. 

Note: The image and character of Olga in chapter 3 of War Angels: Origins is based on international model and actress Olga Alberti, from Saint Petersburg, Russia. She has been seen in such magazines as Cosmopolitan, Vogue, Men's Health, and Playboy (Playboy Russia's Miss May 2012).  

The Stories...  

First, War Angels Volume 1

WAR ANGELS VOLUME 1 is the 'main' story arc and follows the character Val in her origin story that allow us to see the world of the War Angels unfold through her eyes. In Chapter 1, we see Val as a seemingly happy high-school girl but soon learn her dark secret. 

 

 

But when she comes to aid of another, her sacrifice draws the attention of a magical order of warriors that have been in a fight against the forces of darkness since before recorded history.

 

In Chapter 2, Val begins to come to grips with the reality of the existence of other realms, namely the magical home realm of the battalion of War Angels known as The Order of the Lioness. But Val is soon thrown into battle as a group of War Angels fall into a trap in the magical, medieval realm of Escinea.   Val is almost killed when she faces her first Wraith Witch, the dark counterpart to the War Angels, but is saved by Ho'nehe (from Issue 1.5).

 

Chapter 3 brings us back to contemporary Earth. Hot on the trail of those that killed their sisters, Val, Raven, and Ho'nehe track their enemy back to the realm of Earth--a Los Angels night club to be exact. But then things go wrong. 

 

AND THE SECOND GRAPHIC NOVEL IS -- WAR ANGELS: ORIGINS

WAR ANGELS: ORIGINS is an anthology of five different origin stories for characters within the WAR ANGELS universe. Multiple artists were used to create unique styles as each character has a unique story.

Chapter 1 is the character Ho’nehe’s origin story. Ho’nehe is a key player in the WAR ANGELS VOLUME 1 and as such, her story is the longest, at 37 B&W pages. Ho’nehe is half Cheyenne/half Lakota Sioux and comes of age as one of the few female warriors during the period of the Plains Wars in the 1870s. When her world is destroyed by a US Cavalry patrol, her actions set in motion events that will not only earn her a place with the War Angels but show the reader why she is special, even among these magical warriors.

 

Chapter 2 shows us the War Angel Winnie. Winnie is a runaway slave in 1850’s Tennessee.

 

Chapter 3 is set in Leningrad in 1942 and introduces the War Angel Olga. Olga is a Russian sniper that sacrifices herself to save another fellow soldier. Heavily outnumbered, she defeats several German soldiers and almost kills the crew of a massive Tiger tank before Olga herself is killed by a German sniper. Now, Chapter 2 ties into Chapter 3 as Winnie, now a full-fledged War Angel, destroys the tank and its crew before taking Olga.

Note: The image and character of Olga is based on international model and actress Olga Alberti, from Saint Petersburg, Russia. She has been seen in such magazines as Cosmopolitan, Vogue, Men's Health, and Playboy (Playboy Russia's Miss May 2012). 

 

 

 

Chapter 4 shows the other side of war by giving insight into how a Wraith Witch is created. This chapter shows that in many cases it is a simple decision that can drive a character toward the dark or the light, such as with the Wraith Witch Ava.  

 

Chapter 5 shows us how one of the captains of The Order of the Lioness became a War Angel. Natali is a Viking shield maiden in 9th century Scandinavia.  

 

 

Risks & Challenges

The artwork is complete. We are working with a printer which is local to us and has done all of our graphic novels.  This is simply a platform to sell our comics to a wider audience. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

In some realms magic is as real as science. In others, you'll see futuristic, technologically-advanced civilizations and cultures. And of course, we'll get a gritty view of the modern world as we know it.
As part of this kickstarter MWP Comics has created TWO FULL GRAPHIC NOVELS in the War Angels Universe: WAR ANGELS Volume 1& WAR ANGELS: ORIGINS. 
Note: The image and character of Olga in chapter 3 of War Angels: Origins is based on international model and actress Olga Alberti, from Saint Petersburg, Russia. She has been seen in such magazines as Cosmopolitan, Vogue, Men's Health, and Playboy (Playboy Russia's Miss May 2012).  
The Stories...  
First, War Angels Volume 1

WAR ANGELS VOLUME 1 is the 'main' story arc and follows the character Val in her origin story that allow us to see the world of the War Angels unfold through her eyes. In Chapter 1, we see Val as a seemingly happy high-school girl but soon learn her dark secret. 

 


 
But when she comes to aid of another, her sacrifice draws the attention of a magical order of warriors that have been in a fight against the forces of darkness since before recorded history.


 
In Chapter 2, Val begins to come to grips with the reality of the existence of other realms, namely the magical home realm of the battalion of War Angels known as The Order of the Lioness. But Val is soon thrown into battle as a group of War Angels fall into a trap in the magical, medieval realm of Escinea.   Val is almost killed when she faces her first Wraith Witch, the dark counterpart to the War Angels, but is saved by Ho'nehe (from Issue 1.5).

 

Chapter 3 brings us back to contemporary Earth. Hot on the trail of those that killed their sisters, Val, Raven, and Ho'nehe track their enemy back to the realm of Earth--a Los Angels night club to be exact. But then things go wrong. 

 

AND THE SECOND GRAPHIC NOVEL IS -- WAR ANGELS: ORIGINS
WAR ANGELS: ORIGINS is an anthology of five different origin stories for characters within the WAR ANGELS universe. Multiple artists were used to create unique styles as each character has a unique story.

Chapter 1 is the character Ho’nehe’s origin story. Ho’nehe is a key player in the WAR ANGELS VOLUME 1 and as such, her story is the longest, at 37 B&W pages. Ho’nehe is half Cheyenne/half Lakota Sioux and comes of age as one of the few female warriors during the period of the Plains Wars in the 1870s. When her world is destroyed by a US Cavalry patrol, her actions set in motion events that will not only earn her a place with the War Angels but show the reader why she is special, even among these magical warriors.

 
Chapter 2 shows us the War Angel Winnie. Winnie is a runaway slave in 1850’s Tennessee.

 
Chapter 3 is set in Leningrad in 1942 and introduces the War Angel Olga. Olga is a Russian sniper that sacrifices herself to save another fellow soldier. Heavily outnumbered, she defeats several German soldiers and almost kills the crew of a massive Tiger tank before Olga herself is killed by a German sniper. Now, Chapter 2 ties into Chapter 3 as Winnie, now a full-fledged War Angel, destroys the tank and its crew before taking Olga.
Note: The image and character of Olga is based on international model and actress Olga Alberti, from Saint Petersburg, Russia. She has been seen in such magazines as Cosmopolitan, Vogue, Men's Health, and Playboy (Playboy Russia's Miss May 2012). 

 

 


 

Chapter 4 shows the other side of war by giving insight into how a Wraith Witch is created. This chapter shows that in many cases it is a simple decision that can drive a character toward the dark or the light, such as with the Wraith Witch Ava.  

 
Chapter 5 shows us how one of the captains of The Order of the Lioness became a War Angel. Natali is a Viking shield maiden in 9th century Scandinavia.  
 


 
Risks & Challenges
The artwork is complete. We are working with a printer which is local to us and has done all of our graphic novels.  This is simply a platform to sell our comics to a wider audience. 
 

Other Ways You Can Help
Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
TEMPEST: Volume One is the first installment in a graphic novel fantasy series. In this first volume, three characters from three different worlds collide in an interwoven adventure as they all search for purpose in the midst of tempestuous chaos. This is a full-color 244-page book in hardcover and digital formats.

TEMPEST is now  available for preorder as we were fully funded in our Kickstarter campaign. If you missed it, here on IGG you can order your copy!  

 

 

 

This first volume of Tempest begins an epic fantasy story. A principled but self-doubting prince, a listless Elf, and a desensitized millennial all find their realities flipped upside down. One is tested. One is enchanted. One is abducted. Each gets caught up in events larger than themselves and must find a way through the chaotic storm.

Featuring adventure, rich symbolism, and mind-bending cosmology stretching across three worlds, Tempest is a story for all lovers of fantasy and searchers of meaning.

I, Natasha Kennedy, have worked for nearly a decade on this story and have attempted to combine a gripping novel series with colorful and imaginative artwork. I have put a lot of years into writing this story and creating a unique world, so TEMPEST is not only an adventure with diverse and unique characters but takes place in a carefully-crafted fantastical universe soaked in rich symbolism.

 

 

TEMPEST is going to be pretty different from anything you have seen before: it will involve a blend of artwork and prose, providing you with a unique experience whether you read the printed hardback book or digitally on a device. 

 

 

There are a couple different rewards you can receive by investing in this project. I want rewards to feel unique, special, and to reflect the gratitude I feel towards you investing financially to make this happen. 

 

Digital PDF of the Book: I have chosen to make this story available digitally—a special version of the book which is designed for scrolling. This will have exceptionally high quality and look fantastic on your digital device.  

 

Hardback Book: I have partnered with a printer who is going to ensure the highest quality in a beautiful hardbound casing. The pages will be heavy weight and glossy. This book is going to look and feel decadent. I highly recommend investing in one! 

 

In the Delux Package, you can receive a signed and numbered copy of the hardback book, as well as the digital PDF, Artwork for print, and a digital copy of one of my 170-page earlier Graphic Novels: Reklas Abandon. 

 

TEMPEST and the press

Why not check out what others have to say about TEMPEST? Here are some interviews and reviews that I have done with Bleeding Cool, Bleeding Fool and Comicon! 

 

 

I have been creating comics and illustrated books for about a decade. I am just a 31-year-old homeschooling Mother of three who devotes her time to writing and drawing, in hopes of getting these stories that live in my head out there for people to read. I am bursting with inspiration and excitement, and I can't wait to share it with others. 

Everything you see here about the campaign was done by me, between raising my kids and doing graphic design on the side. I wrote everything, did all the artwork and put this campaign together. So proud to see it all come together! 

This project is my most-loved and most-anticipated creation. I have poured myself into making TEMPEST for over 10 years, and finally, I can release it to the world! This is amazing. I am just so excited. 

Natasha Kennedy | kozmos.design | Fine me on Twitter, Instagram and Facebook 

 

Risks & Challenges

TEMPEST is a fully-funded project already. The printing presses are running, and I am waiting on a big shipment of books. The only challenges I could imagine slowing me down would be caused by COVID19 slowing down shipment, but I am hopeful that things should be just fine.

story:
Bikers, Russian mob, small time crooks and people in the wrong places in the wrong time. Welcome to the world of Burning Rubber!

Burning rubber is fully finished crime fiction one shot comic (28 pages with 22 sequential pages) from the creative minds of writer Hannu Kesola (Heavy Metal Magazine, Cursed Land), artist Randy Valiente (Army of Darkness, Re-Animator), colorist Lala Narita and letterer Nikki Sherman.

We believe delivering a massive jolt of one-shot action is just modern readers want and deserve and we offer just that with this high octane comic.

SYNOPSIS:

Being a getaway driver is supposed to be easy. But when you unknowingly steal drug money from the Russian mob -- money guarded by an outlaw biker -- troubles can't be far away.

This hard-boiled one-shot tells its high-octane crime story from the perspectives of the getaway driver and the outlaw.

We hope that there are other crime comic fans out there and if you find our comic interesting, please consider supporting it if you can:)

Cover and print art (print is without the logos).

 

We here have some great rewards that includes of course both digital and physical copies of the books and also digital copies of first two issues of other crime fiction book written by Hannu Kesola, Blood, Skulls and Chrome.

We are also offering two exclusive prints (comic book size). On the vice president perk, the two prints and cover of the comic will be printed on metallic synthetic stock.

One of the best rewards is to get pinup drawn from yourself dressed on Revvin' Devils gang clothing by Marcelo Salaza (Image, Titan Comics etc.)! You can also get original art pages from the book by artist Randy Valiente! But be quick, because these spots are limited!

STRETCH GOALS:

2000€ Every physical backer will receive an extra comic size print.

3500€ WILL BE REVEALED LATER

5000€ WILL BE REVEALED LATER

Print 2.

Original art pages.

 

Hannu Kesola (story) is comic book writer and inker from Finland. He currently works or has worked with companies like Action Lab, Heavy Metal, Caliber Comics, Alterna Comics, and Amigo Comics to name a few. His work has also been published in French, Portuguese, Italian, Swedish and Finnish. 

Randy Valiente (art & cover) is comic book artist from the Philippines. He has drawn series like Re-Animator, Army of Darkness and The Twilight Zone for Dynamite Comics.

Lala Narita (colors) is up and coming colorist form Indonesia. Burning Rubber is one of her first comic books she has colored.

Nikki Sherman (letters) is comic book letterer from US. She has lettered several indie comic books during her career.

 

Burning Rubber is 100% finished. Only thing we need to do is get the printer working on the books and to fulfil the rewards that are all shipped by them except the original art rewards that are shipped straight from artist Randy Valiente.

 

Voice over on the video by Vincent Aymor, music by Ilmein.

story:
STORY

Long ago a barrier, the veil, was erected to separate Mankind from the other sentience races. This created two worlds, each with their own unique histories that only intersected each when powerful magics caused breaches allowing the passage from one world into the other.

An orphan from the world of man, with innate magical powers, unknowingly crossed into the Faerie realm where she learned the ways of magic. She grew to become a powerful sorceress under the tutelage of Merlin. Never forgetting the tragedy that lead to her parents being murdered and seeing the Faerie realm constantly embroiled in petty skirmishes she returned to the World  of Man with the vow that she would bring peace to both worlds by any means.

Book will be B&W unless the $8000 stretch goal is met. 


TREBUCHET!!

 

Make Love Not War variant cover by Joseph White

Merchandise Store

Phone cases, t-shirts, blankets, stickers, are available in the store. Please check it out.

https://teespring.com/stores/durakkens-store

 

~~~ STRETCH GOALS ~~~

  • The book will be fully colored

story:
What is RELIC

This story is about a crusader; Franco of Aragon during the invasion of the Island of Malta in 1522 AD, it was the second and ultimately successful attempt by the Ottoman Empire with help from supernatural forces to expel the Knights of Rhodes. Frank our main protagonist was mortally wounded at the massacre, unknown to him and the Crusader Knights, angels were sent from heaven in human form to assist the Knights. An angel in human form was also wounded during the battle and fell on-top of Franco's body, his blood poured into Franco’s wounds and the angel's blood began to change Franco as he was dying.

You Get

  • 40+ pages of supernatural, medieval, superhero action.
  • Cover A is colored by the fantastic Brett R. Smith!
  • Cover B is illustrated by yours truly.
  • We'll have cover A to be made into a pin-up.
  • Trading cards and bookmarks to give with every order.

The Project

  • I created Relic to tell a supernatural story within a superhero world with the best visual art I can make, I don't see much of that in the mainstream industry so I decided to throw my hat in and see where it lands.
  • I've done work for Moonstone Books, AC comics and I have a space western comic that was printed by Antarctic Press 2yrs ago call SIDEWINDER.
  • I love the escapism comics bring to the world and i would like to bring you stories with no political agenda.
  • I see the industry changing I would love to be part of it.
  • I will be adding more stretch goals if we get funded!

Other Ways You Can Help:

  • Help us get the word out about your campaign via social media and word of mouth.

 

THE ART!




This is cover A, is penciled and inked by Dennis Chacon and colored by Brett R. Smith.


This is cover B, is penciled, inked and colored by Dennis Chacon
Page 1 inks

Page 2 inks

Page 3 inks
