story:
Read the first 13 pages of The Unclean issue #1 here

The Unclean is a new horror/superhero comic series from the creative team behind TRESPASSER from Alterna Comics. Volume one of The Unclean is titled 'Nests' and will span six full length issues.

In 'Nests', we will meet the cast of characters— a woefully unlucky group of teenagers who make the fateful mistake of trying to summon a demon at their Halloween party. They find themselves possessed by bloodthirsty spirits hellbent on revenge and hunted by the legions of Hell who seek to wipe them off of the face of the Earth. Over the course of the first six issues, they will struggle to come to terms with what happened while dealing with more immediate problems like school, their parents, and a deadly, body-hopping parasite with a sadistic streak.

Power always comes at a cost

The Unclean is set to be a long series, taking place over several volumes, and for that reason we will need help from readers to see it through. Contributions from fans will help to offset the remaining costs of production on volume one, and we are offering a lot of cool rewards for helping us reach our goal. The first half of issue one has been completed (read full preview here!) and scripts are complete for the rest of the story arc. The money raised by the Indiegogo campaign will be used to help finish the rest of Volume One—pencils, inks, colors and lettering— and produce a graphic novel collecting the first arc. Any additional income will go towards Volume Two's initial production.

If the funds are raised successfully, we will complete the first six issues and produce a graphic novel collecting the entire arc together, as both a digital and physical release. Alterna Comics will also be publishing the series in single issue format as part of its newsprint line, available in stores and online.

Halloween night.

Six friends go into an abandoned orphanage for a night of spooky, drunken fun. The party really gets started when they decide to perform an arcane ritual at the stroke of midnight.

The spell is supposed to summon a benevolent demon, and the kids follow the instructions to the letter. They speak the words just as they are written, and they spill the blood to sign the pact, just as the book tells them.

But something goes horribly wrong, and the entity which appears before them is anything but benevolent.

Lord of Unclean Things. The Crooked King. The True Face of Madness. Kilanthrotep.

Unfortunately the demon Kilanthrotep has a use for the kids beyond simply devouring their souls. He seeks vengeance upon the mortal occultist who betrayed and trapped him over a century ago, and he wants the children to serve as his agents on Earth and the heralds of his return.

Their souls tainted and their bodies possessed by bloodthirsty spirits, the group of friends has little choice but to do Kilanthrotep's bidding, even at the cost of their own humanity. 

Justin M. Ryan is the author of Trespasser (2016)and The Unclean (upcoming), both published by Alterna Comics. He lives in Florida with his wife and an alarming number of cats.

Kristian Rossi (born 30 April 1980) is an Argentine comic book artist. He began his professional career as an artist doing animation. After working for several years in this field, he decided to focus mainly on his true passion— making comics. He delved into the world of comics under the guidance of Argentinian comic masters like Marcelo Frusin and Eduardo Risso, to whom he is currently working as an assistant. For over a decade Kristian has been working as a comic book artist in titles like The Temporal, Chambers (Arcana), Horror City (Legion), Miss Capi, Libertadores, Proyecto Tifón (Capitán Ediciones), Malvinas: El sur, el mar, el frío (Eduvim), Half-Life: A Place in the West (Steam), Black Crown Quarterly, Hey Amateur! (Black Crown/IDW) and Trespasser (Alterna Comics). Currently developing various comic book projects with different creators, titles like Voidwalker and Rad Rose (Alterna Comics), The Gods Fear Me (Chibi Comics) and Brian Azzarello's and Eduardo Risso's Moonshine (Image Comics), where Kristian is working as a colorist. Besides his comic book career, Kristian is part of the organizational committee of Crack Bang Boom,  a comics, cartoon, cosplay, fantasy and science-fiction convention annually held in the city of Rosario and which has become the most famous convention in Argentina, as well as one of the most important events for the comics world in South America.

DC Hopkins is a professional letterer & designer whose clients include IDW, Lion Forge, DC, BOOM! Studios, Dynamite, Heavy Metal, Disney, Tor, and more. He is also a staff letterer at Deron Bennett’s AndWorld Design studio. DC lives in Indiana with his wife and son and stacks of unread books.

Alterna Comics is New England's largest comic book & graphic novel publisher. Alterna Comics publishes creator-owned stories distributed all over the world since 2006. Bringing Back Newsprint, Affordable Prices, and Comics for Everyone. Available at your local comic shop, newsstand, and bookstore.

Recognition: You will have your name printed in the collected editions of the book, both the digital and physical graphic novels.

1920x1080 Desktop Wallpaper by German Peralta: Digital wallpaper for your desktop background from featured guest artist German Peralta! This reward will be free to all backers.

*Issue #1 Digital: A digital copy of the first issue of The Unclean, made available as soon as it is finished. A preview of the first issue can be read here.
*Available as an add-on perk

*Volume 1 (issues #1-6) Digital: You'll get the full digital collection of The Unclean Volume One: Nests. That includes six full issues. You will receive the first issue as soon as it is finished and then a separate .pdf file containing all six issues once they are collected.
*Available as an add-on perk

*Volume 1 (issues #1-6) Physical: You'll get a printed graphic novel containing the first six issues of The Unclean, collecting the first story arc titled 'Nests'. You will receive a digital copy of the first issue as soon as it is finished, and a physical copy of the collected edition once it has been completed and printed.
*Available as an add-on perk

A4 Art Print by Nico Di Mattia: We are very lucky to feature an amazing piece of mind-bending art from Nico depicting his take on Ozzie and his alter ego, The Figment!

In 2007, Nico Di Mattia received worldwide attention with his videos "Speed Painting" on his YouTube channel, which today have more than 100 million views.
He currently works as illustrator of movie posters, comic book cover artist and editorial illustrator in different agencies, private clients and companies around the world, such as The Wall Street Journal (Asia), Radical Studios (USA), Zampediverse (Italy), La Cosa Cine, Space, Warner Channel, 100 Bares (Argentina), among others.
He's given talks and seminars of digital illustration on International Art & comics Conventions and Universities in Taiwan, Colombia, Peru, Ecuador, Bolivia, Uruguay, Chile and Argentina.
He's recently illustrated three movie posters for the film "El Cuento de las Comadrejas", from the Academy Award winning director Juan J. Campanella.
Instagram: @nicodimattia

The Unclean T-Shirt: Show your allegiance to The Crooked King himself with this t-shirt.

Available in a variety of sizes. (Unisex)

Limited Edition Exclusive 11x14 Poster signed and numbered by Juan Frigeri: Available only through this Indiegogo campaign, Juan Frigeri will be signing and numbering no more than 50 copies of this 11x14 print. After all of them are sold, it will return to the abyss whence it came, never to be seen again.

Commissions by The Unclean artist Kristian Rossi (5x7 and 8x10 available): The Unclean artist Kristian Rossi will draw any character of your choice (not just from The Unclean—ANY character), complete to inks, on either a 5x7 or 8x10 sheet. Multiple characters available for an additional cost (add the 'additional character' add-on perk at check-out). 

Signed original art from The Unclean Vol. 1: You will receive one original, signed page from The Unclean Vol. 1 complete to inks.

This reward will be sent out shortly after the digital graphic novel, so you will be able to request a specific page or pages, though it will be first come, first served so you may be asked to pick again if a page is already claimed.

Appear in the book (Extras and Speaking Roles available): You will appear in the first volume as an extra, so you will finally know the answer to the age-old question of how you would look when drawn by Kristian Rossi. There are two speaking roles available, and a handful of non-speaking roles waiting to be filled!

*Trespasser Digital Graphic Novel: The first collaboration of The Unclean team, Trespasser, was released as a four issue mini-series from Alterna Comics and later collected as a graphic novel. Trespasser tells the story of a hunter who finds a wounded alien in a bear trap near his house, and the fallout surrounding the event. It's a great way to see what we're all about. *Available as an add-on perk

 

**THE UNCLEAN Refrigerator Magnet: Remind yourself not to perform any profane rituals in abandoned orphanages every time you grab a bite of egg salad.
**Available ONLY as an add-on perk to physical rewards

 

**THE UNCLEAN bookmark set: Don't get lost!
 **Available ONLY as an add-on perk

+ $4,000 - Issue #7 Digital (Vol. 2 - Issue One) for all backers above $5: At $4,000 over the mark for this campaign, we would be able to go into production on Volume Two immediately. The first issue, Blood and Bone, dives into the history of The Unclean's primary antagonist and sets the stage for the rest of the series. If we reach this goal, everyone who backs The Unclean: Volume One at any level over $5 will get a free, digital copy of this story as soon as it is available.

+ $12,500 - Issues #7-12 Digital (Vol. 2) for all backers above the $10 mark: If we manage to raise this much over the requested amount, we are well on our way to being able to produce Volume Two. As a thank you to those who made it happen, every backer for Volume One over the $15 mark will receive, for free, a digital copy of the second volume when it is released!

+ $18,000 - Issues #7-12 Physical (Vol. 2) for all backers above the $25 mark: At $18,000 over the initially requested amount, we will be able to fully produce and print Volume Two of The Unclean. This won't be possible without a huge amount of support from our readers and to show our thanks, everyone who backed Volume One at any reward tier over $25 will receive the physical graphic novel of Volume Two at no extra charge.

Risks and challenges

There is always a chance for delays due to emergencies within the creative team, delays in printing/shipping, etc. however we will do everything we can to minimize and expedite the process. The creative team has experience working together without issue, and we are all used to working on deadlines and finishing projects. We've run a successful kickstarter in the past with no issues, including printing and distributing a graphic novel, also in cooperation with Alterna Comics.

Besides his comic book career, Kristian is part of the organizational committee of Crack Bang Boom,  a comics, cartoon, cosplay, fantasy and science-fiction convention annually held in the city of Rosario and which has become the most famous convention in Argentina, as well as one of the most important events for the comics world in South America.DC Hopkins is a professional letterer & designer whose clients include IDW, Lion Forge, DC, BOOM! Studios, Dynamite, Heavy Metal, Disney, Tor, and more. He is also a staff letterer at Deron Bennett’s AndWorld Design studio. DC lives in Indiana with his wife and son and stacks of unread books.Alterna Comics is New England's largest comic book & graphic novel publisher. Alterna Comics publishes creator-owned stories distributed all over the world since 2006. Bringing Back Newsprint, Affordable Prices, and Comics for Everyone. Available at your local comic shop, newsstand, and bookstore.Recognition: You will have your name printed in the collected editions of the book, both the digital and physical graphic novels.1920x1080 Desktop Wallpaper by German Peralta: Digital wallpaper for your desktop background from featured guest artist German Peralta! This reward will be free to all backers.*Issue #1 Digital: A digital copy of the first issue of The Unclean, made available as soon as it is finished. A preview of the first issue can be read here.*Available as an add-on perk*Volume 1 (issues #1-6) Digital: You'll get the full digital collection of The Unclean Volume One: Nests. That includes six full issues. You will receive the first issue as soon as it is finished and then a separate .pdf file containing all six issues once they are collected.*Available as an add-on perk*Volume 1 (issues #1-6) Physical: You'll get a printed graphic novel containing the first six issues of The Unclean, collecting the first story arc titled 'Nests'. You will receive a digital copy of the first issue as soon as it is finished, and a physical copy of the collected edition once it has been completed and printed.*Available as an add-on perkA4 Art Print by Nico Di Mattia: We are very lucky to feature an amazing piece of mind-bending art from Nico depicting his take on Ozzie and his alter ego, The Figment!In 2007, Nico Di Mattia received worldwide attention with his videos "Speed Painting" on his YouTube channel, which today have more than 100 million views.He currently works as illustrator of movie posters, comic book cover artist and editorial illustrator in different agencies, private clients and companies around the world, such as The Wall Street Journal (Asia), Radical Studios (USA), Zampediverse (Italy), La Cosa Cine, Space, Warner Channel, 100 Bares (Argentina), among others.He's given talks and seminars of digital illustration on International Art & comics Conventions and Universities in Taiwan, Colombia, Peru, Ecuador, Bolivia, Uruguay, Chile and Argentina.He's recently illustrated three movie posters for the film "El Cuento de las Comadrejas", from the Academy Award winning director Juan J. Campanella.Instagram: @nicodimattiaThe Unclean T-Shirt: Show your allegiance to The Crooked King himself with this t-shirt.Available in a variety of sizes. (Unisex)Limited Edition Exclusive 11x14 Poster signed and numbered by Juan Frigeri: Available only through this Indiegogo campaign, Juan Frigeri will be signing and numbering no more than 50 copies of this 11x14 print. After all of them are sold, it will return to the abyss whence it came, never to be seen again.Commissions by The Unclean artist Kristian Rossi (5x7 and 8x10 available): The Unclean artist Kristian Rossi will draw any character of your choice (not just from The Unclean—ANY character), complete to inks, on either a 5x7 or 8x10 sheet. Multiple characters available for an additional cost (add the 'additional character' add-on perk at check-out). Signed original art from The Unclean Vol. 1: You will receive one original, signed page from The Unclean Vol. 1 complete to inks.This reward will be sent out shortly after the digital graphic novel, so you will be able to request a specific page or pages, though it will be first come, first served so you may be asked to pick again if a page is already claimed.Appear in the book (Extras and Speaking Roles available): You will appear in the first volume as an extra, so you will finally know the answer to the age-old question of how you would look when drawn by Kristian Rossi. There are two speaking roles available, and a handful of non-speaking roles waiting to be filled!*Trespasser Digital Graphic Novel: The first collaboration of The Unclean team, Trespasser, was released as a four issue mini-series from Alterna Comics and later collected as a graphic novel. Trespasser tells the story of a hunter who finds a wounded alien in a bear trap near his house, and the fallout surrounding the event. It's a great way to see what we're all about. *Available as an add-on perk **THE UNCLEAN Refrigerator Magnet: Remind yourself not to perform any profane rituals in abandoned orphanages every time you grab a bite of egg salad.**Available ONLY as an add-on perk to physical rewards **THE UNCLEAN bookmark set: Don't get lost! **Available ONLY as an add-on perk+ $4,000 - Issue #7 Digital (Vol. 2 - Issue One) for all backers above $5: At $4,000 over the mark for this campaign, we would be able to go into production on Volume Two immediately. The first issue, Blood and Bone, dives into the history of The Unclean's primary antagonist and sets the stage for the rest of the series. If we reach this goal, everyone who backs The Unclean: Volume One at any level over $5 will get a free, digital copy of this story as soon as it is available.+ $12,500 - Issues #7-12 Digital (Vol. 2) for all backers above the $10 mark: If we manage to raise this much over the requested amount, we are well on our way to being able to produce Volume Two. As a thank you to those who made it happen, every backer for Volume One over the $15 mark will receive, for free, a digital copy of the second volume when it is released!+ $18,000 - Issues #7-12 Physical (Vol. 2) for all backers above the $25 mark: At $18,000 over the initially requested amount, we will be able to fully produce and print Volume Two of The Unclean. This won't be possible without a huge amount of support from our readers and to show our thanks, everyone who backed Volume One at any reward tier over $25 will receive the physical graphic novel of Volume Two at no extra charge.Risks and challengesThere is always a chance for delays due to emergencies within the creative team, delays in printing/shipping, etc. however we will do everything we can to minimize and expedite the process. The creative team has experience working together without issue, and we are all used to working on deadlines and finishing projects. We've run a successful kickstarter in the past with no issues, including printing and distributing a graphic novel, also in cooperation with Alterna Comics.

story:
You've got the power.

The power to give birth to a spider who will save the world.

The power to help an ordinary kid who awakens after a horrific brain injury to a whole new reality that comes with his newfound ability to change his body or mind, changing the lives of others in a split second.

The power to ensure you'll soon be going on an adventure that lasts, one that will thrill you, enthrall you and enliven the life you lead.

All that's needed to make this happen?  Your pocket change. 

Here's our story. After you read it, we hope you will give us the power to do what we do best: create or tell the YOUR stories in the finest comic books the world has seen.

Take Sergei the Spider, for example.  He’s not just ANY spider.  Give Sergei the Spider a leg up and you’ll boost seven more bonus legs up for free.  Because Sergei is indeed a spider in man’s clothing.  Or a man with strong spider tendencies.  *But* he’s not Spider-Man.  He’s a Spider,  man.   He’s a former energy warlord from Ukraine here to save the world’s inhabitants from themselves!

*OR*  Be an ally in guiding Luminary into being!  He’s a nobody kid just going to school, and truly minding his banal, and angst-ridden business, when he is confronted and attacked, leaving him with a traumatic brain injury.  When he awakens… he realizes that things are not the same and (pun alert!) he should have quit while he was ahead! His powers and antics will amuse and entertain like none other!

Gemini Comics and thousands of our closest friends (that's YOU, Pilgrim!) present SERGEI THE SPIDER and LUMINARY...the first two of four unique titles in development!

But we need your help to do it.

As CEO and editor-in-chief of Gemini Comic Books, LLC, it is my pleasure to tell you that each title will, in methods sometimes subtle, sometimes in your face and always compelling, deal with a social or political issue relevant in today's complicated world.  We know what you’re hungry for, Pilgrim!  And we know you it has nothing to do with the words “fake news” or "Yuge".

YES, there will action - as much as you can handle!  Sure there will be fists and energy a-flyin'!  You best believe there will be Sci-Fi and Fantasy genre themes and motifs to satisfy the every craving of your peckish, nerdy tummy!  But there’s a difference between our universe and others that so many marvel about.

You see, OUR universe is built around the following truism:  a great comic book NEVER revolves around the mask or the cape.   We know the essential element that makes a comic book truly compelling!  The PERSON beneath the mask and/or the individual who chooses to wear the cape rather than the cap, vest and jeans I'm wearing right now.  Not JUST a cap and vest, mind you, but a cap and vest all the same. Hell, I hope capes come into fashion!  And don't get me started on spats. Anyway...

Here Comes the Pitch!

PLEASE join us and send your pennies in - a few or a whole vault full - to help us launch our brand of comic books.  Believe me,  we will cherish every red, white or blue cent that comes our way.  Because we will use those pennies for the pencils to draw our characters, for the ink that will make their drab grey lives burst into living color, for the paper and servers that will become the home in which they live AND for the office that will become OUR home as we utilize our sweat, giggles and tears to create a fascinating, glorious universe.  Your funding will make every penny we ever spent on student loans worthwhile by making something that even Grandma will be proud (as long as she skips a few pages carefully selected pages on occasion)!  Meow.

Now, I hope you don’t think I’ve assembled a team who just arrived on the Greyhound after attending their first Comic-Con.  Noooooo… Instead, I interviewed dozens of talented people - ridiculously talented people…and proceeded to turn them down.  

I kept looking until the level of talent matched my vision of how the universe would feel.  It wasn't enough to hire the guy who could ink like a maniac if he didn't understand the big picture.  Each mortal piece of the Gemini Comics' puzzle had to have a heartfelt understanding of what we intend to do here.  And eventually, I found my sweet spot - the six people I knew I would be proud to introduce as my colleagues; people who were experienced enough to do a phenomenal job in their lane so I didn't have to worry about going there myself. People I could trust as I focused on my A-Game.  People I'd still like after having spent 16 straight hours with in the “Bull Pen” that is our office.  People with loyalty.  Drive.  Talent.  Strength of character.  People who, like me, are considered to be a little bit “off” but wear that consideration as a proverbial badge of courage.

People like these are rare. They're those proverbial "diamond in the haystack" folks who give you faith in humanity. They're almost impossible to find - akin to a unicorn. But I found them. Oh yes I did. I also have to PAY them.  And I promise you this: If you could meet them, and you will, you’d WANT to help pay their salaries.

I almost forgot the most important trait each of them share:  HONESTY.  And that's something I haven't exactly been showered with as of late. I’ll explain. The truth of it is this: As a start-up company, we are in one heck of a pickle. And, dear reader…it's a dilly.  Are your violins tuned up? Good. Time to get 'em out.

The former CEO of the company -  take note of the word FORMER - turned out to be nothing more than a Flim-Flam Man (otherwise known as a scoundrel).  He hired me, telling me he would invest hundreds of thousands of dollars into his new comic book company, centering it around my ideas and talents while introducing me to the many savvy, successful business icons and celebrities who were his friends or associates.

At this point, what's left of my pride is screaming at me to note that I am NOT someone who is easy to fool. I tend to read people quite easily and spot those who are wearing waders with both practiced and natural ease.  But this guy was the king of Flim, the queen of Flam and the Crown Prince of Scam.  By the time I began to pay attention to the assortment of heckling red flags, (my paychecks were MIA, the phone had been disconnected with no warning and I hadn't yet been asked to schmooze with Gene Simmons, much less Milli OR Vanilli), the Flim-Flam Man had disappeared.

So what did I do?  Need you ask?  I threw on my cape (and spats!) and FOUND the motherf…pardon me…I threw on my cape (and spats!) and FOUND the Flim-Flam Man.  Where you ask?

In jail!

Ol' Flimmy is facing seven counts of embezzlement. With a very healthy bond. Last I checked, none of the his rich and powerful pals had offered him a get out of jail free card. Or $25,000 to pass "Go".

Many an individual in my position would have run away screaming from the seeds of the company that had been planted at this point, but after a (vodka-soaked) weekend-long pity party, I saw the situation much clearer and realized the company had been centered around me all along.  Myself and the oh so talented people I had hired!  The people that the Flim-Flam Man had pledged to pay.

With 20/20 vision, I experienced somewhat of an epiphany.  All of those talented people I had hired and the excited followers and fans were still there, waiting impatiently to read our comic books.  Plus, all of the characters and stories I'd created were still safe where they'd always been - in my little ol' noggin (as if it’s safe in there...sheesh!) except for those I had allowed to come out onto blue-line storyboards, enabling them to get involved in situations that will literally…. Blow. Your. Mind.!

Only two things had changed: I no longer had the Flim-Flam Man in my life and I no longer had any financial backing, which, really had been an illusion all along.  I examined the situation once more.  Could I find financial backing from a person or people who believed in the strength of our characters and stories as much as I do?  I believe I can.  

I believe YOU are the investors I needed all along.  I promise Gemini Comics won't let you down.  You’re going to be blown away. And you're going to be able to say, “I helped make it happen.”

story:
We have put so much passion into this project, Alejandra has definitely become a family member to us and it's thrilling, scary, exciting and downright emotional to watch her grow and evolve through the series. 

We have had our own struggles to find the perfect medium to tell the world about Alejandra and we think, no, we know that we have found the correct one. We have gotten this far with her story by ourselves, now, we want to invite the world into the Abandon All Hope family.


ABANDON ALL HOPE?

The journey of "ABANDON ALL HOPE" began 3 years ago with an epic 90 page screenplay. Our idea was to bring another ass kicking strong female lead character to life, taking inspiration from Ripley (Aliens) and Sarah Conner (Terminator). We wanted the whole story to center around one broken character, as she lives alone and fights solo to complete her mission. She must learn and adapt with each days obstacles as she gets closer and closer to her goals.




THE STORY?

‘Abandon All Hope’ is a dark sci-fi action story with a hint of drama in the mix. In Volume 1 we follow the footsteps of a cloned soldier Alejandra who is forced to search alone for human life in a dark world now inhabited by a violent alien race. Readers are thrown into the story two years after the invasion, when earth is at its darkest time and our hero Alejandra is deciding if it is time to give up hope or not. Alejandra is being broken down physically and emotionally after every unsuccessful day. Unknown memories are affecting her and her enemy is only getting stronger and their army only bigger.

Both scripts for Volume 2 & 3 are complete. 


WE WANT TO SHARE WITH YOU.

We have created ‘Abandon All Hope’ to appeal to everyone. Alejandra is a bad ass chick who is ruthless in her defense of her world but on the other hand she is sensitive and inquisitive. There is self-discovery, there is connection, there is blood, amputations, explosions and booty. We want you to join us on this journey.



WHERE WILL THE MONEY GO?

The money raised in this campaign will go toward

- Paying our amazing artists for their time and hard work to create the remaining 51 pages. This includes the penciling, inking and coloring.

- Production of our great perks (Printing the perks, shipping Australia-wide and Internationally)

- IndieGogo and related fees.

- Any extra made will first and foremost complete Abandon All Hope Vol 1's journey to the print hub, then kick off production of ‘Abandon All Hope’ Vol 2!


THE TEAM?

We have already put so much passion and heart into this project, including taking our time to find a talented art team that would best bring the words to life and we could not be more happy with who we have chosen. They have both been a pleasure to work with and every page has been better then we could have hoped for, just see for yourself.

Hailing from different parts of the globe, meet the team that created Alejandra and her world.


L.A Keim – Co-Owner of Free Fall Productions Australia, an indie film production company based in Brisbane, Aus. Writer of Abandon All Hope.

Amy Straughan - Co-owner of Free Fall Productions Australia/Co-writer of Abandon All Hope.

New York based Artist - James Beihl (Penciller/Inker) –

http://jabeihl.deviantart.com/

UK based Colorist - Kirsty Swan (Colors) –

https://www.facebook.com/Kirstyswancomics

HOW DO I GET INVOLVED?

To become a part of the Abandon All Hope family.

Simply click on the amount that you would like to pledge, sign up (it’s very simple) and pay with a credit card through the 'Guest Checkout' on PayPal or use your personal PayPal account.

Our campaign is a 'Fixed Funding' campaign which means that any money that you contribute will be deducted from your nominated card right away but refunded to you within 3 - 5 working days of the crowdfunding deadline if the goal of $10,000AUD is not met.

That’s not it though, for every different level of monetary amount, we have listed perks just for you. We want to give something back.

To say thank you for your support and to let you know just how much we appreciate you believing in us and Abandon All Hope.

Throughout the campaign we will be adding new perks as new artwork comes along. Also, if we reach our goal of $10,000 we will be adding our Stretch Goal perks !!

That’s still not it, we will be regularly updating our campaign page, also our Twitter/Facebook , website and Instagram. We will also be adding the ability to pre-order the first volume (printed issue) halfway through its production on our website (coming soon).



12.03.15 - UPDATE

Poster options added :)
First two here. Colored options coming soon.




13.03.15 - UPDATE

Poster Option #3 Alejandra in Action

York based Artist - James Beihl (Penciller/Inker) – http://jabeihl.deviantart.com/

UK
based Colorist - Kirsty Swan (Colors) – https://www.facebook.com/Kirstyswancomics

HOW
DO I GET INVOLVED?
To become a part of the Abandon All Hope family.
Simply click on
the amount that you would like to pledge, sign up (it’s very simple) and pay with a credit card through the 'Guest Checkout' on PayPal or use your personal PayPal account.Our campaign is a 'Fixed Funding' campaign which means that any money that you contribute will be deducted from your nominated card right away but refunded to you within 3 - 5 working days of the crowdfunding deadline if the goal of $10,000AUD is not met. That’s not it though, for every different level of monetary amount, we have
listed perks just for you. We want to give something back. 
To say thank you
for your support and to let you know just how much we appreciate you believing
in us and Abandon All Hope.Throughout the campaign we will be adding new perks as new artwork comes along. Also, if we reach our goal of $10,000 we will be adding our Stretch Goal perks !!  That’s still not it, we will be regularly updating
our campaign page, also our Twitter/Facebook , website and Instagram. We will
also be adding the ability to pre-order the first volume (printed issue) halfway through its
production on our website (coming soon). 12.03.15 - UPDATEPoster options added :) First two here. Colored options coming soon. 13.03.15 - UPDATEPoster Option #3 Alejandra in Action

story:
Overview

Dannphan here~ And I’m very excited to share with you the first issue in what could be a unique mini-series!

ORGASM GIRL is an 22-page action comedy about a professional boxer named Amari who has a dirty little secret… She can make any man she touches orgasm with a snap of her fingers!

With penciler Sanity, inker Brian Lee and colorist Nick Caponi, we were really able to give Amari that life and energy that she needed. Each of these bad boys have the skills that guarantee visually pleasing, smooth and exciting art.

So if you want her, come and get her! Back the project today!

(Promo art done by penciler Josh James, inker Steve Feane, and colorist Nick Caponi)

Story

Amari is a boxer famous for defeating men at their own game of rough and tough. But when she witnesses her young fan being kidnapped by a trafficking cult, she steps up from a lowly cheater to an unlikely hero! Strap in for the action-packed, hilarious and amorous… ORGASM GIRL!

Development

Me and Josh had been planning making a comic together for a while now, and I never thought for a second this was the comic we would be doing! I pitched a bunch of different ideas I had accumulated, but (shockingly) this is the one that really stood out to him. Originally Orgasm Girl was going to be a webcomic I was making on the side, but now rather than working on it all with my lonesome self, I have the ultimate comic team! And while Josh may not being doing the interior penciling anymore, he still played a big part in putting together the story you see here.

The idea was to make a character with a stupid, yet useful super power, and the ability to make people orgasm came to mind. From there I thought up villains, puns, and all kinds of crazy things~

Check out what we’ve got so far!

 

Looks pretty great, right?

We’ll have everything colored and printed with a nice matte interior coating for the finished product.

 

Goodies and Stretch Goals

We want only the best for our backers, so we've stuff every tier with a little something extra.

We have special looks at concept art, desktop backgrounds, signed copies, stickers, posters, and even exclusive original art for the super fan who wants something more!

(By KeepOnSanity)

(By Iain Miki)

(By... Wait, that's mine)

(I couldn't resist a crossover)

And yes, adorable stickers! STICKERS people!!!

But if you think that's hot, check out this SWEET pin-up poster Av Jacobs did for us!

 

Keep helping push our project, and we will give you the best of goodies!

12k Bookmarks for everyone!

15k Exclusive New Poster

18k ???

 

Where the Money Goes

Other than paying the art team, a lot of money is going to go towards shipping. We’ll be using Gemini shipping packages to make sure no one’s comic gets destroyed in a horrible postman accident. Unfortunately, we're not doing international shipping overseas for this campaign. But cheer up! You can always get the digital package!

The other two major factors would go towards printing and the other perks for those of you who want a little something extra.

For a full idea of our costs, take a look at the chart below…

story:
In 1920s Chile, an aloof clairvoyant girl named Clara De Valle is shown to have unnatural capabilities. From moving items with her mind or being able to tell when someone she knows will die, her abilities only add to her allure and mystery. After the loss of his previous fiancée and a request made by his mother on her deathbed, Esteban Trueba finds himself mysteriously drawn to the strange girl. Soon it will be revealed that his attraction was not mere coincidence, but rather her strange abilities calling out to him. Sadly, however, Esteban's attraction to Clara was possibly one of the worst things to happen in her life.

The House of the Spirits by Isabel Allende had drawn me in during the time of the pandemic and had kept me entertained well into the summer of 2020 and I had the opportunity to make a comic adaption of her work during my time attending school. The idea of holding one of my own comics in my hands and mailing it out to people who would be interested in reading my work is enough for me to push for this project to happen including finding all the many ways of making those printed comics happen.

story:
WISDOM COMES - CHAPTER ONE

Interior cover

Wisdom Comes is the life-story of Daerokos Galvan, a troubled realist fueled by his unbreakable ambition and a desire to see the end of his peoples' suffering.

 

Here he is in the three most important and formative stages of his life.
 

Black Maw, the Alpha-Dragon of Hera! Source of all terror!

Through sheer primal dominance, Black Maw directs his legion of dragons to slaughter innocent people all across Hera.

Interior sequentials

Exterior Cover for Chapter One

More art will be posted here as it gets completed!

Big BADASS physical map for all those lucky subscribers! (Design subject to change, but here's a progress shot!)

WHAT IS WISDOM COMES?

Wisdom Comes is the life story of Daerokos Galvan, a troubled young realist with one goal in mind: to eradicate his planet's dragons in order to save his people from extinction.

In this first chapter, you'll learn of the bloody history of Hera's children, and what set Daerokos on his path to becoming a living legend!

You'll also be introduced to Black Maw, the Alpha-Dragon of Hera! Kronokosto, as the locals call him, is the biggest and baddest dragon around, and commands all lesser species to slaughter innocent Herans in droves.

But Daerokos decides enough is enough!

  • Chapter One will be 64 pages of story
  • You'll dive head-first into Daerokos Galvan's troubled mind as he relates to you the reasons for his strange surroundings and dismal predicament. You'll witness the turmoil that shaped this young man into a living legend.
  • An epic fantasy saga spanning years in the life of our hero; watch him grow and face unbelievable odds with nothing more than his iron will and determination
  • Realize the struggle of Hera's children and its terrifying implications for life on Earth as we know it
  • A hand-crafted world over a decade in-the-making. Hera is an entirely fleshed-out planet!
  • Rife with themes that respectfully utilize speculative history and evolution

Wisdom Comes has sat idle for far too long in my dusty old notebooks, and I want the world to EXPERIENCE this story for themselves!

By backing this book, you'll be proving to the world that small, indie creators like myself can make it in the world of comics with the support of true comics fans like you behind their work!

What We Need & What You Get

  • The main goal is to finalize the artwork and get this story printed and shipped to you ASAP!
  • You'll get the book and any perks you've selected as soon as possible!
  • I will always be available to talk with you if you have questions.

STRETCH GOALS

There are some cool stretch goal ideas, but I will wait to share those until I see them as a possibility (poster tubes for the map, pin-ups by other artists, extra pages of story, etc). Keep your eyes here throughout the campaign!

$7200 - We hire Steve Canon, colorist of "Jack Irons: Steel Cowboy" to color the book! (look at his colors up there! I mean, come on!) --- LOCKED


$7800 - Upgrade to perfect binding! Let's get this book the spine it deserves! --- LOCKED


$9000 - Upgrade cover with slick embossing and UV spot treatment! Custom gold-work feel and a unique textured logo! --- LOCKED

 

$12000 - Hardcover! --- LOCKED

 

$15k - ??? --- LOCKED

 

$20k - ??? --- LOCKED

Risks & Challenges

I pride myself on my customer service skills. 100% transparency all the way. If you ever have a question, you reach out to me personally in any way and I will do whatever I can to help. There is ZERO RISK here because if we don't meet our goal, there will be no book! Simple! Then we'll dust ourselves off and try again! I'm not stopping this train ;)

story:
Story Summary

Marcus Matthews is a private investigator. He's good at what he does. Some even say he's the best. In fact, so lofty is his reputation, the local papers have taken to calling him, "The Great Detective". But don't remind him. He hates it when you call him that...

Marcus has his work cut out for him when he's visited by a desperate widow looking to solve her late husband's death. She claims it's murder, but proof is elusive. And the players involved don't like the kind of questions being asked. 

Follow Marcus on his next adventure as he dives into the seedy world of shadowed stalkers, police informants, and back-alley terrors. Will he have what it takes to solve the case? Can he truly be the Great Detective?      

About Me

Hi. I'm Dennis. Thanks for checking out my campaign.

Great Detective is a character that's been bouncing around my head since I was a kid. He started out as a crude sketch: a man with a fedora and trench coat, peering through a magnifying glass as he followed a trail of muddy footprints. I believe I was six or seven at the time. And for years, that's all he was, a sketch. Just the barest of concepts. But then, three decades later, seemingly out of nowhere, his world sprang to vivid life in my imagination. I just had to get it out. I had to share it with the world! But how to do it? 

Comics are a medium I've loved for years. For as long as I can remember, I wanted to be a comic book creator. Life ultimately had other plans, but that didn't mean I couldn't dabble. In between work, school, and child-rearing, I wrote a script, found an amazing artist, and produced my very own comic book: Great Detective issue #1, which you can get here for free.

Why offer it for free? Well, I'm a realist. Chances are, you don't know me very well. You have no incentive to simply trust that I'll provide you an entertaining story. So, instead of giving you a sales pitch, I'll let the work speak for itself. If you like what you see, donate to the campaign so I can bring you the next chapter of Great Detective.         

What I Need Your Help With

So, as it turns out, dabbling in comics is not cheap, nor should it be. Comic book artists are some of the most talented, hard working people in the creative industry. They are the life blood of this medium, and they deserve to be compensated for their services.

The funds raised by this campaign are almost exclusively for the benefit of the artist. As the creator of Great Detective, my reward is simply seeing the work come to life. My artist, however, still needs to make a living.

In all, I would like to raise $1,200. That's $1,020 to produce the illustrations for Great Detective issue #2, and $180 for any print orders that come in. As I'm lettering the series, there will be no need to pay for a letterer.

That's it! There are no other costs. 

Risks & Challenges

Of course, every venture has its risks. Life happens to all of us. I could be hit by a beer truck tomorrow, and that would be the end of Great Detective. However, barring that worst case scenario, the main risk I foresee is timeliness. I'm a husband, father of four children, I work full-time, and I'm about to start studying for the CPA exam. Any of those factors could interfere with lettering the series. 

My artist is likewise a busy man. Depending on how deep his commission queue is, work on the illustrations may not begin immediately upon funding the issue.

I'm not saying the above scenarios will  happen, but they could. Just want to be up front.       

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute to the campaign, that's perfectly okay. To be honest, I consider it a win that you've read this far.

However, if you would still like to help, please consider sharing my campaign with your friends. Point them to Great Detective issue #1. Share the campaign on Facebook, Twitter, or whatever social media platform you frequent. Word-of-mouth can go a long way.

Thanks again for checking out my campaign.

story:
I’m an artist and published author, with over 40 years experience in Graphic Design, Writing, Illustration, Comic Strips, Cartoons, Photography, Copy Writing, Film Making and Publishing.

‘Hatch’ has been around for many years now and it’s about time he met the rest of the world. Hatch is unique. It’s as simple as that; there are no language barriers with this strip; translated words can change the mood, meaning or substance of any writing. Only ‘sound effects’ are used; there is no dialogue. All Hatch’s adventures can be enjoyed by all peoples in the universe, whatever language(s) they may understand – he’s simply a visual experience. And now, Hatch is finally here, in all his lonely ‘glory’; lost, bewildered and, yeah, amazed.‘Hatch’, however, is not just an ordinary cartoon strip. No, no. Far from it. Hatch is, in fact, a builder, an experimenter and (occasionally) a time traveller and although he is a ‘man’ lost in time and space, his world is not without incident, not without accident and certainly not without meaning. Hatch endures in us all; struggling to come to terms with himself, his world and his universe. A universe he marvels at, embraces and is ultimately frustrated with. 

I’ve kept the ‘perks’ for ‘Hatch’ to a minimum, in an effort to offer more items of quality, to hopefully make Hatch the centre point of the project, rather than just what one can get for making a pledge. The comic edition of ‘Hatch’ comes in at 32 A4 pages all full of humour and amazement (generally his, but hopefully yours too). I am unable to express the magnitude of what achieving the goal of getting Hatch out to the public would mean to me as it lies beyond words, but for that to happen, I need your help not only in pledging but also passing the word around all your friends, family, acquaintances and everyone you know on social media.

I need the money from your generous pledges to realise my dream of publishing ‘Hatch’. In return, you will receive the first edition of the A4, full colour comic BEFORE it appears in any shop or on any shelf.

I need the initial £650 to print the first 200 copies of ‘Hatch’; the more money pledged, the more copies I can have printed, thus bringing the cost per copy down. So with more copies, I can get more into the market place, gaining more exposure, etc. 

Apart from the comic itself, the perks for this campaign boast quite unique items:

I’m offering SIX pages of Original Hatch Artwork from the comic itself, signed and dedicated. The purchase price for these pages has been reduced to £55 for this campaign only.

I’m also offering the chance to own a unique unpublished one page story of Hatch,  a pen and ink (black and white) original Hatch scenario (6 panels maximum) featuring our hero in another impossible situation, produced for the person making this pledge! This offer is unlimited and so I hope to be drawing them for weeks on end!

The final ‘perk’ is the best one of them all: The ULTIMATE Hatch: A HUNDRED PAGE, A5, bound art book containing literally HUNDREDS of NEW, never seen before sketches of our hero! Signed and dedicated, of course. Also, this pledge offers a one hour Skype call with anyone interested in speaking to me about Hatch or anything else they want to chat about! This perk is a ‘one shot’ - an exclusive art book offered to the ‘Hatch’ connoisseur – signed, sealed and delivered with ultimate care!

This is a rare chance to make a difference in the comic and publishing world; to own a copy of the most unique cartoon character to appear in many, many  years. You can be at the beginning of the adventure, the beginning of a series of works that will make a tremendous impact on comics in general and storytelling in particular.

I have published many comics over the last four decades, largely featuring my own characters and their conflicts. Last year I produced the documentary film  ‘Jack Kirby : A Personal Journey’, which featured 30 minutes of unseen and therefore exclusive footage of myself talking to the comics legend in his own home. (This film is still available on DVD, so get in touch if you wish to purchase a copy!) Comics are in my blood; in the 80s and 90s I illustrated several licensed characters for Egmont Publishing (Gutenberg House), as well as being the regular artist on Harrier Comics’ series ‘Forest’. I published, edited and co-wrote ‘Crikey! The Great British Comics Magazine’ amongst other periodicals. I am currently working on two illustrated science fiction novels.

I want to make Hatch ‘real’ - to get him out into the public domain for all to see and enjoy. You can help me to do that and for that I (and Hatch) would be truly grateful.

The general Risks & Challenges to projects like this one are hardly unique, and I have identified the three stages to this project.

Stage 1: I have produced all of the artwork for the comic. The stories have been illustrated and coloured. 

Stage 2: This is where you come in: the funds to get Hatch into print. This sounds the simplest of the stages, but is, in fact, the most challenging.

Stage 3: To get Hatch into the shops and the publics hands. Without the physical copy, this, of course, cannot be achieved.

In summary, stage two is the greatest challenge; without those funds stage three becomes redundant and stage one pointless.

I believe I am more than qualified to overcome all the challenges set before the realisation of Hatch, except for stage two. Simply put, I need your help; I can communicate with people on the telephone, via email and on social media. That is the easy part of the project and therefore I cannot emphasise the importance of your pledges.

The word is already out in the public domain; people from England to the United States to Australia to Thailand are asking me daily about ‘Hatch’; when is he ‘out’; when can they see him; when and where can they purchase this first edition. Hatch already has a considerable following. That said, and with your help, I can spread the word further, get those extra pledges, make this happen in a big way. I plan to advertise the book, call people via the telephone, on email and in social media. Comics websites, podcasts, radio and possibly TV appearances are in the plan.

I’d also like to engage those people who can't contribute financially, but still want this campaign to achieve its goals: simply tell everyone about Hatch. Tell your family and friends to their faces and on all your social media outlets. Show people your interest, get the word out and make some noise about my campaign; tell everyone, use social media outlets like Facebook, Twitter, Instagram - you name it! I would be most grateful for any help you can give me. Also, don’t forget to use the Indiegogo share tools!

#HatchIsHere #HatchAtLast #HIH #HAL
story_txt:
I’m an artist and published author, with over 40 years experience in Graphic Design, Writing, Illustration, Comic Strips, Cartoons, Photography, Copy Writing, Film Making and Publishing.

‘Hatch’ has been around for many years now and it’s about time he met the rest of the world. Hatch is unique. It’s as simple as that; there are no language barriers with this strip; translated words can change the mood, meaning or substance of any writing. Only ‘sound effects’ are used; there is no dialogue. All Hatch’s adventures can be enjoyed by all peoples in the universe, whatever language(s) they may understand – he’s simply a visual experience. And now, Hatch is finally here, in all his lonely ‘glory’; lost, bewildered and, yeah, amazed.‘Hatch’, however, is not just an ordinary cartoon strip. No, no. Far from it. Hatch is, in fact, a builder, an experimenter and (occasionally) a time traveller and although he is a ‘man’ lost in time and space, his world is not without incident, not without accident and certainly not without meaning. Hatch endures in us all; struggling to come to terms with himself, his world and his universe. A universe he marvels at, embraces and is ultimately frustrated with. 

I’ve kept the ‘perks’ for ‘Hatch’ to a minimum, in an effort to offer more items of quality, to hopefully make Hatch the centre point of the project, rather than just what one can get for making a pledge. The comic edition of ‘Hatch’ comes in at 32 A4 pages all full of humour and amazement (generally his, but hopefully yours too). I am unable to express the magnitude of what achieving the goal of getting Hatch out to the public would mean to me as it lies beyond words, but for that to happen, I need your help not only in pledging but also passing the word around all your friends, family, acquaintances and everyone you know on social media.
I need the money from your generous pledges to realise my dream of publishing ‘Hatch’. In return, you will receive the first edition of the A4, full colour comic BEFORE it appears in any shop or on any shelf.

I need the initial £650 to print the first 200 copies of ‘Hatch’; the more money pledged, the more copies I can have printed, thus bringing the cost per copy down. So with more copies, I can get more into the market place, gaining more exposure, etc. 
Apart from the comic itself, the perks for this campaign boast quite unique items:
I’m offering SIX pages of Original Hatch Artwork from the comic itself, signed and dedicated. The purchase price for these pages has been reduced to £55 for this campaign only.

I’m also offering the chance to own a unique unpublished one page story of Hatch,  a pen and ink (black and white) original Hatch scenario (6 panels maximum) featuring our hero in another impossible situation, produced for the person making this pledge! This offer is unlimited and so I hope to be drawing them for weeks on end!
The final ‘perk’ is the best one of them all: The ULTIMATE Hatch: A HUNDRED PAGE, A5, bound art book containing literally HUNDREDS of NEW, never seen before sketches of our hero! Signed and dedicated, of course. Also, this pledge offers a one hour Skype call with anyone interested in speaking to me about Hatch or anything else they want to chat about! This perk is a ‘one shot’ - an exclusive art book offered to the ‘Hatch’ connoisseur – signed, sealed and delivered with ultimate care!
This is a rare chance to make a difference in the comic and publishing world; to own a copy of the most unique cartoon character to appear in many, many  years. You can be at the beginning of the adventure, the beginning of a series of works that will make a tremendous impact on comics in general and storytelling in particular.
I have published many comics over the last four decades, largely featuring my own characters and their conflicts. Last year I produced the documentary film  ‘Jack Kirby : A Personal Journey’, which featured 30 minutes of unseen and therefore exclusive footage of myself talking to the comics legend in his own home. (This film is still available on DVD, so get in touch if you wish to purchase a copy!) Comics are in my blood; in the 80s and 90s I illustrated several licensed characters for Egmont Publishing (Gutenberg House), as well as being the regular artist on Harrier Comics’ series ‘Forest’. I published, edited and co-wrote ‘Crikey! The Great British Comics Magazine’ amongst other periodicals. I am currently working on two illustrated science fiction novels.
I want to make Hatch ‘real’ - to get him out into the public domain for all to see and enjoy. You can help me to do that and for that I (and Hatch) would be truly grateful.
The general Risks & Challenges to projects like this one are hardly unique, and I have identified the three stages to this project.
Stage 1: I have produced all of the artwork for the comic. The stories have been illustrated and coloured. 
Stage 2: This is where you come in: the funds to get Hatch into print. This sounds the simplest of the stages, but is, in fact, the most challenging.
Stage 3: To get Hatch into the shops and the publics hands. Without the physical copy, this, of course, cannot be achieved.
In summary, stage two is the greatest challenge; without those funds stage three becomes redundant and stage one pointless.

I believe I am more than qualified to overcome all the challenges set before the realisation of Hatch, except for stage two. Simply put, I need your help; I can communicate with people on the telephone, via email and on social media. That is the easy part of the project and therefore I cannot emphasise the importance of your pledges.
The word is already out in the public domain; people from England to the United States to Australia to Thailand are asking me daily about ‘Hatch’; when is he ‘out’; when can they see him; when and where can they purchase this first edition. Hatch already has a considerable following. That said, and with your help, I can spread the word further, get those extra pledges, make this happen in a big way. I plan to advertise the book, call people via the telephone, on email and in social media. Comics websites, podcasts, radio and possibly TV appearances are in the plan.
I’d also like to engage those people who can't contribute financially, but still want this campaign to achieve its goals: simply tell everyone about Hatch. Tell your family and friends to their faces and on all your social media outlets. Show people your interest, get the word out and make some noise about my campaign; tell everyone, use social media outlets like Facebook, Twitter, Instagram - you name it! I would be most grateful for any help you can give me. Also, don’t forget to use the Indiegogo share tools!
#HatchIsHere #HatchAtLast #HIH #HAL

story:
What is DISPLACED?

Imagine. Imagine getting the escape you have dreamed of. To be swept off your feet and taken on a grand journey with no limits. No restrictions, living the life you want and not the life that had been handed to you. This isn’t that story… This story is the worst possible version of that. Getting swept off your feet to be taken on a death trip, never knowing that you will get to go home, to see your family. Forced to make decisions that will traumatize and make you the worst version of yourself. This is that story.  

I have always dreamed of that escape from reality, going on a journey bigger than my mind could handle. I wanted to tell a tale that played on that idea. A journey bigger than you can handle and realizing that you don't want it, and you are stuck with it till the end.

This is the first part of a 5 Issue story following the journey of Eliza! 

This Campaign is to fund printing of #1, All 19 pages of which are already completed!

What are people saying about DISPLACED?

 

“Displaced hits all the right notes of a great first issue. It provides a solid background without delaying the action. It leaves enough mystery to leave us wanting more.”

-For The Love of Indie

           3.5/5

“This book is a very solid outing. The setup is great; Getting to see the family life is a great way for the readers to feel the shock of the forthcoming events”

  -Comic Crusaders

           9.5/10

“This story is amazingly smooth. Every moment feels like a natural course of events (even the unexpected ones) “

-Chico Comics Page

5 Page Preview

What is the story?

Eliza is a 17-year-old high school girl. Living day by day just making it through, making sure her little brother Jonathan is safe from the shocking realization that their parents are getting a divorce.  

 

The story starts off with Eliza waking up in her room and realizing that something is not right. Of all the days this one is one that seems out of place. Her dad hadn't come home, and her mother is doing the best she can. Jon confronts Eliza about the fact that their father hadn't returned and doesn't understand why they fight all the time. Eliza' world gets flipped when a mysterious woman in a robotic suit tries to get her to come with her saying that she is in danger. The story picks up from here and trouble ensues.

 

Who is The Creative Team?

Writer & Creator - Kevin Hamilton

This is Kevin Hamilton' writing debut! He has a love for writing short stories and has never really messed with writing comics before but has always had a love. He is working on a short story that he has submitted to the Alterna IF Horror Anthology and will have news soon! Displaced is his top priority and is in it for the long haul!

Artist - Jeferson Sadzinski 

Jeferson is a master class artist! I have known him for about a year and has only put out his best work every time. He is a one man army on DISPLACED taking care of the Pencils, Inks and Colors! He puts so much detail into his work! you will love it!

 

Letterer - Toben Racicot (letterdrone.artstation.com)

Toben is a hard working letterer doing tremendous work for the Independent comic community. I am glad to have such a skilled and great guy to my team! 

Cover Artist - Chris Shehan (http://zhourulesart.blogspot.co.uk/)

Chris Shehan is an amazing artist from El Paso, Texas. He was a finalist in the 2017 Ghost City Comics competition with the one-shot crime comic DEADBEAT (collaborating with writer Jed McPherson) and is also the interior artist of PROMETHEUS. He has also done work for Cody Sousas Croak Comic, and is the Cover artist for RED WINTER #1, all of which are Successful Kickstarters!

What are the Rewards?

-PDF Copy of DISPLACED Left To Die

-Physical Copy of DISPLACED Left To Die with Cover A by Chris Shehan

-Sticker Pack Consisting of 4 different stickers inspired by the Art is DISPLACED.

-Physical Copy of DISPLACED Left To Die with Cover B by Andrew Southern

-Displaced Poster (By Francesco Laquinta)

-Displaced Pin

Risks and challenges

Any risk in this project is extremely minimal. All 19 pages of #1 are already complete and ready to go to print. We just need the money from the campaign to fund the first print run.

The service I am using to print is very close to where I live. Therefore I don't foresee any issues having all the rewards out to backers as early as August.

 

How can YOU help?

There are Many ways you can help! This isn't the last campaign we will do! So you can go follow us on Twitter at either @ImaKevin @DisplacedComic or @DotteComics to keep up to date with this, or future projects. You can help by sharing the project to friends. Or you can help by grabbing you a copy! The only way we are successful is if we work TOGETHER to help get this funded!

story:
One of the first creative things I ever wanted to do for my friends, was to animate their dreams or nightmares. Since moving away from animation and into comics, and working with so many talented creators, it only made sense to do this book.

story:
THE STORY

Loon Long time ago we bumped into some guy in a cosplay suit right on a street, we took some pix with experimental lighting and got totally awesome results on postpro. 

Vasily: At this point I realized that this is bigger than just a single work, it is a series.

Alex: When we proceeded, it became obvious that this even bigger than a series, it’s a f@ing franchise!

ABOUT

Superhero Landing is a social-media series, designed for the most popular platforms such as Instagram and YouTube. We are combining photography and text to express our vision, and merging multiple formats to create a modern comic content.

THE IMPACT

At this moment, on our own, we can produce only one episode per three and a half months, mostly because of funding. Obviously this is not the way for SL or for Instagram or YouTube subscribers for that matter. Our goal is to bring the entire universe to “the big screens” and we asking you to help us at the start.

With your help we will be able to speed up tremendously (up to one episode per month), enrich our project with original music, graphics, and special effects, collaborate with other artists to expand our vision. 

Our mission is to raise the bar in every aspect that we could. We are certain that even a periodical content created for social media can be as good as top studio blockbuster.

THE COAST

Vasily: Better not to publish anything than to publish a mediocrity just to keep it going.  

Producing high-quality content such as SL ain’t cheap, and it takes a lot of time.

Here are some examples: write a script or at least a draft, choose a location, obtain all required permissions, set up a casting call, make sure all talents are dressed properly (find/buy/rent/fit), don’t forget about props, actual shooting (principal photography), postproduction (a lot a lot of time), some legal work and publishing.

Of course all of this requires money: staff are on the clock, venue fee, equipment (all we need to rent, buy or make to achieve our creative goals), transportation and other direct production expenses. Also there are some indirect expenses, e.g.: future productions, development, and organizational costs, so that we could grow and create even more awesome content in the nearest future.

What does high quality mean on the money side?

It means that not every shooting will be published, this bringing up the average (per episode production coasts). This mean also that sometimes we might need to add some new scenes or re-shoot the existing ones, — all of this is being perfectly normal for any good production studio in the world. 

How much money do we really need?

We are aiming for 32-35k, that will give us the ability to achieve our creative goals and maintain our standards. We are certainly against selling out for cheap ads and silly product placement.

FYI We will be able to receive only 70% of raised funds as a result of platform/transaction fees and taxes.

How money will be spent?

Money will be spent directly to cover up production costs, and if any left, — to increase our productivity as organization. 

How many people are working on this project?

Only two people currently working on the project. In order to execute our concept in full, we certainly need more than that. Enriching project with talented people is our top priority. With additional funding we will be able to hire more staff and keep our focus on the creative part.

THE TEAM

We make a great team together!

Alex has over a decade experience in commercial photography. It is his true passion, — he loves it and obsessed by it. Also he is a quick learner, and almost 7ft tall. 

Vasily comes from marketing field, with genuine interest in photography and style. He loves to write, create and make things better.

Take a look: 

Superhero Landing: Episode has No Name (Pilot) [WATCH NOW]

For better user experience we recommend to use the Instagram App for that.

THE LINKS

Explore Superhero Landing Universe at Fandom!

If you have any questions about our campaign, feel free to ask us here.

If you like to support our project in any other way, please let us know here. 

Excited about what we up to? Spread the word! We will appreciate it!

It will really help us out if you use Indiegogo share tools for that.

You can give us fantastic support by following: 

Our Instagram

Our Facebook

And of course we love to hear what you think, so don’t be shy and comment.)

Thank You for your Time and Support!

SL Team

He loves to write, create and make things better.Take a look: Superhero Landing: Episode has No Name (Pilot) [WATCH NOW]For better user experience we recommend to use the Instagram App for that.THE LINKSExplore Superhero Landing Universe at Fandom!If you have any questions about our campaign, feel free to ask us here.If you like to support our project in any other way, please let us know here. Excited about what we up to? Spread the word! We will appreciate it!It will really help us out if you use Indiegogo share tools for that.You can give us fantastic support by following: Our InstagramOur FacebookAnd of course we love to hear what you think, so don’t be shy and comment.)Thank You for your Time and Support!SL Team

story:
What is ImpStory?

ImpStory is a graphic novel (planned to be the first in a series) written and drawn by myself (Cody Baier) with artistic collaborator Victor Neumann. Striving to be a departure from the typical fantasy story, ImpStory features an atypical cast of characters in an adventure that spans across several different worlds. Familiar fantasy races and monsters are depicted in unique ways, and our heroes will face off against completely new and original foes (as opposed to the typical goblins/skeletons/etc. one would find in your average fantasy tale). 

The art of ImpStory also takes a novel approach, as Victor does not simply color my artwork. Rather, the art of the comic is a true collaboration, where I draw the initial version of the page, and Victor adds to it before finishing the colors, in order to truly combine our individual artistic strengths to create a more visually engaging experience.

The Premise

Within the great cosmic tree of the Sephirot, the universe is in turmoil. Twenty years ago, the Demons--long exiled to the hellish realm of Qliphoth for the nature of their creation--stormed the realm of the gods, led by a being known only by what they called him; "Demonlord". This Demonlord not only slew the entire pantheon, but did so effortlessly, leaving the entire Sephirot without divine rule or guidance. Nothing to protect the countless worlds within it from the Demons' cosmic crusade.

Before she was struck down, the goddess of creation Cerenis did as she always had when the universe faced a dire threat; she sent her blessings, which would find newborns destined to be exceptional people, and deem them as Chosen Ones. But with the gods long dead, when the Chosen Ones discovered what they were, they ignored the calling. 

All except one: a Shadow Imp mage named Zippit.

Having spent years travelling to many worlds through the Starways, using his immense magical powers to help others, Zippit alone decided to answer the call--gods or no--and see what he could do to help. In order to learn what he can do as a Chosen, he must seek out the Cosmic Scribes; keepers of all the universe's knowledge, and former wards to the gods.

Sample Pages

The Characters

A wandering Shadow Imp possessing incredible magical power (which he attributes to the teachings of his Master, whom he adores). Zippit's magical prowess is matched only by his motormouth, especially when gleefully sharing his magical knowledge with others. Not wanting for more than just good times and good company, Zippit travels from country to country, world to world, using his powers to help those in need. Upon discovering he is one of the Chosen, he's the only one to heed the call despite the death of the gods.

Zippit's apprentice, a former guard captain (and mercenary before that) looking to become a spellblade. An experienced warrior and tactician, as well as someone to rein Zippit in when he starts getting a little too excited and long-winded. Laurence holds a great deal of respect for Zippit's selflessness and magical abilities, though he harbors secret, more selfish reasons for following the Shadow Imp. Reasons fueled by revenge...

Daughter of a Cosmic Scribe, Ingrid is a scholar who's as beautiful as she is book smart, though her street smarts are severely lacking. Shortly after the Demonlord killed the Gods, her Scribe father left under mysterious circumstances, and never returned. Before he left, he gave her a living tome, calling itself "Nac," which seems to hold all the knowledge one could ever want to know, but cannot answer questions directly. Using Nac's clues, Ingrid has embarked on a search to find the Cosmic Scribes' keep (somewhere her father never let her see), and learn the truth about what happened to her father.

A charismatic young Vampire noble from the Monsterman nation of Allhallow. While Morticof weilds considerable power as a Vampire, it pales in comparison to his powers as a mage. Though he's only versed in water magic, his power and skill in the oceanic arts is unmatched, even by Zippit. Initially offering to help Zippit and his companions as a favor, Morticof quickly finds himself compelled to accompany the Imp on his quest by the allure of a grand adventure, something his drab life of politics and privilege has made him yearn for.

A captain in the Demon army, Sarona is a force to be reckoned with. Possessing not only superhuman strength, but a host of strange and formidable abilities. Having experience the hell of Qliphoth in her early childhood, she grew up especially enamored with the Demonlord, viewing him as a savior much in the way most other Demons do. Also like most Demons, she grew up with stories of the ruthless and self-destructive humans and Monstermen living in the Sephirot. Sarona has lived most of her life as a true believer in the Demonlord's cause, but perhaps that could change...

No one knows where he came from. No one knows where he got his power. He appeared in Qliphoth one day as if by a miracle. He brought the Demons safety from the horrors that lurk there, and security under his rule. He is known only by the title they gave him: Demonlord. He came to the Demons offering them salvation from the gods, and the bounties of beautiful homeworlds once only afforded to the denizens of the Sephirot. To the wide-eyed amazement of the Demon hordes, he slaughtered the gods one by one without an ounce of effort. Now he has set his sights on worlds he deems fit more for Demonkind than mankind. The only hope the people have lies in the knowledge that though he cannot be defeated, he can be sealed away. Though how long this will last is anyone's guess, as rumors have spread that he is only getting stronger...

What We Need & What You Get

They money raised by this campaign will go into funding a print run of the comic, setting up an avenue for future printings of the comic (we do not want this to be a limited run just for backers, we want people to be able to buy copies at any point in the future), and toward Victor and myself so that we can work on this comic full-time. Should we exceed our initial goal, additional funding will go toward stretch goals, which are to be determined at this time. Should we not reach full funding, the book will still be developed, though distribution plans may change (and, of course, production will be much slower).

The Impact

Since I was a small child, it's been my dream to make comics. Creating worlds and characters, then telling their story with my art, has been my singular passion for most of my life. From drawing comics in marker on construction paper and stapling them together, all the way to pursuing a career in self-publishing comics of my own. Now, I come to you folks to help realize my dream. I've teamed up with a colossally talented artist to make this book as great as I can make it, and worth every penny you're willing to give.

But this isn't just about me, it's about you; the audience. I can't ask you to fund a book without making it worth your while, after all. I'm offering you a compelling story, with memorable characters, a unique setting to be immersed in, and some damn fine art (which wouldn't be possible without Victor).

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge we face is simple: time and money. Victor and I both have our obligations, our bills to pay, clients to draw for, and even our own personal side projects. However, with your help and enough funding, we can devote the necessary time and resources toward making and distributing ImpStory, possibly even giving us the opportunity to bring you other titles in the future!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't donate to the campaign, but you want to help, there's still plenty you can do! Word-of-Mouth is incredibly important to independent creators, so spread the word! Be sure to link to the ImpStory IndieGogo page on social media, or just tell your friends! Every little bit counts. Even if you only tell one person you know, that's one more person who may be able to contribute to the project, and we appreciate each and every one of you.
